title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (Commack, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Quick phone interview with nurse recruiter and then scheduled interview with nurse leader. After interview with nurse leader, met with staff nurse who brought me around the unit. Heard from HR after a few days.
Interview Questions: When did you go above and beyond?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: One interview. HR and Manager were in the interview. Very welcoming and excited to speak to me. Just read through parts of my resume and made me explain each experience.
Interview Questions: Please tell me about yourself

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Interview consists of behavioral questions and hiring managers will be listening for very specific examples. They will do their best to weed out generalities like “I would do x” and instead want to hear “In this situation I did these specific things and the outcome was _”.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you made a mistake at work.

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward. One interview before receiving an offer, but I had interned at MSK the summer prior. The interview questions were standard and the two individuals who I met with were nice.
Interview Questions: What was one thing you received criticism on in a previous role

title: Research Regulatory Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward: an interview with the regulatory manager and the clinical research manager. 2 weeks wait, and then a response from HR. Process length depends on the urgency. May take longer or less time to hear back from HR.
Interview Questions: - Tell me about yourself - Explain a situation when you had a conflict at work and how you handled it. - Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: They asked a lot of situation/example based questions. If we prepare well you will do well. Make sure you think of examples of past positions that you can apply to team based situations, issues, etc
Interview Questions: Describe a time that there was a conflict between you another employee and how was it solved.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I had multiple interviews and a group or panel interview. There was a long turnaround time from the interview to the offer to onboarding stage. Overall it was a positive experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you received developmental feedback...

title: HR Business Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Kept waiting for an exploratory . Rude recruiter who didn’t even shake my hand hello when I put it out. Bothered that they were interviewing me. Passed me to another recruiter who proceeded to divulge inappropriate information about a separation package she once received. A truly unprofessional experience.
Interview Questions: There were no openings. Was exploratory but would never work for this team.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: They call you and you get a call from HR. After you pass the first round interview, they will tell you about the second round interview in which you go in front a bunch of people for an interview. Once you pass that you do orientation.
Interview Questions: why MSK? What are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Summer Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: First, a group Zoom meeting and then wait for email for you are fit and if you got selected you will receive an individual video interview with some behaviour questions only
Interview Questions: What is a challenge you face

title: Medical Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: It was okay. They asked a lot of scenario questions and wanted examples so have responses prepared! They were friendly but it seems like they want people with years of experience
Interview Questions: Questions that are scenario based

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Friendly! Super helpful. The person I spoke to was very nice and very insightful about the interview process and starting the new position. I appreciated speaking with them very much.
Interview Questions: What areas in nursing interest you.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the Team basic question about my past research experience and why I wanted to join their lab. Also asked about lab culture and specific questions pertaining to their lab.
Interview Questions: Q: Why do you want to join our lab Q: Give me an example of a time you worked on a project independently Q: How long are you trying to stay in this position Q: What are your long term goals (i.e. PHD, Masters, or MD)

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Contacted via email by HR first. First "screening" interview with PI of lab, invited to a second interview with lab members at the facility to see if I was a good fit, and then third-follow up interview the next day with PI.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself Have you read any of our papers Why do you want to join this lab

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I had an interview with the unit nurse leader and charge nurse. They are very welcoming and friendly. I had a great experience! I got to have a tour of the unit as well!
Interview Questions: Why did you choose nursing as your career?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: The staff was super friendly and the whole interview process went smoothly. I was able to take a tour of the unit. They asked me why nursing, tell us more about you previous experience.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply you MSK?

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went by very quickly and smoothly. I was contacted 2 hours after applying. I then scheduled a zoom information session with my recruiter. I did a phone screening interview the same week and got moved on to the next round. In total there were 3 interviews. The second interview was with the Assistant Manager and Team Lead.  My last interview was with the Doctor. They do ask a lot of situational questions so think of previous work-related experiences and practice answering in STAR format. Overall I had a great experience. Everyone was extremely nice and the process went smoothly.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at MSK?

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Horrible. It is too structured & a lot of good candidates are passed up. I understand most of the basic questions for an interview, but to interview someone and only look to see if they have what it take is not favorable. Just because you graduate college doesnt make you a great fit for the job
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you weren't successful and how did you handle it .

title: CORE Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: There was one phone screen with an HR representative and then three interviews with the physicians who work in the CORE. Standard questions about experience, the role, and future career goals.
Interview Questions: What would make you a good fit for this role? How comfortable are you with managing financials?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: There are 4 rounds of interviews for IHCD service. First with the manager, second with RPA, third with PI, and last with the language manager. The last one is to assess language fluency. I've heard some employees also interviewed with IHCD director but that was not my experience.
Interview Questions: what are 3 words your coworkers would use to describe you?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Overall very conversational. Everyone was super nice and no one tried to throw any curveballs or tried to make me look bad or panic. As long as you know what you are talking about with respect to their lab you should be all good
Interview Questions: I was asked about the papers the lab has published (what they were about and what conclusions the paper came to) as well as some behavioral questions like how i find value in the tasks I am given

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter called and asked me a few questions in regard to the role. From there she let me know that I would be moving forward in the process and then suggested we discuss salary.
Interview Questions: They asked me why I was interested in moving into a research role and how my experience contributes to the role.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Interview was multiple rounds with multiple members of the team. I got all the way to the interview with the PI but ultimately got rejected. One interview did mention the job was a min of 9 to 5.
Interview Questions: How would you describe changing priorities

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Zoom interview All of their questions followed the STAR framework For instance: Tell me about a time when… What do you do when… Have you ever… Give me an example of… Describe a situation…
Interview Questions: Describe a situation when you made a mistake at work and how you handled it

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with Human Resources, followed by interviews with management and then HR in person or zoom. One final interview and online reference requests to at least three different people.
Interview Questions: STAR interview questions that were tailored to Rehab

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: As soon as the phone interview process began it was doomed. She had no interest no energy. It’s like I was on the list and it needed to get done. Shame because I would have loved a real shot.
Interview Questions: What can your skills bring to this company?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Email contact via HR. First virtual invitation for interview with the Private Investigator. Then in person Interview with entire lab members, then final follow up interview with PI asking about interaction with lab members.
Interview Questions: Did you like research? How/Why?

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for the periop 101 program and the interview lasted about 20 -30 minutes. Interviewed with a Charge Nurse and Nurse Manager. They asked me about my professional background and why I was interested in the OR. They also told me about the position and what to expect (3 year commitment, 4x10s and no weekends). After, the Nurse manager said I should hear back from HR in two weeks.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? Why are you interested in the operating room?

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: I was called for a screening interview and then scheduled a virtual interview. I then had a virtual interview with 2 interviewers. Scheduling was painless and the process was smooth
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself Why MSK Why OR Favorite clinical experience from nursing school Favorite TV show, movie, or book

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: In person interview, interview was a little late but I was constantly updated/checked on so still very professional. Great energy and manager was incredibly warm. Interview was about 40 minutes and I was given a tour of the unit after it was finished. Overall a very positive experience
Interview Questions: Why MSKCC and how did you decide on nursing?

title: Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Took 2 months to go through three rounds of interview. It's a very long process. First phone interview and staff interview, supervisor and then med directors. Asked all kind of standard and behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you have difficulty working with others

title: Summer Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Dr Paul Booth made me feel wonderfully comfortable and was incredibly supportive. It was great to have an interviewer who genuinely wants to mold a young professional well and help them succeed in the future.
Interview Questions: Technical and personality gauging questions.

title: Research Regulatory Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: The entire process was pleasant and fast. Met with 4 different people in the department, including staff, managers and the PI in the span of 2 weeks. Smooth and fast process. It was intense but enjoyable process.
Interview Questions: What is your strength and weakness?

title: SKI Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward interview process. I was an internal candidate. I met with PI's and discussed the role duties and my experience. The only thing that took awhile was the transfer to the department after I received an offer.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict? How do you stay organized?

title: Paralegal Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online.  Two months later, I received a call from a recruiter, who was very nice on the phone.  The recruiter presented the facts of the position to me and asked me if I wanted to continue with the interviewing process.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation if two attorneys provided two different ways to handle a transaction?

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: easy interview. typical star questions. everyone was nice and made me feel comfortable- felt like they really wanted to get to know me. talked to recruiter and then other people
Interview Questions: why do you want to work at MSK

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions:
It was smooth.
Two rounds of interview one being a fully technical round with lots of coding problems.
Other round was also Technical with some behavioral round. 
And final was team interview.
Interview Questions: Leet code medium questions should be enough.

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Lovely great happy with the process. They were kind and polite. They really cared about getting to know me. It was really phenomenal. I wanted to stay and chat more with all of the interviewers.
Interview Questions: What are my Strengths and weaknesses

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Very detailed process. It included the STAR method - Interviewers discussed this in the beginning of the interview. Unfortunately, I ended up declining the role and going with a different offer.
Interview Questions: What are three weaknesses you have?

title: Marketing Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted to set up a virtual interview and had to first send in a writing sample with an up-to-date resume The interview was 45-60 minutes with a few people of the team I would be working with. I heard back within a week or two
Interview Questions: How would people around you describe you when you are not there?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: There was a presentation  to hiring manager + team and then three interviews with executive leadership.  The first interview was virtual with team, subsequent interviews were on site.  The presentation consisted of answering predetermined questions.
Interview Questions: Name a time you worked on a project and it didn’t work out.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applied online 2 weeks later received an emailed to set up interview with hiring manager following week interview with peers said HR will reach out waited about 4 weeks and received a email for reference and then came the offer letter
Interview Questions:
Why MSK ?
Tell me about a time when you went above and beyond for a patient?
What can you bring to the team ?
What makes you unique?

title: Patient Navigator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Approached by a recruiter, applied, had a phone screening interview  for about 20-30 minutes and then was invited for an in-person interview.  From applying to job offer, the application process took about 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: How would your peers and co-workers describe you?

title: Animal Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applied online , got a call by recruiter, then was supposed to meet with hiring managers, Overall the process is quick and easy, They are flexible , especially since the pandemic.
Interview Questions: Why do you wanna be a animal tech ?

title: Nurse Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Easy and just a simple conversation to get to know you and if you really want to work in the field. I also thought it was very easy and to the point. The interviewer were nice.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself ?

title: Bioinformatics Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: After applying got an HR call, then got a zoom HR screening Then met my current supervisor, and talked about my goals and what the supervisor wants of the position Then had a meeting that involved solving some genomic problems and coding interview as well After that presented my research to the team Then I got an offer letter
Interview Questions: Program a well known machine learning algorithm of their choosing in a language of my choosing. Codes were shared through something like a synced VScode.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions:
Not exactly sure if this counts, as I apparently didn't even make it past the phone call with the recruiter.

But anyway, I received a phone call from an internal recruiter shortly after applying. She screened me and assured me that multiple departments would be interested. A day or so later, she sent me an email assuring me that a specific person would be contacting me soon to schedule an interview.

After a week or so of waiting for that person to contact me, I contacted the recruiter to let them know. The recruiter answered days later saying that the director who was supposed to contact me was just out of office and assured me not to worry. Again, she assured me that multiple departments wanted to speak to me. 

After a week and still no contact from that department, I checked the job listing to see that it had been filled and the position was closed. 

Obviously, these positions are competitive and people are busy, but the experience wasn't great. I have volunteered for this hospital before, so this isn't the first time I've been entangled in an interdepartmental communication lapse. It's all honestly turned me off from this hospital completely.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my future plans, time commitments--things of that sort.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions:
3 rounds of interviews 
First round by manager
Second round by the director, 4 teams at different time slots 
Third round - lab test experiment and calculations in person  

Remaining  rounds on zoom

They gave a lab tour too
Interview Questions: Goals, weakness,strength , ambition, work culture

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with multiple departments many times never received formal job offer. Interviews were virtual through zoom due to pandemic. Managers very nice and accommodating/ flexible with interview scheduling. Pleasant experience overall.
Interview Questions: What makes you a good candidate for this position?

title: Office Coordinator Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was smooth and simple. The directions to the virtual interview was very clear and easy to navigate. Interviews made me feel comfortable and made sure they gave me a chance to gather my thoughts before answering.
Interview Questions: Give an example of how you assisted a patient.

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Never made it to the interview round because of the timed coding challenge. The instructions said I can choose any programming language but that was true of only 2/3 of the questions. The 3rd was Java only.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very tedious but rewarding. They ask many situation based questions, so it would be helpful to have that prepared. They want as much detail as possible. It is a little nerve wrecking but it is a great way to think outside of the box about your answers.
Interview Questions: Think of a time you had a difficult encounter with a patient. How did you handle it and were you satisfied with the outcome?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: The nurse manager provided an overview of the floor. Then they asked me some questions. Told me they would reach out to the recruiter. Received an offer from HR in the next 2 weeks.
Interview Questions:
- Tell me about yourself. 
- What are your strengths?
- What makes a good nurse?

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: 1 interview where they asked technical and behavioral questions. Most of the questions were pretty standard although some were a little more challenging. Interviewers took notes as you answered the questions.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you failed

title: Clinical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Zoom interview with 2 nurses and 1 NP. They went over the structure of the program and then asked me questions (some below). The experience was pretty friendly and conversational.
Interview Questions:
Why oncology nursing?
What has been your favorite clinical so far?
Tell me about a time you had to resolve a conflict.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Four virtual interviews in total - two with the hiring manager and two with senior leadership.  One HR conversation to confirm qualifications.  Asked insightful questions, and was focused primarily on interpersonal and leadership skills.
Interview Questions: How have you dealt with difficult employees?

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
Completed a total of 4 interviews, all participants were very, kind, respectful, and professionally detailed. 

Everything was executed in a timely and professional manner.   Interview process was all virtual due to the pandemic. 

My impression of the process and institution was that of a group of talented and caring medical professionals with a familial company culture.
Interview Questions: Can you think of a time you had a significant challenge, either personal or professional, and how did you overcome it?

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with several staff members and the manager.  Most of the questions came from one guy, who had a heavy accent.  I found him to be a very nasty and disrespectful person.
Interview Questions: The interviewer asked relatively simple questions.  Even through my answers were correct (and I doubled checked my answers after the interview), he kept saying, "You're wrong! and "You don't know anything!"

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Laid back, easy going, they didn’t ask too hard of questions and I felt like they we’re looking for someone who was a team player. There were 2 people interviewing
Interview Questions: Q: What is your proudest accomplishment and why

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions:
The interview consisted of a bombardment of extremely specific technical questions about their specific stack and abstract CS concepts. There was no portion of the interview where I wrote any code. The interview didn't start with any introductions or more general questions, and at the end I was not prompted to ask the interviewers any questions.

Both interviewers had their video turned off on the video call. They were rude, arrogant, and impatient. I got the impression that they did not want to be doing the interview and that they did not respect me or my time.

Not a good experience. If I'd gotten an offer, I'm not sure if I would've accepted it.
Interview Questions: Explain the differences between an array, stack, and queue.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: I got a phone call from a recruiter with some pre-screening questions. I got invited the first interview within a week. I got invited back to the second interview within a week. Lastly, I got an offer the week after the second interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Back in 2017, interview consisted of a phone screen, then a zoom interview, then a onsite interview with one of the assistant managers and the assistant managers manager.  After that I call a call at the end of the week from HR offering me the job.
Interview Questions:
Name a situation when you went above and beyond
What are your weaknesses?

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: A quick process, very positive interactions with internal recruiter and hiring managers. Started with a quick phone screen and one meeting with hiring managers. Received an offer a few days later.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you went above and beyond

title: PCA II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Very quick and to the point to be honest. They speed it up to where it’s a little hard to think but overall very understanding of the questions that they are asking throughout the interview
Interview Questions: Is this just a job to you?

title: Community Health Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with recruiter was great: 15 minutes and was very straightforward. I got an email 2 days later saying I was moving forward in the process and will be interviewed by the Hiring Manager (Associate Director) and will be hearing from them to schedule the second interview. 9 days go by and I don’t hear anything so I reach out and the recruiter states that they are experiencing delays on their end and will get back to me soon with updates. 2 days later they email saying they I’m actually NOT moving forward and they’ve decided to proceed with other candidates. MSK and other employers can hire whoever and however they want, however, it is highly unprofessional and frankly rude to tell a candidate that they are moving forward to next rounds, leave them hanging for weeks, then tell them oh no, you’re actually not moving forward. It’s very disappointing. I was a patient of MSK and I was really looking forward to working with such a great institution that I really believed in. Unfortunately they lost my respect. And based on other reviews written here, I’m not the only person this has happened to.
Interview Questions: Basic questions like, why do you want to work here? Tell me about yourself?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Originally applied for a Project Coordinator role with one of the lab teams. Had a phone screening with a member of the team who was very vague and kept mentioning that I was being considered for other "junior level technician roles". This confused me, but I was assured that I was still being considered for the Project Coordinator role. I was also told that an in-person interview would follow "roughly two weeks from the phone screening". I do not live in New York, so I told the interviewer my availability and waited for a response. 

A few weeks later, I was contacted after reaching out three times trying to figure out what was going on. At this point, the date that had been thrown around for my in person interview had come and gone. I effectively planned a 5 hour trip to NYC for no reason. When I finally was contacted, it was for a follow up interview for the junior level technician position that had been mentioned to me in passing during my phone screening. At this point, I was already really frustrated with the lack of responsiveness and lack of clear structure to the process, but I was still interested in the team, so I asked for the role's budget and expressed my concerns regarding the pay and qualification gap between the two positions. I did not receive a response for three more weeks, and when I finally did, I was told it was "too early in the process" to disclose budget information to me. How do you justify not even disclosing salary to me after over SIX WEEKS of waiting around and having the job title i'm being interviewed for switched with no real mention of it? I immediately withdrew my application. Shame on the Integrated Genomics Operation for their lack of professionalism in regards to new applicants.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your past experiences

title: Patient Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: This was an in person interview. After communicating via email, an interview at the hospital was made. Follow up was about 1-2 weeks after the interview. Overall good experience and interview process went smoothly.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: they asked fair questions and i was prepared by using glassdoor and knowing my resume by heart. staff is friendly and welcoming during the interview and want you to succeed. They have clear expectations.
Interview Questions: how would you handle XYZ situation

title: Bioinformatics Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Talked to a potential manager. It was a first interview with the company, general questions about my experience. He mentioned that for the second interview they would ask to do a presentation about my previous projects.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous projects related to the position

title: Field Service Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Very professional - learned a lot from speaking with the interviewer. I used the skills from this interview to other interviews.  They really know their stuff about computer hardware & software.
Interview Questions: What is a PST file?

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center

title: Rfmw I Interview

Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation and how did you manage it

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Applied for a couple postings and 4 days later was emailed by a recruiter to set up a phone screening. A week later after following up, I was scheduled for an interview with a supervisor. After that interview the supervisor scheduled me for an interview with the manager. I was told I would hear back within a week and after a week went by the recruiter told me the team decided to go with a candidate with more experience but recommended me to another department within clinical research. I was scheduled to interview with both the manager and supervisor the next day. 

I interviewed with both and was told I would hear back but they just started their recruitment for the position. A week went by and after not hearing back, I emailed the recruiter to ask if she’s heard any follow up. She responded that she would reach out to the team and let me know but it’s been over a month since then so I’ve given up. 

The questions were all pretty behavioral and all the interviews were done virtually for about 30 mins. 

I know a lot of potential med students use clinical research jobs to boost up their med school resumes so they have alot of turn over ( Idk about the working conditions). I think they try to vet to insure you will really stay on board and not leave. 

My take away from this has been they aren’t that great with following up. I knew going in that it’s pretty hard to break in from current employees. I think for the applicant sake, follow up would just be greatly appreciated. It seems like a trend when  reading these interview reviews.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: After submitting several applications to open positions with MSK, I received and email request for a phone interview which was set up for the next day. I researched how my current skills were transferable to the position and why I believed I was a good fit. When it came time to the interview I was met with acknowledgment that the experience was there for this position and this was a formality really. We spoke about why I wanted to make a career change at this moment and was understanding. She was honest saying she was afraid this position would not be in my salary range because it’s cap is lower than what she expects mine is now based on my level of experience. I was promised follow up with identification of several opportunities she believed I could be a good fit into. However, it has now been several days and I have followed up several times and each attempt was met with no response and I am unsure if I should continue pursing any further, or stop interviewing, but without any guidance I’m not sure what I’m expected to do that this point.
Interview Questions: Why the decision to leave a company you’ve worked for for the past 8 years?

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (Commack, NY) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Long interview process - first spoke to recruiter on the phone and answered basic questions. Moved on to the next round, which was a Zoom interview with the two assistant managers at the office I was applying for. Had a long in-depth conversation of about 10-12 behavioral questions that required answers with examples of past situations.  The interview was difficult but I was well prepared.

I felt that I really connected with the interviewers and had a pleasant experience. At the end I asked them if they had any hesitations about my qualifications and they told me "no we think you're a great fit for the position with your extensive patient-care experience and your personality, and you should expect to hear back in two weeks." 

Two weeks came and passed, so I contacted the initial recruiter and he told me no decision had been made yet and that he would be in touch within two weeks. He wasn't, so I contacted him again and he said they had selected someone else for the position. To be honest, I thought it had gone really well and the interviewers gave me really positive feedback at the end of the interview, but ultimately they picked someone else.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you went above and beyond for a patient.

title: Research Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the website in early Aug, and within a week got an HR interview. The scheduling for the interview was pretty bumpy so HR was very apologetic and sweet to me. My interview with the PI was scheduled next, around mid-Aug which went well. It was a candid interview where we both spoke of our strong points (not just me!) so I was very happy. I also had another offer in hand (who is the PI's close friend) which I was candid about. I think that really speeded things up for me. Next, I had a lab interview of about 3 hours where I met most of the lab (13 ppl) and went well. Overall I heard back from them very quickly. I need an H1B transfer. I got the offer in September start for a join date in November start. But HR only has started working on my transfer process on Oct 5. I'm not sure if my visa will go through before my start date (they don't really reply to or my boss's emails) so kinda bummed about it. Hopefully, it goes through! So keep that in mind for someone who needs a visa.
Interview Questions:
Q. Tell us about your strengths and weaknesses?
Q. What projects have you worked on?
Q. Would you be ok not being liked my everyone and enforcing rules on the lab?

title: Product Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Absolutely abysmal experience from the recruiter. A recruiter reached out to scheduled an interview for a product role, and even after multiple emails/reminders regarding my availability, they never responded back. I found out 3 days later that the role has magically closed without any correspondence from the recruiter. I mean honestly, how unprofessional is that? After sending a note saying I plan on echoing this interview feedback to their HR department, I magically got a reply with the recruiter stating my messages went to their spam folder and “they’re still interested.” Then the same exact thing occurred, where the recruiter was unresponsive. I can’t stress enough how much I’d suggest avoiding this company. Their recruitment time isn’t worth the time and effort, there are much better companies out there.

title: Bioinformatics Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Easy and very long Interview process included one coding test with 3 Leetcode Medium questions. Then 3 weeks later, a get-to-know-each-other interview then 3 weeks later, an HR interview then 3 weeks later an interview with head of department. Then a take home quiz. 

For the take home quiz, they assigned a frontend based task and said dont spend more than 4 hours. They did not describe how they want the code returned and when the deliverable was done and doing as expected, the interview rejected 2 weeks later with some of following excuses:
1. File name could have been different.
2. Code could have had test cases.
3. Code could have been on Github.
4. Variable name could be different.
5.  More instructions should have been there.
6. Delivery method could have been different.

Who puts company quiz on Github ? Wouldnt it have been unprofessional? My code was named script.py. What name did he want ? Variables had meaningful names and comments too. If they had asked, i could have sent on Github, docker or anything. Apparently, a zip file with readme and requirements.txt to install all libraries werent enough. 

All in all, a total unprofessional team who wouldn't specifically tell what they want and would expect a production quality output. Process seemed biased as they didnt ask a single technical question at all. Just wasted my time on take-home quiz and took 3 months in interview process, only to make silly excuses in take home quiz.
Interview Questions: Just about past experience and a take home quiz and Algo monster difficult coding challenge

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: You have a couple of rounds of short interviews with HR, Assistant Managers, and Managers. A lot of behavioral based questions are asked. Prior knowledge in healthcare is very helpful.

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Interviews begin at HR with more conventional resume review and some questions about education and career goals as well as a basic skills test. title: Clinical Research Manager Interview

title: Software Engineer Interview

title: Billing Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: First I interviewed with HR who just asked basic questions. Than I interviewed  with the department I would be working at. The interview was done virtually.  The interview was with 3 people.
Interview Questions: They asked about my current position and 1 interviewer basically looked at my resume and asked me what the meaning was of the different phrases and statements on my resume.  He than rudley asked me what were the names of the clients I worked on, I respectfully informed him that  I signed a non disclosure agreement so I could not reveal my current customers. He than got mad and said well you claim you work on large clients, but don't want to reveal them, so basically saying I was making up the fact that I worked on large clients. This person was rude, unprofessional, and kept cutting me off, claiming he only had 15 mins. I wouldn't have taken the job if offered, because I would never work for such an unprofessional person.

title: Patient Authorization Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I got hired post pandemic. I applied online then got an email from HR looking to schedule a phone interview with the HR representative. The HR rep basically called to tell me more about the position and just ask me to elaborate on my resume. We had a brief chat and then I sent a follow up thank you email. 
A few days later she contacted me saying the department supervisors want to do a zoom interview.
We scheduled it and I had a chance to meet two supervisors from the department. They asked a lot of STAR questions. I sent follow up emails after we were done. Next I got an email to interview with the manager. They told me they were interview more candidates and I would have an answer in a few weeks. About two weeks later I got an email from HR offering me the position.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about yourself. 
Name a situation where you acted to quickly at work.
Name a situation where you had an inter office conflict.

title: Research Study Assistant Interview

title: Clicnical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online for a Super Interview Day with The Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences Service. A staff member contacted me by email to set up a 5-minute phone screen. On the phone screen, the interviewer asked about my educational background, the languages I spoke, and interestingly, what my prospects were after graduation. 

She explained their department hired a few Pre-Med students who bailed on the department after year (training's expensive) and wanted to make sure I was not one of them. After I told her I wasn't, she signed me up for a Zoom interview with a lab manager from one of the department's research groups that best match my interests and skills.

Here's the best part: the lab manager never showed up to the Zoom interview. No call. No email. Nothing. 

Confused, I texted the staff member I had the phone screen with (point of contact for that day) about the situation. She informed me that the lab manager had something come up and could not attend our interview (Yet, they could not personally notify me, great). She also told me that she'd let me know of the next steps the next day. That message never came.

In the end, I withdrew my application and let them know they were responsible for it. 

If a workplace displays several red flags (disorganization, little to no communication, little consideration for others' time) even before I get hired, I do not want to work there. Simply put, I do not want to take a chance that they won't attempt the same gross behavior when I am employed.

I may need a job, but not that bad.
Interview Questions: I never got to the interview questions since my interviewer never showed up.

title: Research Technician Interview

Interview Descriptions: Interviewed in 3 stages, all were very nice, informative, and respectful. Not too many tough technical questions, but really wanted to get a feel for who you are, and explained thoroughly the laboratory's goals, mission, and purpose. Interview began mid-December, with an offer mid-January

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: It was a two part interview -- one that was online via skype with HR and then they invite you back to have an interview with a nurse manager in person on the floor.
Interview Questions: Why MSK?

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through my universities career site. The first part of the process involved an online game-based assessment that lasted about 30 minutes. Afterward,  I received a call from HR and set up a phone screening, which lasted about 15 minutes. They asked basic questions about your resume, why you want to work there, and your availability. From there, I was then set up with a group interview at my university with three current employees in different departments at MSK. The interview was pleasant, with behavioral questions. After that, I received notification of my offer over the phone. The whole process took a little over a month.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you lead a project or group.

title: Summer Support Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: One virtual interview. All questions were behavior based questions, relatively simple and largely based on your resume. Interviewers were nice and the interview was low pressure, even with some technical difficulties. Called a few weeks later with a job offer.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a situation you wish you'd handled differently

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews. One with HR and one with the floor manager. Both interviews were straight forward and both people were very kind and down to earth. I really appreciated how honest both representatives were, and I felt very welcomed by them both.
Interview Questions: What is one thing you would change about yourself?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I went to an information session about CRC's which turned into a networking event. I met with multiple people including the hiring manager.  About a month later, I got an email for an interview.  A few days later, I got an offer.
Interview Questions: Why MSK?

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Interviewing process took over two months. From start to finish. Very lengthy and very involved with the vetting. In a way I appreciate that because it’s weeding out the less serious. Very professional.
Interview Questions: Describe a moment you had to handle a challenging patient?

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Overall very easy, basic interview questions. Questions like a struggle that you have faced in the past or what inspires you to want to work here. Two rounds of interviews.
Interview Questions: What's one struggle that you recently had to work to overcome, and how did you do so?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Grueling, annoying, very extra and unnecessary. You are literally interviewed 3-4 times before being hired and for some people it’s 6 times.  A hiring manager once asked me who was my mentor, like what does that have to do with anything?!
Interview Questions: Who was my mentor if any

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Received an email to schedule for a phone interview. Thank was schedule for a second interview in person. The interview went well. The interview process was very fast, only take a couple days
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years from now ?

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very quick, we mostly talked about my research interests and responsibilities. The interview experience was very pleasant. I heard back in a few days, and got the feedback on the interview.
Interview Questions: What are some of your research interests?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my resume and was contacted by talent acquisition specialist very quickly. We had a phone screen where I was asked a series of questioned. Then my resume was sent to departments with openings for their review.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very long however if your interview process is long it ensues that you will receive an offer. Reference check and possibly interview with another team member.  In total interview process is about 2 months.
Interview Questions: Time when you handled a patient that was livid and how did you handle situation.

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Short simple and direct. Job description definitely did not emphasize the amount of work and time you need to put in to be fulfilled upper management satisfaction. There will be at least 3 rounds of interviews. 2 with hr, 1 with manager and 1 with PI
Interview Questions: Years of experience

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly & informative interview.  Interviewer explained full benefits and demands of the position.  Relaxed atmosphere yet professional.  Definitely a facility that makes their patients a priority.
Interview Questions: Schedule availability

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: A few weeks after submitting applications, they reached out via e-mail. Had a phone interview, and was brought in for an on-site about after 2 weeks. After the on-site interview, I was informed that I did not receive an offer after about 3-4 weeks.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of a time where you had to deal with a difficult coworker.

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening followed phone interview followed by in person interview. In person interview was in NYC and phone screening and interviews were done by someone from HR. Interview in NYC was completed by the managers of the department I was eventually place in
Interview Questions: Describe a weakness that holds you back at work

title: Scrum Master Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (Baltimore, MD) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: They are the facilitator of exchanges and interactions with the team. They help build consensus regarding next steps on the team, keep everyone on task following the agreed-upon rules, and do everything they can to maximize the team’s performance.
Interview Questions: What is a the difference between agile and scrum

title: Senior Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process was pretty straight forward.
First they sort list candidate and then have small codability test for coding. once you clear that, they arranged F2F interview within a week. Interview with Manager and one senior technical person. it wasn't that hard, mostly asked about past project experience and scenario based questions. Offered a position in next 3-4 days.
Interview Questions: Scenario based questions. more on your past projects

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I got the video call interview with the lab I applied for. It was great experience. They were very nice and was not too serious or too formal. They made me less nervous about the interview and very honest about expectation.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite thing about lab work?

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Had to download an app and play 15 games for about 30 minutes. Then received a call from HR for a phone interview. From there set up an in-person interview with two people who had about 15 open-ended questions each and they wrote down either your response or their reaction to your response in front of you. In-person interview was about an hour.
Interview Questions: describe a scenario when you may have disagreed with criticism you received. how did you handle it?

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview was very brief and last around 10 minutes. The interviewer seemed to be rushing and did not ask if I had any questions in the end. When I did ask questions, she did not seem certain on her answers.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in a hospital?

title: CT Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (Middletown, NJ) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online in December 2019. 
I received a call from a recruiter two weeks later. An interview was scheduled (1:1). The interview was about an hour long.  I received an offer two weeks later.
Interview Questions: Name a time you went above and beyond for a patient.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by the Talent Acquisition Team and had an initial phone interview. It took about 9 business days to get an email back inviting me for a second, in-person interview. The in-person interview was an hour long with three people from the team, including the Clinical Research Manager. They asked mostly scenario based questions.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you had to deal with conflict in the work space. How did you handle this?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Basic behavioral interview. Asked a bit about past experiences but mostly asked how I would handle stressful situations and workloads. How to deal with conflict within a team, problem solving and making decisions.
Interview Questions: What was one challenged high face and how did you overcome it

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions:
This was probably the worst interview process I've ever went through. I had applied for another position 1 month beforehand, but the recruiter contacted me to interview for another Data Analyst position. I went along with it since the position was pretty similar to what I applied for.
A few days later, the recruiter gave me an online analytics test to take. I passed and even scored above the average percentile. The recruiter told me they're even going to skip the phone call and let me see the hiring manager in person ASAP.
The following week, I go in for the interview. The interviewer asked me regular questions that one would ask during an interview. But then she would try to refute my responses, which made me uncomfortable. For example, she asked me why I left my first job and went to the second job. I said it's because I was looking for a challenge and felt stagnant in my previous job (which is 100% true). She goes "Uh (company name) is a huge company. You mean to tell me that there were NO growth opportunities whatsoever?" I said well at the moment, no there were not. She goes "Wow.. well I can't believe that, but let's continue." ??? 
Towards the end of the interview, she asked if I had any questions. I started asking a series of questions, but she stops me mid-way through a question because "she just had to tell me about next steps, unless I had anymore questions". 
After the interview, of course I did not hear back from the recruiter nor hiring manager. And I didn't follow up because of the experience I had. It sucks because I'm really passionate about MSK's mission, but I guess I dodged a bullet.
Interview Questions: Why MSK? Why did you leave your previous careers?

title: Commications Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty straight forward with HR and with the manager that I would be reporting to.  I thought my credentials answered this question easily.  However, I was told that HR would contact me in days either way.  I never heard from them.  2 weeks later, i requested a response by leaving a voicemail.  Still no response.  I finally had to contact the Senior Comm. Lead to get a response whereby HR then called me later that same day.
Interview Questions: With your experience you would be expected to take over my duties during the course of my time off.

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New Brunswick, NJ) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: The process began with a game-based assessment which took about 30 minutes. After that, there is a phone screening, followed by a group interview. The group interview lasted about 45 minutes.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you failed and what you did in response to it.

title: Health Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online first through their website and my school's website. Then, I took the online test which tested my personality. I was then reached out to and had a phone interview, and finally an in-person interview
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to learn something difficult very quickly

title: Laboratory Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied to this position through recruiting consortium from my school. They typically do phone calls as a first round, but I had it through an in person interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your education.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview that lasted 15 minutes and asked about why I would like to work there as well as work experience and strengths and weaknesses. They also asked what you know about the company and how you would contribute by working there.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, Got an email from the talent acquisition  team for in person interview about two days after applying. Was told I would be meeting with with the hiring manager. No phone, or video interview.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself
Why do you want to work for mskcc

title: Clinical Research Audit Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I was an external applicant. I applied on 10/08/18 and received an email from HR on 10/29/18 to schedule a phone interview.  I spoke with the Recruiter on 10/31/18. I had an in-person interview on 11/5/18 with 2 of the team leads and their manager, so 3 people in total. Next, I interviewed with the Director or the department a day or two later. I was offered the job on 11/27/18.
Interview Questions: Why are you looking to leave your current position (Recruiter asked)

title: X-ray Tech Per-diem Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Don't even apply to this terrible place.  They will ask you to be available to work 5 days a week.. but only "possibly" give you 2 shifts a week. They didn't care about my education or qualifications  or anything.  Who can live on 2 days a week pay? This was the most horrible time wasting interview I ever went on. Since I can't and won't sit around waiting. I get a no thank you email the very next day.
Interview Questions: availability

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Depending on the person or person there can be multiple interviews. I had 3-4 interviews. They have a packet of questions and write your answer down. Some interviews may be 1-3 people. I had 2 people interview me and a sit in person.
Interview Questions: Have you worked on the phone with patients?

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: first, they asked a few questions in regards to behavior and they asked what I thought the position itself entailed.  Then they asked about my work history and what interested me in the office coordinator position. They described exactly what the position would entail and if I had any issues in preforming them. they stated a brief summary of what the hours were and what they were expecting.
Interview Questions: tell us a time where you had to handle a task and was not able to.

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (West Harrison, NY) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Signed up for the newly grads community talent network. 
A recruiter reached out via phone and set up a phone screening. 
Another recruiter followed up to set up an in-person interview and emphasizing that the interview will be focused on behavioral questions. 
Attended the in-person interview which took about 45 to 50 minutes with two interviewers and the recruiter I had been in touch with.
Interview Questions: Why are you looking to transition to a patient focused role?

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I had three interviews: phone, skype, and in-person. Make sure you look up interview tips for each style of interview, you may be surprised how much goes into a skype interview. My interviews were scheduled fairly close to each other but the offer took a while. Overall, great management and would recommend applying here to anyone.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you had to deal with something difficult.

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone interview and then an interview with the manager of the floor that was hiring. The phone interview was fairly simple. Interview in person went into depth about situations and  "get to know" you questions.
Interview Questions: Why did you become a nurse

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. I received a message about three days letter to set up a phone screen call. I did the phone screen call and at the end of the call scheduled for a phone interview two days letter. The phone interview was with a talent acquisition specialist. It was mainly behavioral based make sure to study the STARS method and material was sent over by the recruiter to prep in advance. After the phone interview, it took about two weeks to be scheduled for an in person interview. The in person interview was with two hiring managers. I was mainly asked behavioral based questions. The in person interview went well but it's important to do your research regarding the company and also being prepared to answer different behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at MSK?

title: Research Study Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: very good experience, did not ask difficult or uncommon questions, friendly hiring managers that are extremely intelligent and professional, very informative explaining the main job responsibilities and daily work flow, quick emailing/follow up response, 2 live interview sessions
Interview Questions: what is one of your weaknesses

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: First there is a phone screening with the external recruiter which takes about 15-20 minutes. Then a second phone call interview with the HR person within the company.  Lastly, an in person interview that lasts about 45 minutes: They asked a total of 9-10 questions, with sub questions accompanying each one to clarify
Interview Questions: Describe a time you took charge of a situation

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (Basking Ridge, NJ) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process took about 2 weeks. First you will receive an email from Talent Acquisition looking to schedule a phone interview. Phone interview is very brief, more about salary and job description. Then you will hear back by the end of the week to schedule an in-person interview. It is a panel interview with 3 employers who ask about a total of 12 situation specific questions. If you do not provide them with an actual scenario they will re-ask the same question and ask for specific examples.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time you and a co-worker did not see eye-to-eye and how the situation was handled and what you learned from this.

title: Research Regulatory Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: interview and hiring process is quick, under a month from interview to offer letter. my only advice pay careful attention when interviewing, analyze your interviewer so that you understand what work environment you are entering, the interviewer which is your manager has strict control over you and your work so pay close attention to decide if you really want to work for them
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I knew someone so I was able to bypass online applications. Easy process. Met with manager and she showed me around the floor. Asked me a couple questions.  Haven't heard back yet.
Interview Questions: If someone were to describe you, what would they say?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: 1. Phone screen with recruiter. About 3 days later, I received an email for an inperson interview with the Clinical Research Supervisors. Then another 3 days later, the supervisor emailed me to set up an interview with the Doctor (P.I). Met with the doctor and a week later received a phone call with an offer from the recruiter.
Interview Questions: Name a time you made a mistake.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: first was the phone screen by recruiter, the questions are more like general investigation.  then i was set up to be interviewed by the PI of the lab. i am still waiting for the coming  interview.
Interview Questions: salary expectation

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, took an online assessment, was chosen for a phone screen, and then brought in for an onsite interview. At the onsite interview I met with two assistant managers, and then one overseeing manager, the onsite interview lasted about 1.5 hours in total. During my experience, I found it valuable to really learn the topics HR sends you ahead of time to practice, make sure to study the STAR interview method, as I was almost solely asked behavioral styled questions. I found it important to engage in normal conversation at the end of each interview, so my interviewers could see who I am as a person on top of my STAR answers; make sure you let your personality shine through somehow. Everyone that I met with at MSK was extremely nice, genuine, and seemingly truly interested in my potential growth with the organization. I was so grateful to receive an offer with the company, I almost cried on the phone with my HR rep!
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time at work that you failed, and how did you resolve the issue

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my resume, then was contacted by HR rep for a short phone interview and later scheduled an in person interview with the floor I was applying to - after the initial interview, I was told there would be a second interview because it's a 2 interview process.
Interview Questions: Why MSK?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview within the first few days of applying, then face to face interviews with four people a week later.
