The interview was terrible, there was a disconnect between the recruiter, hiring managers and department head. Gave inconsistent information and didn't seem to know  where this person was going to fit in their organization. The recruiter was pulling on the side of his face I think trying to stay awake while interviewing me and answering emails.
Interview Questions: What do you like the most about your job and what do you like the least? In what situation did you take initiative on a project or something? A lot of process questions regarding my field.

title: Rehabilitation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: A few days after completing the application  I received an email to schedule a phone interview.  After completing the phone interview I completed several rounds of interviews.
Interview Questions: The interviews with the hiring team consists of "what would you do" questions or "name a time when" questions. Some of the questions were specific to the job so if you do not have prior experience in the field they will be difficult to answer.

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: They asked several questions about my background and what my major was in college. They also asked what I can bring to the position. They switched the interviewer last minute but it was okay.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have related to this position?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
I submitted an application through MSK's online HR portal and received a request for a phone screen about 2-3 weeks later.  I had a 30-minute conversation with an HR associate who provided an overview of the organization and culture. The phone screen consisted of standard questions ("Walk me through your resume," "Why are you interested in MSK"). 

I was then scheduled for a second round phone screen with a member of the team. The second interview was much more candid and we spoke frankly about the structure of the team, challenges of the role, etc. I was asked some questions to gauge my technical knowledge of data analysis and querying.

I had to withdraw my application due to receiving a job offer from another organization, but I found the interview process with MSK to be very open and professional. I felt there was a strong effort by both interviewers to make me feel comfortable while chatting about the position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Memorial Sloan Kettering?

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Was easy to follow. Very active process... HR was very responsive and set up interviews quickly and alerted you to the next step. There were two phone screens and an administrative test and a request for references.
Interview Questions: Why MSK? Two strengths

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with 2 people. Applied in Mid April. Got my phone interview 3rd week of May. Went for my 1st face to face interview last week of June. 2nd interview was the 2nd week of July. Got an offer on July 19th by email and phone. They emailed me a link that same day to review my offer letter and accept it. The pay offer was good with a night differential of 10%. Starting hourly pay is $25 (5 years experience) and $2.50 on top of that for a total hourly pay of $27.50 if you work nights. PCT’s no longer work 12 hour shifts, RN’s either. Because the workload is heavy it has been changed to 8-10 hours depending on your unit. I’ll be working 8 hours, 5 days a week. The benefits are amazing. The discounts and perks are phenomenal. They are Union (1199). Tuition reimbursement of $12.5K a year, not sure if that’s after 6 months or after a year of working.
Interview Questions: The interview process was average. Answered questions about my work experience and they also asked me to tell them a time when I went above and beyond for a patient, what were my weakness, why should they hire me, what would my past employers say about me and why did I choose to apply at MSK?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Very pleasant experience. Took a few weeks to get response from initial application. First a phone interview, then an in person interview was scheduled with the department. The process went very smoothly with helpful recruiter.
Interview Questions: Describe how you would be able to contribute to the department.

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: I first received an email to expect a 15 min preliminary call. The woman was very nice. She explained the position, expectations, possible salary, and briefly touched on benefits. I was then interviewed via video chat which lasted 30 mins and was asked behavioral based questions. I was then scheduled for an in person interview. I was offered the position a few hours later.  Every one I spoke with was very nice and insightful and very willing to answer questions or concerns. Great experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for MSK?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and heard back 2 months later. Scheduled a general first interview which consisted of questions about your background and experience and why you wanted to work as a CRC. Next round was a sky interview with the clinical team and the PI. More questions about yourself and why you were interested in the position. Some behavioral questions.  I got a third call a week later and thought that it was an invite to go interview in person, but turned out to be  the job offer. I've learned though that the interviews are done within the clinical team and will vary by which service you apply to.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very lengthy considering the amount of time it took from the time of application before I heard back for an interview request. The process consisted of a phone screen, and in person panel interview which lasted about 1 hour, and interviews with several MD's for placement.
Interview Questions: Why MSK?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very in depth and they ask how you organize your data, tell them about your experience, and you speak to multiple people at the same time. You first are interviewed by the secretary, then have 2 more rounds of interviews afterword. You are interviewed by a doctor and also the main person you will be working underneath.
Interview Questions: How do you gather data

title: Front Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Overall the interview process was eh. The first two interviews were easy, just your basic phone and facetime screening. Third interview was in person however it felt like a waste of time because it was a behavioral interview and I felt the questions didn't pertain very well to the position. The final interview was in person with the doctor and all of his associates, they were pleasant. Overall the process took two months and could've been better given they took WEEKS to reply to some emails, or did not return some emails. Doesn't make sense not to reply to potential employees? Due to this I declined the offer seeing that HR was not very responsive.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you handled a crisis?

title: Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: It was a whole-day interview from 8am-5pm. Their office and the hr office were located in different places far away. The traffic was very bad in the morning. I was late. Talked to several professors and staff. Finally did a 50-min presentation. Many audiences. Asked many questions.
Interview Questions: Talk about your work experience.

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Very brief phone and then video interview. You set up a time for a phone interview online and then they call you. Interview was informative about the position. They also asked if you had any questions.
Interview Questions: What is a positive trait about yourself

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was reached out by CRS via email to set up a phone interview.  Then I was invited for a in person interview with the manager and CRS.  I was reached out via email by th CRS for a second interview was with the doctor.   I heard back a week later from the HR for references. Then the week after, I was offered and accepted the job. Overall, It was a quick process
Interview Questions: Why MSK?

title: Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied in March and got called around the beginning of April. I had a brief phone screening and was called for a first interview. The first Interview went well and they asked a lot of behavior questions which lasted about an hour.  After the 1st Interview, I was called back for a 2nd Interview a week after. The day before the interview I had my time changed 4 hours earlier than the original time.  The interview had a 2nd round which asked the same round of questions and also lasted a 1hr. After leaving the interview I was never followed up with any information, never asked my references or even got a call back to say that I was not qualified to move forward.  I would respect if the organization can just mention to candidates if they were not selected instead of ghosting them.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at MSKCC?

title: Supply Clerk III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online via the website, and it took about 2-3 weeks for someone to get back to me. My first interview was over the phone from a talent acquisition person. Then approximately 2-3 weeks later I got an email from that same person letting me know when my in person interview was. The interview went great, I was interviewed by 3 people at the same time, and then I was given a tour of the facility.
Interview Questions: I was asked what attracted me to the position.

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy online application, then an in person meeting with 3 women. All behavioral questions. They were all very nice and informative, and I was happy to hear that I had gotten the job. Unfortunately I had already accepted another by the time they offered it to me.
Interview Questions: How have you faced challenges in previous experiences?

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, went in for a face to face, got asked for my references and then didn't hear back for 2 weeks. Emailed my recruiter and then was sent an automatic response that I did not get the position. Would have appreciated a personal email as I took time off from work and paid to come into New York. Respect goes both ways especially after having my references fill out a form.
Interview Questions: behavior questions

title: Data Science/Analytics Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: My resume was shared with MSKCC by my university. I was contacted over email, where I was asked to share my coding sample in R. The interview was short, over the phone and lasted around 40 minutes.
Interview Questions: Experience with Tidyverse?

title: IP QA Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: The process was fast and accommodating. I had another job offer and the hiring manager worked off hours and with other prospective management to interview within a few hours’ time.
Interview Questions: What would be a challenge for you in this position?

title: Clinical Research Manager/Research Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I've interviewed at MSKCC twice. Both times the positions were filled by internal applicants. It was a waste of my time. One of the recruiters indirectly asked about the year I graduated college. Why is this relevant?  Make sure you are prepared to deflect this question to your experiences.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself
What would your manager say about you?
How would your subordinates describe your weakness?
Have you participated in an FDA audit?
What are the names of the PIs you worked with

title: Healthcare Administration Summer Support Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: 1 online application and 1 in-person behavioral interview (before co-vid 19), where you are asking about your previous experience and expected to use the STAR method to answer all questions
Interview Questions: What experience do you have working with a team where someone does not complete a task?

title: Summer Legal Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: On campus interview and then I had a callback in New York where I interviewed with 4 attorneys over 2 hours. Everyone was really friendly and nice. Overall a good experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Flow Cytology Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Met with director, offered position unofficially, HR reached out two days later, offer letter by the end of the work week. Accepted offer, they only do orientation maybe twice a month and at the start of a new pay period, so depending on the timing you might have to wait a couple of weeks to start the position, orientation is two days, but the food is really good, and it is somewhat fun.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience at all in flow cytometry?

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: first you take an assessment when applying then someone will email you or text you about setting up a phone interview and then they will set up a video interview
Interview Questions: name a time you worked with a group and had some difficulty handling the project

title: Data Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview then after a week there was an in-person interview with three people in the department. The interview took about an hour and it wasn't formal. It felt easy going and like a conversation.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Best interview process. Interviewed by 8 different people in total for 2 hours. Overall robust interview process. Liked the outcome. Positive attitude by the interviewing people. They helped me to ease up the interview process with casual talk initially.
Interview Questions: Tell us why we need to hire you

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Interview was semi difficult. Although they assure you that every position is available for entry levels, they question your skills in the data collection environment repetitively. The interviewers were very nice but a bit intimidating.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with extracting large amounts of data?

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: There was one phone interview and then an in-person interview with similar questions. First, a recruiter calls you and then you schedule the in-person portion. There is also an online assessment.
Interview Questions: Describe one time that you had to learn something difficult quickly.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Following your application submission, you should expect to hear back from a recruiter between 1.5 to 2 weeks to have a phone screen. This conversation will be scheduled and occur about a week from initial contact.  An on-site interview was scheduled later that week, exactly four days after (so expect that to take a week). The process is relatively smooth and the interviewers per each department were lovely to speak with, however in my personal experience I had been ghosted by the recruiter I had been closely working with following a rejection from a position.
Interview Questions: Explain a time when you faced difficulty; how did you overcome?

title: Data Entry Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was  good...You have to be well knowledgeable about the company and the work position you are applying for before going for the interview. Must be Punctual to the interview place, very Important!
Interview Questions: what do you know about our company?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted via email to arrange an interview for two weeks later.  I met with the charge nurse of the unit, who informed me that there was a two-tier interview process, and that I would be contacted if I would be among the selected candidates to move to the next round.  I was not contacted for another interview and was told that the position had been filled.
Interview Questions: Was there one patient encounter which struck you as "the reason why I became a nurse"?

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Long story short: two phone call interviews (basics about the position, salary, and hours), two in-person interviews on-site (behavioral/situational), then a third phone-call regarding one of the final stages (a reference check).
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at MSKCC?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone interview, then a group interview, then a 1:1 interview.  All were short and quick. But very informative. I was able to ask questions and they were open to getting to know you.
Interview Questions: Name a fun fact about yourself

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview went really well. I was interviewed by the PI of the lab and we just had a conversation. He spoke about his work and the aims of his lab. For the most part he did most of the talking. He asked me a few questions and I also asked him a few questions in return(need to show you are interested in the work being done). And he requested documents from me after the interview and within a week or two I got an offer. Every thing went pretty fast. A month later I started working.
Interview Questions: What are your future goals? How soon do you plan on going to grad school?

title: Protocol Review Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Heard from recruiter within a week, then went through a series of three in-person interviews lasting an hour each over the course of 4 weeks, resulting in the receipt of a final generic email saying they were pursuing other candidates about 2 weeks after my last interview.  There was a large gap between the interviews. I never got a feel for whether or not anyone liked me. No one ever showed me around the office space, which I thought was odd. In my final round I was told that the position was "SO DIFFERENT" (emphasis on purpose) from my resume experience, and I felt right then that I had been wasting my time during the entire process. If I had known that they were simply looking to fill an experience gap, then that is easily done without so many interview rounds.
Interview Questions: Explain to me what your interpretation of this position is.

title: Research Regulatory Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online for the position. The whole process took 3 weeks. I had 3 phone interviews. 
1. Screening interview- with Talent Acquisition Specialist (7 min)
2. Behavioral interview- with Hiring Manager (40 min)
3. Job description interview-  with Clinical Research Manager (20 min)
Interview Questions: STAR related behavioral questions

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Interview went very well.  Felt comfortable and well-informed coming out of it. Difficult, if not well-prepared.. so prepare possible answers/scenarios in your head. Review review review. Come in with confidence and background knowledge of the company, position, and various ways to grow from the position in the company.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for MSKCC? How do you various experiences make you suitable for the position?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Very confusing, HR did not communicate well between me and the team I was interviewing for.  Also they double booked interview time spots. Eventually I met with HR lady and then the team. Team was very nice but it was obvious HR did not understand the position. Overall not good experience so I took CRC job elsewhere.
Interview Questions: Why MSK?

title: Member Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Long and difficult. I was there for almost 2 hours. I had to meet with 2 interview specialist and felt a lot of preasure. They ask you a question and want you to spend lots of time answering that question while they take tons of notes.
Interview Questions: They asked so many and wanted full answers with lots of details and a scenerio to back up your answer

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I had an employee referral. Two weeks later I received an email for a phone interview. I never heard back after the phone interview. Human resources was very nice though.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you went above and beyond for a patient

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
1. Video Interview 
2. In-person overview of position with talent acquisition specialist
3. Interview with hiring manager(s)

The employees who participated in this process were friendly and enthusiastic about their contributions to MSKCC.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you turned a negative situation into a positive one.

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: One over the phone interview and then an in person interview in NYC a few weeks later. Pretty much everyone got their offer a week after the in person interview.
Interview Questions: Asked mostly behavioral questions like "why MSK," "describe a time when you went above and beyond for a customer/employee," and "describe a difficult customer interaction and how you dealt with it"

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: A person from HR/Talent Acquisition would get in contact with you and do a phone screening over the phone.  We managed to do a webcam interview and she asked a few questions. HINT: Study STARS. These questions are behavioral style.  After doing the webcam interview, I was able to set up an another interview to meet with two supervisors. Once again. HINT: Study STARS. Finally met with the administrative manager. HINT: Study STARS.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied and immediately completed a personality assessment. About a week later, I did a brief 10-minute phone interview with HR. A couple of days after that, I did a 30-minute video interview with HR.  Approximately a week and a half later, I did an in-person interview with 2 supervisors. HR requested me to provide them with 5 references the same day as the interview. The references will have to complete a survey via email. The key is to study the questions on Glassdoor, know how to answer the questions in the STAR format, and do your research on the company.
Interview Questions: How did you hear about MSK?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process was pretty quick but very lengthy. Met with HR department, than two managers and lastly the physicians. Within a few days I received a call from human resources offering the position. It all went by pretty fast.
Interview Questions: Name a time you were faced with a difficult decision and how you dealt with it?

title: Unit Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Very long time span from first interview to hiring, first interviewed by Talent Acquisitions (HR), then week later by manager/ supervisor. Individual interviews lasted about an hour each. Specific department I interviewed with, I did not feel confident after.
Interview Questions: Many Behavioral questions, expect to give examples of explaining a time when this happened and what you did when this happened.

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Very long-winded, inefficient process. I applied online and concurrently reached out to a contact in the organization. Initial phone interview with the hiring team, then in-person interview, then phone interview with HR, then another in-person interview. There were also "assignments" required for the in-person interviews. They definitely need to streamline this process, especially for candidates who don't get an offer.
Interview Questions: Why MSK? What other opportunities are you considering? Lots of behaviorial, "what would you do if" questions.

title: SKI Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online got an email. Schedule interview. Meet with HR, then hiring manager, then PI and full staff. If that goes well they will ask for references. Good luck!
Interview Questions: Tell us how you deal with conflict at work?

title: Clinical Trial Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very extensive interview process since I was one of the first CRAs to get hired. Be prepared for multiple rounds of interviews, culminating with one with a PI. Speak about your leadership experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a CRA?

title: POA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Overall, the interview process was pretty long. It started off with an onsite interview with HR, followed by an interview with the managers of the future department I would work for. Finally, the last interview is with the physician you will work for. The most difficult part of the interview are with the managers since all of their interview questions are solely behavioral based.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you handled a situation with tact

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online. Received an invitation for phone screen 2 days later.
In person interview with Recruiter and Hiring Manager a week later.
Sent email to follow up on status. Was completely ignored.
Interview Questions:
Behavioral Interview.
Tell me a time you went above and beyond for a patient.

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with the recruiter, who then asked me for my availabilities. I went in the next week for an interview with the nurse leader. I had two rounds of interviews: first with the nurse leader and charge nurse and second with three staff nurses. I was very nervous because it was my dream job. I didn't think I did well. The next week I got an email asking for five references, which were done within three days. However, I did not hear back until a few days later when I emailed HR and was told that I did not get the job. Overall a fast process and straightforward.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application then had a brief phone interview. Was asked to come up for an additional interview. First was a series of questions (interviewed by two people) then had a final interview.
Interview Questions: What do you know about MSK? Why are you a good fit for the Session Assistant position?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: they ask about previous research experience. you meet with lots of different professors. it is a tough experience but exciting. you really need to know the ins and outs of all your previous research and not just the top line.
Interview Questions: they ask about previous research experience

title: Regulatory Research Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: You are first interviewed by HR, then Management, and there is a third interview with a clinician... Just walk in confident, you need a bit of experience, but most of it can be learned on the job
Interview Questions: Explain your experience?

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: There were multiple interviews. The 1st one was a phone call. The 2nd one was a virtual interview. The 3rd one was in-person with the managers. If you get selected you then meet with the doctor you would be an office coordinator for. If they like you, you will most likely be hired.
Interview Questions: How you you describe yourself?

title: Organizational Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Video interview to start followed by in person interview that included conversations, facilitating a session with the team, and offering a diagnostic.  There was also an IQ test that had to be completed live while on site
Interview Questions: How would I work with someone who may have less organization development experience than me

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process is long, but worth it. It was about 3 months from application to offer. Here is a outline of the timeline:
- Applied online directly on the website
- Month passed. Then HR reached out to me via email inviting me to do an initial phone screen.
- Next week, had a phone screen. Asked me to walk through my resume.
- Week passed. HR set up a phone interview with the hiring manager later that week. More in depth questions.
- Week passed. Informed that they wanted me to come in for an in person interview.
- The in-person interview was 3 weeks later.
- Before the in-person, I was asked to do an online personality assessment (consisted of 2 sections about an hour each) (not sure how this is used in the interview process)
- For the in-person, I spent a half-day at MSK and met with 4 people about an hour each
- 3 weeks after that I received an offer.

Things to note - they require 5 references, in some cases 2 out of 5 have to be one of your past/present managers. Make sure you can answer why MSK and why this role. Also, make sure to follow up during the process if you haven’t heard anything. They did a very good job of keeping me in the loop.
Interview Questions: How would you rate your Excel skills (out a score of 10)? Why did you rate yourself that?

title: Practice Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: They start off by a phone/video interview in which they ask you about 3 behavioral interview question. If you pass that they set you up on an in person interview with 2 Administrative Coordinators who ask you about 10-15 behavioral questions and situations. If they like you, an HR person will call you and set you up on another interview to meet with the physician/surgeon and than you have to do a reference check.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had a conflict with another employee?

title: Bioinformatics Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I received a coding challenge and a phone screen (I don't remember which order). I came in for the in person interview from 10-5, met with colleagues and directors. Asked about my past experiences and workflows. Small amount of coding questions. Everyone was kind.
Interview Questions: What programs have you used for variant analysis?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Four interviews all lengthy consisting of multiple behavioral questions  interviews were all scheduled close together and process was quit quick. Go in prepared and review and think of examples to answer “tell me a time when you had to” 
Ex: meet multiple deadlines
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you had to meet multiple deadlines anf how you handled it

title: Research Study Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: First phone interview with HR, then in person with supervisor and manager, asked back to meet with head of department and chief md. They requested references through skill survey and then made me an offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research experience

title: Application Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: 3 rounds of interviews with different level of management. 2 interviews one day and additional another day. Questions were pretty standard--tell me a time you encountered an issue and how to resolved. Tell me about yourself, etc.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in the position?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Video interview and in person interview on site. On site interview consisted of only behavioral questions. They weren't based on your resume. They just want to know how you act in different situations
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when...

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was screened by a recruiter and interviewed for around 20 minutes on the phone. I was told that I would interview with a direct manager first and then move on to higher level managers if I passed the first round. However, I interviewed with two managers and the director all at once. It was around an hour and a half.
Interview Questions: What was one error I made as a professional?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was called about 2 weeks after applying online, and scheduled a phone screen interview. The phone screen took about 10 minutes and I was asked pretty generic questions about my research experience and clinical experience. They then said I would need to come in for 2 more interviews over the next month, which seemed a little excessive.
Interview Questions: What kind of research experience do you have?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions:
A couple of weeks after I applied for the position, I received an email from a recruiter asking to set up a phone interview.  The phone interview lasted about 10 min and she asked very basic questions just to get to know me.  We proceeded to set up a video interview for later in the week.  The video interview was with the recruiter where she went on to ask me questions about the company and also situational questions from past experiences.  For the situational questions I was required to answer using the STAR method (important to know what this is).  The video interview lasted around 30 min and once it was complete, we set up a date for me to come in and meet with two Administrative Coordinators and the recruiter, herself.  I met with the recruiter first and it was a very brief conversation.  She provided me with helpful interview tips that will help make the interview go a lot smoother.  The interview with the Administrative Coordinators lasted around an hour and I had to responded using the STAR method.  That interview went well and the following week I met with the Doctor I would be working for. The Doctor asked me questions to get to know me and was very nice.  

Everyone in this hospital is very nice and wants to make sure you are a good fit for the company.   The questions were about the hospital, past experiences, and myself.  It is important to know what the STAR method is in advance to help you when it comes time to interview.
Interview Questions: Tell mw what you know about the hospital?

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I was first screened on the phone then called in for an interview on my campus. The interview was very simple and the questions were based on experience and examples of times you have provided customer service and care to clients.
Interview Questions: When was one time you went above and beyond to help a patient?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Absolutely horrible. The talent acquisition recruiter reached out to me for a phone screen and to discuss my background for the open role I applied to in addition to upcoming roles; stated the conversation was great and there would be a definite follow up the hiring manager for an interview/next steps, never happened, months later, silence. Very unprofessional. I’m glad I saw this before going any further.. No need to work there with that nonsense.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about your experience and background. 

What are you looking for in your next role?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions:
Only did the first interview, but was a pretty negative experience. The hiring manager had zero interest in the conversation and his lack of enthusiasm killed my interest in working for MSK.

He also clearly struggled to understand his own interview questions to which I asked for clarification.  But overall, the conversation felt incredibly monotonous and robotic.
Interview Questions: What clients have you had?

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, in- person interview, and then interview with hiring managers. The in- person interviews are on the same day and you need to travel via train or bus to the other location. Make sure to prepare in advance and dress the part. I personally believe that I was qualified and that I answered everything they asked but not up to their standards.
Interview Questions: Behavioral based questions

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Process was about 2 weeks, I applied online first and then had a phone screen then a video chat then an in person interview with two managers. I was hired and interviewed with a doctor and her nurse.  Have your references on stand by to fill out a survey as it is requested and they might be contacted for verification
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions : describe a time you went above and beyond for your job or in school, what is a time you could have done more?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Received email request from HR recruiter to schedule phone screen, during the phone screen scheduled the in-person interview with hiring manager. Heard I was not chosen via email about a week later. Overall from application to final email was about a month.

Honestly, the hiring manager was pretty rude during the interview, checking her phone, clearly not paying attention to my responses. Advice to HR and hiring managers: We are interviewing you just as much as you are interviewing us, be a little courteous.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a difficult situation and how you handled it.

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: The most difficult part was getting HR to want you and want to send your resume to whichever department they believe would be a good fit. That process alone took me personally 3 months (although to be fair my schedule was messed up because my college graduated later than most). However once they wanted to submit your resume to people, that process from beginning to start date was roughly 3 months.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with people who you may not get along with?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed through my school and it was a terrible experience. The proctors were late to my first interview so we had to reschedule. The first interview occurred in September and (when it finally happened after rescheduling twice) was fine. It was just a preliminary check up to see my interest and if I was well qualified. The second interview didn't happen until January and that was after I kept emailing the Talent Acquisition Specialist about the details of the second interview which I was told would happen before winter break would start.  That did not happen of course. I was emailed over winter break if I would be available to come in on a Thursday to interview at an office location. I had booked my plane tickets for winter break in October so I was nowhere near NYC for any of these available time slots so I asked for accommodations. My second interview was with a Clinical Research Supervisor. The questions were more focused on my qualifications and skills and scenario questions to see how I would fit in the working environment. I really enjoyed this interview and the CRS. She answered a lot of my questions and gave me a better perspective of the job  and the company.  She recommended me for a third interview right away. I waited months just to hear about a third interview. And when I did, the Talent Acquisition Specialist told me that he apologized for the inconvenience but the department that I wanted to work with had been irresponsible in setting up their interviews and that I would be interviewed as soon as possible. This is now spring break (mid-March). Finally, when I did have an interview with the CRS of the department I wanted to work in,  there were audio problems AND apparently they had changed the job description from when I first interviewed in September. This was a shock to me and the new position wasn't as great of a fit. After this 6-month interview process, it took them 2 days to make a decision about me. The rejection email came from an automated server which was an even bigger kick to the gut. I understand that this is a well-reputable company but this was no way to treat a potential candidate. There was no organization and the timeline was just ridiculous. I found out a month later that the Talent Acquisition Specialist I had personally worked with had left the company so i have no idea of knowing whether my experience is due to his ignorance or if other people were treated just as unfairly.
Interview Questions: If you were struggling with the work, what signs would you show so I as your supervisor know that you need assistance?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I first had a phone screening, then my first in person meeting with with the research manager and the project coordinator together. Then, there was an in person spanish assessment where you have to rate your proficiency before you come in for the interview. At the interview, you speak with the language coordinator in spanish (it was very conversational and casual), then you have to do some translating, and read your answer out loud. Then, the final interview was with the PI!
Interview Questions: what are 3 words your supervisor would you to describe you? what 3 words would your best friend use?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, 1st interview with direct managers, 2nd interview with more senior staff. Offer was extended after references. The process is a long process and after the offer is extended, a background check, medical clearance and drug testing is needed. As part of the medical clearance, TB test must be done. I suggest if you are in the reference stage to make sure you have 2 TB test done.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: SSA I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: great experience and easy , nurse leader was very nice. Was very detailed about the job and what to expect. It was more of a conversation then an interview and it made it feel easy
Interview Questions: patient care questions in regards to safety

title: Human Resources Analyst, Workforce Insights Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and had a phone screening with the hiring manager two days letter. She was very excited about my candidacy and invited me to an in-person interview two weeks later. During this interview, I met with her and another manager I would dotted line report in to. Both conversations were very easy. Throughout the whole process it sounded like she had really wanted to hire me. About a week after the interview, the hiring manager called me and tells me a key person left their position so they were re-evaluating the role. During this call she literally offered me the job and asked for my salary requirements(said "we would love to hire you but we have to iron a few things out first) and told me I should expect a call in two weeks with a final decision. Two weeks come and go, I never hear back from her. I emailed to follow up and receive her out of office so I check online and they filled the position days ago and never had the decency to even send me a form rejection! I put other jobs on hold (probably very naively) because she essentially offered me the job or at least I thought she did. This was the leader of talent acquisition I was dealing with too! I'll never apply to this company again.
Interview Questions: Walk me through your resume

title: Clinical Lab Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: First of all I got phone screen interview from HR after one month  from the date I applied this job. A week later , I went to the hospital for in-person interview. In the next day, they sent me an email that asked me to put down 5 references . From that moment, I hear no feedback from them .
Interview Questions: What’s your plan in 5 years

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone screen with a recruiter. She talked about the details about the position. It's been about 2 weeks and I am still waiting on the decision regarding the position.
Interview Questions: Why does this role interest you?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Applied online on website and got an email to schedule phone interview. Phone interview was with HR and was quite short and straight to the point. He asked if I was able to commit at least 2 years. After the phone screening an  in-person interview was scheduled. In- person interview was with someone from HR and was about 15 minutes. They were going to let you know if you got the job a week later.
Interview Questions: What are your future plans? Name a situation where you showed leadership. Name an instance where you were stressed and how did you handle that situation?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: The whole process took about 3 weeks. It started with a video interview with an HR representative. She told me about the salary, hours, described the basic job post, and asked if I was interested. I was then asked to tell a little bit about myself and my background.  She scheduled an interview with a supervisor in that department the next week. That interview was very conversational and asked a lot of behavioral questions. Then I was asked to provide 5 references. After those references went through, I was scheduled to interview with the boss of the first interviewer. Again the interview was conversational and focused on behavioral questions as well as making sure I was a good fit for the team.  I was offered the job later that day.
Interview Questions:
Describe a time your work was criticized and how you handled it. 

Describe a difficult situation and how you handled it. 

What do you like to do in your free time?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Received an email from HR two days later to schedule an in-person interview. Went in for the interview and met with HR, I was asked lot of behavioral questions. She liked my answers so I moved to the second part of the interview where I meet with the hiring managers. They asked me a bunch of questions. The entire process was all done in 1 day. Took about 2 hours.
Interview Questions: What can you see yourself contributing to this department. When have you gone above and beyond for a patient. How did you solve an issue in the work place.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Got a phone interview with the team lead. He started with the team role and what his team is looking for.  After that, he went through the review with me. Gave me chance to ask questions as well.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with Market Research?

title: Authorization Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: The overall process took 2+ months. I got a call for phone interview after 4+ weeks I applied for the position. It was a longest phone interview I ever had so far. We had 40 mins phone interview. Most of the questions that the HR asked are common and to be expected. At the end of conversation she invited me to come in  for an in-person interview. For in-person interview, I met with 2 supervisors who took turn ask me a bunch of behavioral questions and they expected you to be very detail with your answers. It is VERY important to use STAR method answer their questions. This interview last about 45 mins. I received email the next day that they would like for me to meet with their manager. She is very nice and approachable. She asked me alot of specific questions about my skills and experience on the position I applied for. She also talked about how the department runs, what is the work culture there and the expectation. At the end of interview, she told me that they will contact me back within few weeks.  A week later, I recieved references request email and get an offer a week after I submitted references.
Interview Questions: What make you different from other candidates?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the job online. Got a call from a recruiter. There were multiple position available the positionI applied for did not list two or more year requirement. But when the recruiter asked me this question and he told me it was a requirement and that he could not proceed with me as an applicant.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Memorial Sloan Kettering?

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a miserable experience. I was asked a lot of questions about conflict within teams and between friends. I was also asked the same question in different ways. I have never left an interview feeling badly but this interview made me question everything. I was told that the interviewers must stay true to their process and that I would hear back in two weeks once they had reviewed all applicants. The same day as my interview I was asked to come back for a second interview. I still felt very uneasy from the nature of interview and so I spoke to a mentor of mine about the question style and she explained to me that it may be very concerning that I was asked those types of questions because it could mean that conflict or nurse bullying is an issue on that floor. I am hoping that is not the case because I wouldn’t want to work in that type of environment.
Interview Questions: Being in a situation with drama and how it was resolved

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: The phone interviewer was very nice and friendly. Make sure you have your personal questions that you'd like to ask. Series of different interviews to be expected. Overall the interview went well. It is a great company to want to work for.
Interview Questions: How did you learn about this hospital?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I feel like I was juggled around and gipped a little bit. I applied for a position for a particular lab and got through two rounds of interviews out of the three - four that happen if all goes well. I was asked to pick a date and time to interview for this lab, and it was never confirmed, so I unfortunately wasn’t able to meet with the team, and the position was given to someone else. Not to fret I thought, the clinical supervisor was kind enough to recommend I apply for a position that just  popped up while in limbo. She said she thought my credentials better matched and I may have a better chance. I accepted, and interviewed for it. The third interview for this other lab was 2 hours with meeting four different team members and answering pretty redundant questions (it did get tiring). The first two ladies I met with were very nice and the interview was more conversational and chatty. Next interview with the next batch of ladies was pretty neutral. 

The interview process is a bit lengthy, and it will soak up some of your time. Personally, I do not know what this specific department looks for in a candidate. It’s hard to tell seeming that my credentials and interests didn’t align with the first lab I applied for, and even with the other recommended position, I still wasn’t a match. I was emailed by a member I never even interviewed with, but I asked for feedback anyway, so I guess we will see if anything of value will come out of that. 

I don’t really see myself applying here again.
Interview Questions: Why MSKCC

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was invited for a phone screen. I was told via email that the call would last 30 minutes. The recruiter called promptly and proceeded to talk for close to 20 minutes - about the hospital, hospital management, the HR department, HR management, the HR team, and on and on.  She gave way more granular information than was really necessary for this first round. She then asked a few short questions - why MSK, why I was looking for a new opportunity, what I like about HR, and what I don't like. That was it. By the end of the call I knew this wasn't going anywhere and not surprisingly I got an email a few days later thanking me for my time. I think I was just unlucky with the recruiter I talked to. I'd like to apply again and hopefully get a different recruiter who takes the time to learn about me and my background.
Interview Questions: Why MSKCC?

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: The Health Plan follows ACOG″ guidelines and does not allow additional reimbursement for multiple births when all babies are delivered by c-section. “Delivery only” codes include 59514, and 59620. Modifier 22 can be attached to the global or “delivery only” c-section code if the physician work required for the multiple births is substantially greater than typically required. o Documentation supporting the additional work must be submitted with the claim in order for additional reimbursement for Modifier 22 to be considered.
Interview Questions: age

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Was first contacted by a talent recruiter. She asked if I would be available the following day for a brief introductory phone interview. At the end of this interview, she suggested that we move forward to second rounds with a virtual video interview the following day.  A week later I was contacted that I had been invited for a final round interview in person with both the talent recruiter and the department managers.
Interview Questions:
Name a time when you were working on a team and you disagreed with your team workers. How did you approach it? 

Name a time when you went above and beyond for a patient? 

Why MSK? 

Why this role?

What do you know about MSK?

title: Data Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: My interview went well. I learned about the legal side of the company. They should contact the person letting them know they didnt get the job instead of having them wait and guessing for weeks and months.
Interview Questions: Why are you looking to leave your employer?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I was first contacted by someone in HR who I spoke on the phone briefly with. I then went to HR and met with them in person, before meeting with a Supervisor and Manager in the department. The final interview was with the Doctor. Each interview lasted about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Questions about time management

title: RSA Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: It was very thorough from the phone call to the sit down interview with the talent acquisition specialist in HR to the hiring manager.  In later years and higher positions, I also had to interview with the MD in the department I was applying to.  Overall experience was pleasant.
Interview Questions: Can I give them 2 years?

title: Laboratory Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by HR and scheduled for two interviews.  I thought they went very well.  It was not my first interview with MSK  and I always make it to the last two candidates but they offer the other one always for a simple reason.  They don't hire anyone from outside the institute but they move people around especially for managerial positions.  I was informed that they offered another candidate but they offered me a lab supervisor instead.  It was strange because I met with the lab supervisor until I realized she was the one who took the position.  I did not accept the offer.  In summery and as I said before, they do NOT hire people from outside the institute, they move their employees around.  I agree that their services are great but when it comes to management they need to update their system and hire new skilled people who can bring new ideas to MSK.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I applied previously back in December, and was not offered a position because as per the Talent Acquisition Rep, I came off too strong a candidate, and the doctor I was interviewing for felt that I was a bit overqualified for the position. 

A few weeks ago, that same rep reached out to me for another opening that just recently posted, and asked if I would be interested. I said of course, and was immediately asked to meet with two supervisors.  All seemed to be going pretty well, and the questions that were asked pertained to my experience (*STAR-method [see note below]), education, and if I would be willing to work in a facility other than the position that opened up, which I said yes to as well. This interview lasted almost about an hour, so be prepared to be there for a while, and be sure to use the restroom or grab a bite to eat beforehand!

Two days later, I was asked if I would be able to come in to meet with the provider that I would potentially be working for.

I met with the doctor, who was very kind and easy going. She asked me about my personal goals and didn’t make me feel uncomfortable at all. They want to make sure that you are good fit for the company, and just as much as you’d like to work for them, they want you to work for them too! 

*the STAR method, in addition to previous interviews that I read on Glassdoor definitely helped prepare me this go around. If you don’t know what the STAR method is, please google it! Most of the questions were behavioral based, and require through detail and explaining. You don’t have to go in depth, but after reading the STAR-method process in answering behavioral questions, you’ll understand how to respond, and trust me, going in there prepared is the best way to be!
Interview Questions:
How do you handle difficult patients?
What are two of your greatest strengths and two of your greatest weaknesses?
Why do you want to work for MSKCC?
What drew you to the healthcare field?
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I always knew that mskcc was an amazing company with amazing values, and going through the whole interview process and meeting people that work there, makes you even more amazed how everyone there is genuinely dedicated to cancer care. Its a truly humbling environment to be in and talent acquistion makes sure they are hiring the best candidates who have the same values. I applied online, got contacted by talent aquisiton a few weeks later. we had a 10 minute phone interview, and she invited me for an interview in manhattan. She was the sweetest peerson in the world, really makes you feel comfortable! The interview was difficult because they want you to answer in the STAR method (make sure you learn this!!) and is totally behavioral based. After the questions portion, she went over all my answers stating what i did good and could have improved on. She went over the whole interview with me and gave me examples of ways that i could have improved my answers. She was the sweetest person in the world, and i really really appreciated the feedback she gave me. She then told me to wait for the shuttle that would take me to main campus to meet the program chair/supervisor. She was so awesome too! the kindest souls in the world. Had a short interview with her and then she took me around the facility showing me all the floors, introducing me doctors and faculty. it was really great! I sent a thank you email, and didn't hear back for 2 weeks, but then i was notified that another candidate had been chosen. I was really bummed, but understood! The talent aq i had the inteview with then contacted me a few days later asking if i would like to interview for another poa position, and I attended a series of interviews: with 2 admin coordinators, 1 department head, met the 2 docs, and 2 poas of the department. She then contacted me the next day saying I got the job! I was so happy! This time around, I used the feedback she ha given me during my interview to really prepare for the 2nd one she sent me on, I was so grateful! The most amazing and helpful people you'll meet along the way, who are truly passionate about the mission of mskcc. Study the interview questions that people post on glassdoor, and just be yourself!
Interview Questions: What do you know about mskcc

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got an email from HR several days later. We set up a brief phone call. Interviewer seemed rushed, but very friendly and energetic. I was told I would be invited in for another interview with another member of HR, but this person has yet to contact me.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Memorial Sloan Kettering?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: A 45 minute interview with two managers. It was a lot of STAR method questions so be prepared to speak of your prior work experience. If you read through the interview questions on Glassdoor you will be more than prepared.
Interview Questions: Name a time you went above and beyond for a customer/patient?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: 3 rounds, thoroughly goes through your resume and asked many fundamental questions. Research experience required and each round had different people and question. Everyone was very supportive and nice.
Interview Questions: Asked about explaining what I did for each thing mentioned in the resume

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: This was one of the least professional and rudest interview experience I have ever had. A week after submitting my resume, I received an e-mail about a phone interview. The first question I was asked was why I wanted to leave my current job. Before I had the chance to explain that I was relocating for personal reasons, the HR interviewer cut in and said, "you know if you burn bridges at your current job, they may never hire you again." I though this was an extremely judgmental comment, and very hindering in the progression of the conversation. Furthermore, I felt the interviewer did not have much experience with healthcare. He made illogical assumptions based on my resume, and was very unresponsive when I tried to clarify. I am hesitant to reapply to an organization whose HR department is so hostile.
Interview Questions: Why MSK?

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews, one with talent acquisition specialist, the other with clinical care managers. STUDY UP ON BEHAVIORAL QUESTIONS/STAR SCENARIOS. Overall process took two weeks. One annoying thing is that they make you submit 5 references after the fact. A little bit too meticulous.
Interview Questions: Name a time where you worked with a team and they had a different work style than you had.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Started with a phone interview with someone from the HR department. Next step was a face interview (on a different date) with the nurse leader of the specific department I applied for.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had applied more than fifty times to different positions and was only selected for an interview 5 times. To summarize: Be patient. Different supervisors look for different things in the applicant. Don't take rejection personally. Was asked to come in for an interview and then a second interview a week later where I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: I asked about problems that they would like me to tackle and offered my proposed solutions. Was given a typing test on the spot so be prepared.

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for the Session Assistant position. Overall it was a fairly quick process. I interviewed over the phone and then scheduled my second round of interviews within the same week. I then met with 2 supervisors in the NYC office who asked several behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you had to work with team members or coworkers who thought differently than you

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (Basking Ridge, NJ) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed to be a Physician Office Assistant and they liked me so much but moved on with someone else, so they decided to offer me another position as a Session Assistant I! This actually turned out to be better than what I wanted so I think this will be great :D
Interview Questions: Can you name a time when you were flexible at work? Something that came out of nowhere and you had to handle it.

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with HR person . Followed by in-person interview with nurse leader then I had to do indivdual interview with the physicians. It was a very long processed.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving current position?

title: Clinical Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: very brief, not comprehensive, just a body to fill a seat since they had the budget. The interview did not give you the ability to assess the job properly and did not meet any of the team members.
Interview Questions: tell us about your background

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
