Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through the college center for career and professional service. Submitted my resume and cover letter and received an offer for an interview. Had an initial phone screening with HR (Talent Acquisition), and an in person interview with HR. Then got offered a second round interview at the institution where I met with HR first, and then the PI and other lab members.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions rather than experiential. Like how I have dealt with difficult situations, how I work with others, etc

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Took a few hours, first had HR interview, then sent me to the research building in a shuttle. The first part of the interview with HR was easy with basic behavioral questions. The next part was with the lab's principal investigator who asked  about past experiences and work specific questions. After this got escorted to a conference room with about seven people from the lab who asked more work and experience related questions.  Robust past experience wasn't required as they explained they would teach everything in the lab. Overall experience was laid back with this group and the people were nice and fun to speak with. In the end gave me a short tour of the lab. About a week or two later got a call and a mail for reference and invitation for offer.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with mice before?

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (Basking Ridge, NJ) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Met with two higher ups who asked me about 7-8 Questions, then met with the head manager who asked me 3 questions of her own. I was told 24 hours later that I wasn’t hired.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: 3 interviews with senior admin and human resources. It was a thorough interview with a lot of discussion of past experience, future goals and what I hoped to accomplish with the role.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where something broke and you had to create a process to fix it.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position the day it was posted on the website. I interviewed for the same position at another location but was told they wanted to go with internal applicants. So I was then set up for another interview 2 days later. I was nervous but confident. The Nurse Manager i interviewed with was pleasant and very informative. She allowed me to speak on my experience and gave me insight as to what i would be doing on a day to day basis. After my interview she set me up to receive a tour of the floor i would work on and i had the opportunity to meet other PCT's, doctors and some nurses. It was quite the experience! I spent about 3 hours there. The culture is definitely welcoming, professional and i was very comfortable.  I got an email the next day to give them 5 references. Lastly i just recieved my job offer email! I am so excited and truly happy. Words can not describe how i feel. To all job seekers one thing ive learned is to be prepared. Learn as much as you can about the company. Be confident be prepared come ready to show why you are the best candidate. I can not wait to begin my successful employee journey at MSKCC!! Good luck to everyone applying!!
Interview Questions: I was asked to talk about a position I've held in the past and how it relates to this current position.

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions:
Applied. 2-3 weeks later got an email about a phone screen that would take place in 1 week. Phone screen was basic. 3 days later got a call about an interview in 2 weeks. Interview was supposed to be with a coordinator but the HR guy interviewed me instead. It was fine but he rushed me and didn't seem interested in me at all.  After multiple emails trying to get feedback or some type of response, I got a rejection THREE WEEKS LATER. 

Process is too long for the benefits of the position. I wouldn't do it again at all. They need to learn to value other people's time as well. I would go for another position for sure that pays more and has a reason to spend weeks and weeks of wishful thinking. Maybe it was just my experience but I read a lot of other similar reviews and I am not a bad interviewer and have a lot of experience as well (not to brag or anything) just wanna give you perspective
Interview Questions: Basic behavioral stuff. They didn't even look at me when I answered just typed away like a robot.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: It was supposed to be a 15 minute interview that was scheduled. The interviewer called five minuets late and only interviewed for eight minutes.  I couldn’t even understand the name she gave. I feel the late call and not understanding set a bad tone for the interview
Interview Questions: What about sloan kettering made you want to apply.

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (North Bergen, NJ) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: I went on 5 interviews in 4 days (it only took so long because of the holiday season and the snow storm). I met with HR, the clinical research supervisor for the specific department, a clinical research manager, a project manager, and a doctor. Everyone was nice and welcoming. After the first interview you have to send 5 references. The CRMS asked a lot of “Tell me about a time when...” questions and the doctor was more so concerned about your future plans and if what you’re interested in is relevant to the job/department you’re applying to. I got a call 2 days after my last interview and was offered the position.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time when you and a group had a disagreement on a project and how you resolved it?
How do you deal with stress?
Why MSK? How do you believe you got into this position?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: I first had a quick phone interview and was then called in for an in-person interview.  I never heard back from them after the in-person interview despite many phone calls and emails
Interview Questions: What interests you about research and are you okay with working as part of such a large team?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a resume and cover letter, and was invited to interview over Skype. I interviewed with two people at the same time. They were really nice and answered all the questions I had. They asked basic personality questions as well as behavioral questions. There were a lot of questions regarding experience working in teams.
Interview Questions: Name a time when there was an issue working in a group, and discuss how you resolved the issue.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Was invited to spend the day with my prospective supervisor and colleagues. Gave a Talk about my previous research project, and got the opportunity to learn about the ongoing projects in the lab through individual interviews with all team members. I was even invited to attend a presentation from an invited speaker at the institution.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in joining this lab?

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, got a phone call from recruiter a few days later, had a phone interview, and a skype interview, now flying out for a in person interview. Good experience so far.
Interview Questions: All behavioral- tell a time you worked with a difficult person

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Overall, the process took about two months; starting with a phone screening by HR and then multiple onsite interviews before extending an offer.  To be honest, the biggest reason I declined the offer was because HR was so disorganized and didn't really show effort or care for me as a candidate. HR contacted me about a possible interview date/time and I responded asking if there was a later time available... He never responded to any calls or emails for the next 6 days  and then called me on the interview day to ask me if I could still come in despite knowing I was pretty far away.  I was also given the wrong department to interview with twice. And then when I finally received an offer, I was never given an official offer letter and he took almost a week to get back to me about details of the offer and whether benefits and compensation could be negotiated. Anyway, moving on to the actual interview process itself...

The first onsite interview is with HR. You're mostly asked about your qualifications and then given information about pay and benefits. This usually lasts about half an hour and then you get shuttled off to the main hospital to meet your prospective direct supervisors.  The department manager (your boss's boss) actually joined in the interview too which saved me time from coming in again. The questions were pretty standard: Why MSK? Tell me about yourself? What is your weakness? They seemed to be more behavioral questions rather than technical questions. This process lasted about an hour and was probably the most enjoyable part of the process. The people at MSK are clearly very competent and enjoy the work that they are doing.  They very personable and helped me understand the environment I'd be working in including the cons.

After that first day, I was invited back to a second round of interviews to meet the program manager (your boss's boss's boss). The questions were also pretty standard and mostly related to how you deal with conflict/ how well you can work in a team.  The interview lasted a quick hour since it was mostly conversational.

And then finally there was a third round of interviews with the attending physicians. I met with two people consecutively for about half an hour each. Strangely enough, these were by far the least technical interviews. I was barely asked about my experiences and qualifications; it was mostly questions about cultural fit and future plans.  One doctor said something like "Honestly, this position doesn't require someone who is really smart and knows a lot. The work we do here is very simple, you just need to use common sense and be hardworking." It seemed like they were just looking for someone who would be reliable and will work well with the team. 

I received a verbal (phone call) offer from HR the next day.  I was interviewing with multiple companies at the time and asked for more information about their package so that I could compare them to my other offers but it took a lot of time before HR responded to me.

In the end, I decided to go with a different company.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in the next 5 years? Why Memorial Sloan Kettering? Did you ever have a conflict with a coworker; How did you resolve it? Are you a more extroverted person or an introverted person?  Can you make a 2 year commitment?

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Fill out online assessment, phone interview, in-person interview. I applied online through my university and filled out a lengthy assessment. After which, I was invited for a phone interview. The phone interview was extremely brief with an overview of what the position may entail. The subsequent in-person interview was with 2 HR personnel. They were friendly and the interview went well.
Interview Questions: When have you gone above and beyond for a patient?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Received email to set up phone screen. Had the phone screen following day and asked to come in for second interview. Interviewed following week for 3 hours with HR person first, then 2 supervisors for department, then hiring manager for the entire research department. Following week I received another email being invited for second round interviews with one of the service doctors followed by 2 RSAs in the service I was interviewing for. Went home that day and received email asking for 5 references. References were completed within the next 3 days. Didn’t hear back for 3 weeks with constant emails for an update. Finally recruiter emailed saying they would email department for final update. Didn’t hear back for 2 weeks. Then got told over a voice mail that “they are no longer moving forward with that position” but would love to move forward with interviews in other services. Never heard from them again. High hopes over a long period of time to be let down in the end.
Interview Questions: Name a time you went above and beyond for someone?

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was  a phone interview first and then a video interview. They want you to go into a good amount of detail on previous work experiences and situations that you have dealt with.
Interview Questions: Explain a time that you went above and beyond for a patient or a customer.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: At first, I had a phone  interview with the HR department then met with them in person. They asked me if about my employment history and if I was comfortable with the salary they're paying for this position. I then made a counter offer. We settled with a number before going to the physical interview.  The interview process was  a very comfortable experience. The interviewer was polite and made me feel comfortable.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for this company?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: They're really interested in your future plans, especially if you intend on going to graduate school cause the position usually requires a 1-2 year commitment. Overall, average process. It's easier if you have previous research experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (Basking Ridge, NJ) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was via webcam, then another meeting in person on location (two interviews), and later another interview with the physician I'd be working with. Interview questions were behavioral based and difficult to quickly answer. Physician asked me "When can you start?" After leaving that interview I thought I had pretty much had the job, but came to find out another candidate was hired the next day.
Interview Questions: What's a word used to describe you that was surprising?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: The process was very long. I was worried towards the end. I almost gave up, but when you realize how far you've come it motivates you to keep going. I did a total of 4 interviews. The last one is the easiest because the doctor only wants to get to know you. Once you pass the interviews with the recruiter, 2 admin coordinators, and submit your 5 references, the job is about 90% in your hands. You only have to tell the doctor and their nurse about your job and school history. The interview with the admin coordinators was LONG, but I did not feel it because I knew I was qualified, and that's what they want to see if you have what it takes to be a part of the team. They ask several behavioral questions, so be prepared to give examples for each question. Believe it or not, glass door helped me get the job, I studied the questions other people posted. Most of them are the same. DO RESEARCH ON THE HOSPITAL AS WELL. Even if you only know when MSKCC was first founded, and who they were founded by. Good luck!
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Safety Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: The process was very decieving and unprofessional. I received a phone screen at first which seemed harmless enough. One week later I receive an email requesting an in person meeting with very inflexible dates and times. To meet this requirement I had to use a vacation day from my current position. I receive a mass email which was sent to all interviewers on the day before my email reminding me that I would be meeting with a Director and the HR Generalist. Upon arrival there are 4 additional interviewers. Furthermore, the team informs me that the job I applied for would be for off hour shifts. Very unprofessional to not list that little bit of knowledge in the description for the posting. After finishing the interview I am informed they still have weeks of interviews left, which means there was no rush in the first place for me  I make this interview. I still have not heard anything back and this has been a month. I am very upset with the whole process and would never recommend anyone who is marketable to apply through this hospital.
Interview Questions: How would you perform a risk assessment?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: It was smooth, and everyone was friendly from HR to the hiring manager. Be ready to answer situational questions and how you fit in the department.  I heard back from HR in two weeks.  Goodluck!
Interview Questions: Why MSKCC?

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: They called me and had a phone interview with HR. After that a week later I had recieved a call to get an in person interview. Pretty straightforward, asked a series of situational questions. Took about 30-40 minutes. Two people ask you questions. Just send a proper email
Interview Questions: What are your plans for the future

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through a college recruiting fair and had an in-person interview, which they said was the first step in the hiring process for Spring 2018 college graduates. Had the second interview a few months later.
Interview Questions: Describe an experience where you worked with other members of your team, all of whom had different perspectives, to solve a difficult problem.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Set up interview with Talent Acq. and went through a few basic behavioral questions. Then once this was finished, took a shuttle across town to the office for the specific department where I met with two supervisors then the research manager.
Interview Questions: What would you do in a situation when you have conflicting orders from a supervisor vs. PI?

title: Biostatistics Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: One round, technical questions. The interviewer was very nice and he was also my supervisor later on.  It was on site one on one, lasted for less than 30 mins.
Interview Questions: The interviewer asked me to go over my resume and talk about the projects I did, softwares I used. Then he asked me how long have I been using R. No behavioral questions.

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was reached out to for an interview within 2 weeks, had an interview with someone from HR, then a project manager, and finally a physician. Interview process took a week, and 5 references were required.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you worked in a team and everyone had their own ideas

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Not difficult, easy-going. Interviewer was very accommodating and helpful in answering any questions about the position that I had. Also, interviewer was very clear about what my duties and responsibilities would be.
Interview Questions: Biggest weakness?

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was immediately directed towards the assessment test. Answered questions that asked about previous job, basically trying to figure out your attitude and demeanor during your former job(s). Received an email a couple days later politely saying that the position has already been filled.
Interview Questions: To what extent would your manager describe you as a team player?

title: RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Met initially with the Clinical Supervisor who explained the position and he responsibilities.  Then met with two senior. RN Case Managers who posed different scenarios.  Interview went well and I didn't feel intimidated as I have on other interviews.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a doctor that is pushing you to discharge a patient quickly while you have other patients actively being discharged as well.

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I found the listing on indeed, applied through the site, got a call within the next week and set up an interview. The initial interview was with HR and then I was sent to be interviewed by some of the department heads, which took about an hour. After going home and radio silence for a few days I was asked to go in for one more interview with some of the physicians. Soon after that, I got a call for a job offer, which I accepted
Interview Questions: HR asked a lot of "describe a situation where _____ and what did you do? Everyone else really grilled me about my skills and experience, but overall it was a pleasant experience

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online through their website, I had a recruiter reach out to me because I randomly messaged some of the recruiters on LinkedIn weeks before. I spoke to her for 5 minutes, the next day had the phone interview, 2 days later had a in-person interview in NY with 2 administrative coordinators who were amazing people. They wanted me to be comfortable and just wanted me to talk to them without being afraid. After the interview they asked me if I preferred NY or Basking Ridge location, so I chose Basking Ridge, NJ. A week later my recruiter reached out to me and told me I had an interview in Basking Ridge (Thursday) and the following day was an interview with my physician (Friday). The interview Thursday was basically the same I had in NY, I even mentioned it to them, they knew I passed the NY interview but just wanted to do the interview to get to know me since it was a different location which was fine. I knew the questions they were going to ask me since I had been through the process in NY. The physicians interview took about 10 minutes since she was so busy, she was a bit intimidating but such a sweet and intellectual woman. Just be yourself with your physician. Monday I was offered the job! 

I was extremely nervous about the initial interviews but I shouldn’t have been. The process is not as scary as most people say it is. They want you to work at the hospital just as much as you want to be there as well. Be prepared with some stories and you will be fine. Don’t forget to ask questions!
Interview Questions:
Tell us about a time you received  feedback about yourself which surprised you.  
Tell us about a time you didn't get along with a co-worker. 
Tell us about a time you let down your group. 
Tell us how we would know you are stressed.
Strengths & Weaknesses

title: Windows Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (Edison, NJ) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions:
It was a very standard  Phone interview process.  Then in person interview.
Few weeks in between steps.
HR is not very responsive and a bit careless with contact info, responses, confirmations.
Interview Questions: Windows Server, Networking, AD questions

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Online application, phone interview, then Skype interview, then onsite interview with assistant managers, then interview with director. HR called a couple days later. This was however 3 years ago and from my understanding things have changed.
Interview Questions: How did you deal with a difficult situation?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was asked through email to set up a phone interview 2+ weeks after submitting an application. After a phone interview I was asked to come in to interview with HR and then to the department of clinic managers for that specific are I applied to
Interview Questions: What was something you have accomplished in your current job that you are most proud of

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions:
A very difficult interview process that requires a lot of travel on the interviewees side. 
It seems like no matter what the interview question was, it was not the correct answer. Also, all behavioral based
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you tried and failed at something.

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Received a phone interview after submitting an online application. Moved forward with an In person interview with one of the managers on the unit I was applying for. Spent about 15 minutes talking about the manager's personal life. Wish I was Interviewed by a different individual.
Interview Questions: Why Sloan?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Had to come into the office for the interviews with the research supervisors/ administrators and then met with the doctors within the specific service on another day. Once accepted within the position I had to get medical clearance from the employee health services including PPD, vaccines/ titers. In addition there is a urine drug screen that must be completed after you submit your background check. Overall the interviewing process was not difficult, but applicants should make sure to prepare accordingly and make sure you understand the aims of the research team and what you have to offer within the department. Everyone is very nice and look to hire qualified people to join their team. When meeting with the doctors bring a positive attitude and don't let their lack of enthusiasm affect your interview.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
About two weeks ago I applied through MSKCC job portal and got a call the following day saying they wish to have an in-person interview with me. Then the next following day I went to their HR office and had the interview with their HR department at Midtown 3rd Ave. 

The interviewer was quite friendly and asked me several questions (which all are irrelevant to jobs but rather focus on personality) and introduced me about the what is the task function, where is the primary location for the position, as well as the pros and cons of the job. Quite useful!

By the way, the Salary for this position is $21/hour, approximately 42k/year.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when your group has an argument and how you managed to solve it?

title: Quality Control Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was with all the higher-ups. Then I met  with all the members of the laboratory, I would be working on with on a daily basis.  I was in the room 4 for hours and no lunch was given at all or asked for water/coffee. So I was exhausted by the end of it.
Interview Questions: STAR method questions. And a lot about what types of techniques you had used in your previous jobs.  Also, some behavioral questions as well.

title: Procurement Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
There was a phone screening, and then in-person interviews with the HR rep, the Procurement team, and an interview with the head of Procurement. Everything went well, I felt. I engaged in a lot of back and forth. They asked typical interview questions, and I came back with questions of my own.

I received an offer, but I turned it down. The HR recruiter never told me that I was applying for an entry-level position, when my resume clearly shows that I'm at a mid-career level. I found out through the Procurement department that it was entry-level. They wanted me to take a pay cut for a lower-level position, AND move to the NYC area while they offered NO relocation assistance whatsoever. I had to supply 5 references online, with 2 of them being supervisors or managers. One of the ones I had to provide was my current supervisor, who received an email survey for providing said reference. That made for a difficult conversation afterwards. When I tried to negotiate salary, the HR recruiter said "not gonna happen". There was no way that I could justify taking the job with the way everything played out.
Interview Questions: There were a few "tell me about a time when..." questions. Also asked me about a time when I failed at my job.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I applied to an unspecified lab online and heard back by email (as preferred in my application) in 2-3 weeks. They were starting up a new lab and establish the initial members. First I interviewed with the human resources representative that had contacted me. This mostly consisted of general interview questions including background, experience, and why MSKCC. This was fairly quick maybe about 30-40 minutes. 

I was shuttled to the research laboratories where I met with the PI and had a laid-back discussion/interview about the research, my specific experience/skills, and what I would be expected to be doing. I was given a break down of what my day would be like. Admittedly I was not the most qualified candidate but was reassured that most things could be taught in 1-2 months. I was told that there ideally would be an opportunity for an independent research project if things went well. This was about 35 minutes long.

Overall the whole process went fairly smoothly and everyone was nice and approachable. The interviews seemed less formal and stressful than other interviews. I was not asked for references like others have stated so I guess that was a sign that they were looking for someone  more qualified.
Interview Questions: What previous research experience do you have?

title: HR Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I had probably one of the worst interview experiences of my life here. The recruiter was wonderful but then meeting the hiring managers, two women who I'd be reporting to in Human Resources, were rude and abrasive. The second woman I met with seemed as though she was falling asleep and sighed before asking each question - almost as if she was bored.
Interview Questions: They asked if I would feel comfortable coming to them with an issue.

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Brought me into their lab and had me talk to the PI for an hour. It was mostly the PI talking about their work and asking me if I had questions. Talked very little about me. Had a very nice time. Then talked to two RSAs who I would be working with. They had me talk about my experience. I should have asked better questions about their research. Instead I asked about cultural fit, which was a mistake.
Interview Questions: Why do you find cancer research to be interesting?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Got a call from HR, Set you an interview. Was relocated to the hospital the same day to interview with the supervisor for the research group that was interested in my resume. Came back 2 weeks later to interview with the doctor in charge of the research.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you handled a difficult situation

title: Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: First talked with PI on skype about my interests and background. In person, I then gave a presentation on my graduate research project to the lab and talked more in depth with the PI and lab about available research projects.
Interview Questions: Thesis specific.

title: Session Assistant I Interview

title: Controller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position and landed an interview with Human Resources. The interview went great, the HR manager was very nice and professional. She educated me on the Foundation and the job itself. I was then called back for a second interview with the CFO (treasurer) who was also very nice. We discussed my qualifications and the reasons why I wanted the position. The following day my boss came to my office to let me know that she’d be having lunch with the CFO (treasurer) of the Alfred Sloan Foundation. I thought it was very unusual considering they had never met before. You see something highly unethical and unprofessional happened here; Without my permission The CFO (treasurer) went directly to my boss to get a reference on me and asked her to a private lunch to discuss me.  A few days after their lunch I was contacted by HR and informed that I wouldn’t be making it to the next round of interviews. To give some more context I had a very soured relationship with my boss - so by taking the lunch meeting with this very unethical unprofessional CFO (treasurer) my chances for landing the job was nill. My boss, at that time, was highly unprofessional herself so this was a perfect storm for me to lose my chance.
Interview Questions: Typical Q&A interview question format.

title: Office Assistant Interview

Interview Questions: What would you do if you and your coworkers were having issues?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and took the assessment test shortly after. I received a call that same day in the afternoon and set up a phone interview for the next day. The phone interview went well, the recruiter asked questions to get to know me and see if I was the right fit for MSK. Very friendly and enthusiastic. She then invited me for an in person interview for the following week. Again, extremely personable and friendly, which made me feel comfortable. She asked me a few behavioral questions and was taking notes. When she was done with the questions, she explained the position and salary (not negotiable). She asked me if I had time for another interview and I said yes. I was told to take the jitney to the main hospital and meet with two administrative coordinators. 
This interview was long. They had a packet of questions and were also taking notes. They like for you to use the STAR method to answer every behavioral question. You need to make sure you have relevant examples to answer these questions. After about an hour of questions and answers, they asked me if I had any questions, which I did. They went into more detail about the position. It was a great interview. 
I was then asked for a 4th interview, this time with a physician I can potentially work with. I was most nervous for this but I should not have been because it was such a pleasant conversation. No behavioral questions this time. I guess this was more of an interview to see if you're a right fit with the physician. 
I was called that same evening with an offer. It all went by so quickly, not even a week from the time I applied for the position. I would say it's a lengthy process, but I understand why. They only want the best employees there and you need that for such an important institution like MSK.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)

My on-site interview was scheduled one week later.  It was in the HR department with a TAS. TAS was very professional and asked me about some questions for about half hours. Then I was sent home. She said she would contact me about the results.  One week later, she emailed to tell me that they are considering other candidates. I was never able to make to the department.

Interview Questions: strengths?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online, did the online admin skills test and then had a phone interview with an hr person who was great. They invited me in for an interview. I did a brief interview with the hr person which was on the light side, pretty much giving me info and an idea of what to expect, and some tips to do well on the interview. about an hour later the same day I was sent to interview with two hiring managers. 

That interview was great, and they requested my references. I thought i was going to get the job but two months later ended up finding out they went with someone else.
Since they really liked me they sent me to interview with another department and I got the job! Two months but I'm finally in !

Tips: 
-These are behavioral interviews, so they want to know about diff scenarios and they want you to be VERY detailed. They are really looking for personality and how you will work with patients/physicians so if you know you'll be nervous take some time to prep on my questions and you'll do great
-As with any interview, do some research on MSKK because they asked me in both interviews.
Interview Questions:
What are your strengths and weaknesses?
Tell me about a time you encountered a problem/failed at something. What did you do to get through it?
Tell me about a time you had to work with someone you didn't get along with.
Why are you interested in MSKCC?
Tell me about a time where you took initiative.
What do you do when you're stressed/how would someone know if you were stressed? (pro tip: they shouldnt know!!)
Talk about a time you gave outstanding/above average customer service.
Tell me about a time a supervisor gave you feedback you didn't agree with.

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied on the company website and was phone screened by a recruiter about a day later. After the phone screen I did not hear anything from the recruiter for about three to four weeks. The recruiter reached out to me via email explaining that she was sorry she had not contacted me in so long and that she has new interview slots available for the role. She also asked me to do a video interview with her before meeting with the hiring managers and gave me some feedback on the role in which i was going to be interviewed for. After the skipe interview, I arrived to the in person interview 30 minutes early and was seen about an hour later. (I assumed my patience was being tested). I was interviewed by two of the hiring managers and was asked a series of behavioral "STAR" method questions. After the interview, The hiring managers gave me a sheet explaining the role again and different roles I would be eligible to apply for in the future. I was asked to have a seat in the waiting area and about five minutes later was told that the recruiter will reach out to me in about a week to let me know the next step in the hiring process. I honestly feel lost in a way because the two "hiring managers" that interviewed me didn't know that the recruiter was an actual recruiter and called her a hiring manager.  I really dont think that they need anymore staff. I declined because i feel that they are over staffed with session Assistants and that can be very difficult in the future (fighting for hours) Also your not considered an employee to the hospital until your sixth month in. (The reason i declined)
Interview Questions: Explain a time you went above and beyond for a patient?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Standard online application. One thing I noticed is that you make a profile and upload one resume and one cover letter and they get sent to all the different positions. You can not adjust documents for each position. 

Got a phone call about 4-5 days for 2 interviews at the core facility. Everyone was extremely welcoming and the lab manager seemed very impressed with my experience. The conversation went very well, we spoke for about an hour and a half, and I felt confident in my chances at getting the position. I met with the lab supervisor for the second interview the same day and this one went very quickly, about a half hour, but still very smoothly. 

I was invited back to the lab after my second interview by the lab manager to meet with the other research techs and we all got along great. The position itself was doing very basic DNA purification from stool samples, something that I had an enormous amount of experience with.

The lab manager said they would be interviewing other candidates as part of the process but that they would contact me in two weeks. I hadn't heard back from them after about three weeks so I contacted the lab manager again to inquire about my application status, which was when she informed me that they were looking for someone with more experience. 

Overall, the interview process was very relaxed and at no point did I feel under-qualified or as if I had said the wrong thing. I would say that interviewing at MSKCC is an easy process, you just really have to meet the standards they are looking for in terms of qualifications.
Interview Questions: What are you looking to gain from this experience?

title: Research Technician Interview

I would suggest to be fully prepared to answer questions about your research experience, your future plans, expectations, explanations about certain points on your resume. title: Human Resources Business Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Two phone screening interviews, following an advantageous face-to-face interview.  The face-to-face interview was very intimating and full of subtle scare tactics. While explaining my STAR scenario, the interviewer suddenly lobbed oddball questions and also started rapid-fire questioning, I guess to adopt an aggressive and argumentative attitude from me. Thought the interview I remained calm and within the first 20 minutes, I knew I wouldn't move on in the recruitment process.  Their process of interview and selection was severely outdated.
Interview Questions: Many behavioral questions like "Tell me one time you had to .... "

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Overall, it was the most pleasant and comfortable interview I have had. Once you submit your resume and apply, if you get selected, you are asked to take an online admin test. If you pass, you are then asked to me the talent acquisition specialist then meet with 3 other admin staff, often former session assistants. The process and experience is very smooth and streamlined. They will focus mostly on behavioural questions, so, have plenty of examples on hand. I suggest you use the STAR technique in framing your responses.
Interview Questions: What do you know about MSK? What was your motivation in applying for this position? Give me an example of a time you had to problem solve, think quickly on our feet, resolve customer service issues, encountered a challenge with your boss, how did you handle it?

During that interview they gave me the go and said they wanted to move forward. I had another tour for about 30 mins where I shadowed someone. Before I left the building HR sent me an email for the next step.

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions:
- Apply online through website
- got an email saying I qualified and had 48 hours to complete assessment 
-completed assessment (timed questions, computer skills, thinking abilities) 
- phone call to set up a phone interview
- phone interview (25 minutes)- learn about job, name a time you went above and beyond (be very specific- STAR method) (situation, task, action, result) 
- Interview: 30 minutes with HR (10-15 behavioral questions) then take shuttle bus to sloan hospital uptown
- meet with 2 managers for 1 1/2 hour interview (~30 behavioral questions)
- meet with administrative coordinator 
- phone call from HR asking for 5 references
Interview Questions:
- Describe a time that you were in a stressful situation
-Describe a time that you were flexible
- A time that you went above and beyond
-Why did you choose the healthcare field?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online & submitted my resume. They require that you complete an online aptitude test before the process can continue. I took the test & followed up with a phone call. Had a brief phone screen a few days later & never heard from them again.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Had someone submit my resume to HR for the position. Was contacted by HR to schedule an onsite interview a few weeks later. First interviewed with HR, then some prior Session Assistants, and finally, with the Administrative Manager. I was asked for a lot of SPECIFIC examples such as a time I had to work in a group and the outcome, a time I made a mistake and how I approached it, etc. Best advice is to make sure you have specific examples and stories prepared ahead of time.
Interview Questions:
A lot of behavioral questions asking of specific examples.
What was a time you made a mistake? (How did you address it? What was the outcome? Etc.)
Name a time you had to work in a group and someone was not participating. (Again, how did you address it, outcome)

title: Administrative Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for two jobs and was contacted for one of them. I had a very brief phone screen during which I was only asked about salary, (mine was higher but due to the attractiveness of the opportunity, I didn't want to be ruled out based on that factor.) I was invited for an in-person interview to meet with "three managers". A date was suggested, and I was under the impression that an email confirmation was forthcoming (it never came.) The day before the discussed date, (a week later, after two unreturned phone calls) I finally got a call asking me to come, but on a different date. Although the position was in a different location, I was invited to Manhattan and was not told with whom I would be meeting, I was to find that out at the interview, which was to be at the HR offices. I was told to bring four copies of my resume. In order to make this work, I had to take off from work on short notice and travel into New York, at considerable expense.

Despite repeatedly leaving my cell phone number in voice mails, when I did get calls, they went to my  home phone, which caused me to miss the calls and have to call back, including a message an hour before my interview, asking me to meet half an hour earlier. Fortunately, I got this message and did go early, at which point I was read the job descriptions again, and told that I would be meeting with TWO managers, and that I'd be riding a shuttle bus up to meet them. My appointment was not for an hour from then, and I had to sit in the lobby and wait after riding the shuttle uptown. 

I have nothing negative to say about the managers or the interview itself, although, having not been selected, they may not have felt the same. I was told that they'd be making a decision in the next week, but two weeks later, when the HR person didn't return my call, I finally relented and emailed the manager, who must have forwarded the email to HR so she would finally update the status in ICIMs. What's the point in using the applicant tracking system, if you're not going to use it?

So, I wasn't selected but this was a process in which my time wasn't valued, and as an applicant I wasn't even given the consideration of feedback during the process. I've worked for both large and small companies throughout my career and just didn't expect this at a company of this caliber. The whole experience left me scratching my head.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when ... (fill in the blank - about ten times)

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Talent Acquisition Specialist first introduced me to the position. Asked a few questions and then had me visit my direct supervisors for the position. They were very friendly and welcoming. I realized they do not pass you on to the next meeting with direct supervisors unless you have impressed the Talent Acquisition Specialist. They said the next step will be to meet with a Doctor in the field and then basic HR follow-up.
Interview Questions:
How do you deal with stress?
Why research?
What would your previous research professor say about you?
What would he say you need to practice more?
A time you went above and beyond to help someone.
A time you worked with a diverse group.
Three qualities you look for in a supervisor.
How do you handle deadlines?
If you were buddied up, how would you deal with a buddy that doesn't contribute?
Why is this position right for you?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Three interviews- One interview was over the phone and they asked questions such as your job experience and why do you want to apply for the position. The other two interviews was in person and they asked behavioral questions
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online in August . The following day I was notified by a recruiter to take an assessment to be considered for the position. Phone interview 2 days later and was sbxehsukes for an in person interview the following week. I met the recruiter who is one of the most down to earth person. She warmed me up for the interview which was about 2hrs long. I met with the Admin Manager and the coordinator, they asked me a lot of behavioral questions (be honest) I then met with the physician. Two weeks later I was told the department decided to hold off on hiring someone. I was then given 2 department to choose from to interview with. I interviewed with the manager and 2 physicians. I was offered a position with one of the physians and I start on the 10/24! It took two months to get in... But I'm in!
Interview Questions: Give an examples a time you went above and beyond for a patient. Be descriptive

title: Traffic Controller Interview

Interview Descriptions:
Very thorough lots of information given to perspective employee the interviewer was very knowledgeable and friendly yet serious.
The atmosphere was a relaxed professional aura and the room was cheerful and inviting.
Interview Questions: What do you see yourself doing in 5 years?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was cordial and consisted of details outlining the job of the potential new hire which lasted approximately 45 minutes and concluded with my being asked if I had any questions.
Interview Questions: I was asked if I had any questions after the interview.

title: Research Project Coordinator Interview

Interview Descriptions: I had to pass through several rounds. First I was contacted by one of MSK recruiters and she helped set up my first round of interviews. After that had to interview with another manager, program director and 2 doctors. It was a vigorous process. But overall it went well. Each interview lasted for approximately 30 min and it was really in depth and you got to know who you were talking to.
Interview Questions: What are your long term goals? Why MSK? What are you currently doing? They also asked alot of what if questions.

title: Office Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: I've had 5 interviews in 3 weeks and was told at my last interview that I will contacted in a few days about whether or not I have the job. It as now been 6 weeks and I haven't received or phone call or an email from anyone which is very heartbreaking.
Interview Questions: What are your future plans?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied by a recommendation. i had a phone interview first where they asked me basic questions like why msk? why research? my experience with data analysis and why cancer research. after that i received an email for an onsite interview where i met with the Hr that previously interviewed me. she asked me again some of the same questions and prepared me for the hiring manager by asking some behavioral questions. then i walked to a new location where i sat down with 3 manager and was explained a little bit about the position and asked a lot of behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: tell me about a time you made a mistake and how did you solved it?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was very straightforward, but also thorough. The initial application is a lengthy, covering education and work history, followed by a test of technical skills with computers, and critical thinking and behavioral assessment. After the application has been submitted a human resources representative contacted me the very next day to schedule a phone screen. She was very calm, relaxing, and personable. After the phone screen, she provided very valuable feedback and advise for the in person interview with a different interviewer, which she scheduled immediately.

The in person interview was quite a unique experience. the questions covered were much like the phone screen, and the advise that followed was very similar (i'm assuming they wanted to get an idea of how well an applicant responds to questions over the phone, then in person, before the "real" interview). I was told that I would move on to an interview with a department that same day. My department was radiology (which I coincidentally happened to favor), which was located on another of the hospital's many campuses. After a shuttle ride to the site, I met with the administrative coordinators who were just as pleasant and easy to speak to as the previous interviewers. I left that interview feeling very confident and looking forward to the next round. the next day I was contacted by my in person interviewer from HR with the details for a reference check, which they do on the back end. After two weeks I sent a follow-up email, and was contacted by the coordinator for the department requesting a another interview. This second interview included the entire team of administrative coordinators, and one-on-one interviews with two physicians, each representing a different position. Physician office assistants and physician secretaries are very similar, but differ slightly according to the sub-division they work in. At the end of the interview, I was told that I could now be considered for either position within the department.
Interview Questions: why should we hire you?

title: RSA Interview

Interview Descriptions:
HR phone screen, CRS interview (supervisor, immediate), CRM interview (manager, supervisors boss), MD interview

Overall process takes a long term but actual interviews are pretty relaxed and easy. Be prepared on how to answer the basic and common interview questions and come prepared with your own questions on the research they do
Interview Questions: Personality based questions, situational based questions

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was long and rigorous. I met with about 5 people. Talent acquisition representative, two managers, one physician and a nurse. Interviews with talent acquisition was about 20 minutes. Manager interviews were about 1 hour long and very detailed. Provider interviews were more conversational.
Interview Questions: what would you say are some of your weaknesses?

title: Office Coordinator Interview

title: Research Study Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: Multiple steps, first with hiring manager, then research manager, and finally with the PI. After meeting witht he PI I was told that they went with another candidate. After which the hiring manager told me I can interview for another department. The same thing happened, and now she has asked me again if I would like to continue interviewing... so I have no idea what they are doing.
Interview Questions: Many behavioral questions

title: Research Study Assistant I Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: They called one day and we had a brief phone interview. Afterwards we set up an in person interview. The person I was initially supposed to be interviewed by was to "busy" and I had to be shuffled around (I eventually spoke to her that day and she was just in her office the whole time doing nothing really). I was called back for two more interviews but the organization of the company is disgusting and I knew working there would not be any better.
Interview Questions: Strengths, weaknesses, typical behavioral questions

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
First I got a phone call from the Talent Acquistion Specialist where I was asked 3 behavioral questions. Was able to go in for an in-person interview the next day with the TAS and was asked the same 3 questions. Received great advice on how to clarify my responses with my resume in mind. Immediately after that interview I took the jitney from the HR building to main campus for an interview with 2 Administrative Coordinators. Was prompted that I would be asked a row of behavioral questions from the pair of them (probably ended up being around 15). Also received more information on the job responsibilities. Walked with one of the ACs to another one of MSK's buildings to speak with a physician - was a very open conversation where we talked about his previous POAs and I was able to ask questions. Received an email & phone call a few hours later to submit information for 5 references that would receive a survey to be completed online. Received my offer over the phone & via email.
Overall it was a good experience. Everyone I encountered made me feel very comfortable and was open with asking for clarification or questions.
Interview Questions: Recall a time when you gave outstanding customer service.

title: Research Study Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Met with HR, then met with the clinical research coordinator and the clinical research manager. Meeting with the CRC was more relaxed than talking with HR or the CRM. This all took about 2 hours. Was invited for a 2nd interview a few days later to meet with the doctor, which was chill and only took 15 minutes. The doctor didn't ask too many questions, and instead asked if I had any questions.
Interview Questions:
Describe a time you had to work with others.
Describe a challenge you overcame.
Why MSK?
What do you have to offer MSK, and what does MSK have to offer you?

title: Session Assistant Interview

Was called back for in-person interviews scheduled for the following week. The first interview was with a representative with HR. Then there was a second round with who ended up being my supervisor. Following that there was an interview with some executives from the organization.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you went above and beyond in a customer service role.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: The whole process took about 2 months.  I applied to this job online at the end of April, had in-person interviews with HR and the lab head on the same in early June, then was asked for references a week later, and finally got an offer 5 days after references were checked.  Both interviews were relatively short and easy.
Interview Questions: Why are you a good fit for this position?

title: Research Study Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Took me over a month or more. I applied internally (already working for another department) so my chance was slightly better (and the phone interview by the HR/talent acquisition was rather short and simple).

But since this position is involved with two different departments, I had to interview with 3 project coordinators, 2 attending doctors, 1 lab manager, and 1 research center director.

The interviews themselves weren't too challenging (except for those with project coordinators), but the process was just long.
Interview Questions:
- What would you do when one of your attending doctors complained about your fellow RSA(s)? Would you tell your fellow RSA? If yes, how? 
- We might have high school kids / college students during summer for certain tasks, but they seem not too motivated. How would you approach and make them more motivated?
- To build a better team, it needs to be a drama / gossip free environment. How do you deal with gossips at work? 
- One of your fellow RSAs is not doing too great on his/her work. How would you inform that to him/her without confronting?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: phone call with HR. In person interview with HR and study team. If they like you, they send you to interview with one of the service's doctors. Mostly a behavioral interview, lots of questions on how you'd handle hypothetical situations/what you'd prioritize.
Interview Questions: They asked about experience handling stress

title: Budget/Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
I'm not one to typically write reviews but I had such a pleasant experience that I felt inclined to chime in. Was contacted about a week after applying online to set up an in-person interview with HR. After the basic HR behavioral questions (20-30 min) she asked if I had time to meet with the hiring manager. I agreed and was given the address he was located at, about .5 miles up 3rd ave which was not bad at all. There I met with the 3 more people (2 analyst and the hiring manager). All were extremely friendly and made the interview stress free. Asked the typical behavioral questions, nothing I wasn't prepared for. 

9 business days later I received an email from one of the people I interviewed with with an excel assessment test. Was told to complete ASAP, which I did. Wasn't to terrible but make sure if you say you are good with excel that you are truly good with excel because they will know. 

After taking the test I heard back 1 day later asking for my references.  The deadline for reference was 2 business days so be sure to have previous managers and coworkers in mind if you make it to this stage. I was then made an offer 3 days after the reference deadline which I happily accepted.  

I've interviewed with many companies during my current job search and this was far and away the best experience I've had with all of them. And I'm not just saying that because they offered me the position.
Interview Questions:
Why MSK?
On a scale of 1-10, rate your excel skills
Strengths and weaknesses

title: Patient Care Technician Interview

Interview Descriptions: 1st you meet with a HR rep, there they will ask you a series of questions, once they get the feel of you, they will tell you what positions are available with start time, salaries ect. You have the choice to pick & choose, once you choose a position, they will email the department head, the department will email HR back with dates & times, I chose the 1st earliest date and time, the interview was quick and satisfying (maybe 15 minutes the most) I was confident that I got the job, when I arrived home, an hour later my phone started ringing, it was my HR rep, and on the other end of the phone, she uttered the most beautiful words of  "You wowed them!" "You got the job!"
Interview Questions: What is your strong point? How will you utilize it here if you are hired?

My in person interview began with meeting a talent acquisition agent who ran through some typical questions just getting a preliminary sense of who you are. The meeting with the talent agent went well and she asked if I could meet with 2 higher ups who were located at a MSK building at a different location. I took the shuttle bus to the upper east side location where I met with the two former SAs at once for about an hour. They asked about 17 or 18 behavioral questions and they want specific examples for each question. It is ok to take a minute to think about the question before answering. I think that interview went well, they were very nice and professional. That night I received an email asking for 5 references and have not yet heard back if I got the job.

title: Physician Assistant Interview

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview

I got an offer two weeks later.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview

Very pleasant interview, although I waited 25 minutes after scheduled interview time.  I found the environment pleasant.  The HR Manager basically went through every aspect of my  resume.  I think I was the last interview of the day because she was seemed very bored as if tis was a tedious process.  If I had know this, I would have chosen an interview time that was much earlier in the day.  In stead, I was extremely flexible and found it was not in my favor.
I was told that if I was a candidate that thy are interested in, they would contact me for a second interview.  I asked if there was a time frame that I cold expect to hear back, but I was informed that the interviews for this position just started.
