title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Applied for POA through an employee referral. Received a call from HR the next day to set up a phone interview. The phone interview was about 20 minutes: what are your professional goals, why do you want to work at MSK, how did you handle a situation when you were under pressure, tell me about a time when you went above and beyond to get a job done. I was then asked to schedule for an in-person interview with the recruiter the next day, but due to my work schedule, I could only do the week after. The recruiter asked basically the same questions + what do you know about MSK? I was then to meet two administrative coordinators 3 hours later that day at the main hospital. 

Here's where it went downhill. I was told that a jitney would come by to pick up employees at the corner of Tunnel Exit Street and 40th to transport them to the hospital. The jitney comes at the :10 and :40. I set out to meet the jitney at the :10. Saw that it was a white van with a paper sign that says MSKCC Employees. But it never stopped on the corner. What I should have done at that point was to take the train since I noticed it didn't stop for me. So, that was my fault. However, I proceeded to wait around the area for the :40. I didn't see the jitney until :41 and it completely went by me. I tried to chase it down in my one inch heels but to no avail. Regardless of the method of transportation, I will be late to the :00 interview. I called my recruiter and explained to her what happened and if she can inform the administrative coordinators that I will be late. I ended up taking a cab to the hospital and was 11 minutes late to the interview. 

I honestly repressed the interview I had with the two administrative coordinators so well that I don't remember what questions they asked. They explained to me the format of the interview at the beginning, told me to use the STAR technique. It was a lot of behavioral questions. I didn't use the STAR technique at all, and at one point, didn't even answer one of the questions properly because it just didn't make sense to me (I unfortunately cannot remember what that question was). At the end, they said either they or my recruiter would keep in contact with me. 

TL;DR: I advise everyone to take the train or a cab to the hospital and avoid relying on the jitney at all costs. I also advise e-mailing the recruiter back regarding why you didn't get the job and what you could have done better. I have an idea of why I didn't get the job (besides failing to answer questions properly and the obvious lateness), but I should have asked. Also, you'll need to thank everyone you met for their time, which I didn't do either. So, yeah, I'm pretty terrible. But despite how much I bombed this interview, everyone I spoke with and met were all super nice and super professional. They did make me feel welcome and relaxed and my nerves were gone as soon as I spoke with them.

FYI, completely unrelated: I'm currently on a one-woman mission to propose a new standard on the hiring process of this nation. This whole interview process and these BS interview questions are getting ridiculous. For people like me who are honest, hard working, but with no creative gene to make up answers on the spot, I'm getting turned down for jobs I know I will excel at, to people who are perhaps less hardworking than me but good at bullshitting. #downwithSTAR /End rant, good luck to all : )
Interview Questions: What's the best thing about your current job?

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was sent a referral from my friend via email and I filled out an application which ended with an assessment test that tested for basic knowledge, typing speed, and personality questions. I received a phone call about 3 days later but I missed it. I called back and she scheduled a phone screening the next day. The phone screen asked questions like "you just graduated, what do you plan doing now?" "what do you know about MSKCC?" "tell me about yourself." then she asked a couple of team-related behavioral questions. Then she explained the position and the salary. I agreed to the salary then she scheduled me for an in-person interview at HR. (phone interview was on a Thursday, in-person interview was scheduled for Monday) Monday came around and I was interviewed by the talent acquisition lady, one-on-one. She asked similar questions like "why MSK?" "why Session Assistant?" "Strength?" "Weakness?" A couple of behavioral questions were also asked like "name a time you had a difficult group project" (something along the lines like that). She then asked me if I had time for an interview with 2 supervisors later that day and I said yes. She then told me that there will be more behavioral questions and to answer them using STAR (situation, task, action, and result). The next interview was a little bit intense but I have prepared for it thanks to my friend and to Glassdoor. The 2 supervisors were past SA and they were very nice and very approachable. I answered to the best of my abilities. They had a packet of about 18-20 questions and each of them took turns asking and they were taking notes as I answered. When I was done answering they said that was it and that I should get a response by the end of the week hopefully. I was sent an email for references, I did them that night on my computer. 3 out of 5 of my references completed the survey the next day (Tuesday). And on Wednesday morning I got a call from HR offering me a position! I was worried at first because some Glassdoor reviews showed that after the 2 supervisors, they were also interviewed by a hiring manager. However I wasn't but I was still offered a position! The process was long but thorough. I understand why they take these steps because MSK is such a great company and I've seen how they treat their employees and even potential employees. I felt very welcomed and now I feel even more welcomed! I'm so glad for this opportunity! I start 2 weeks from now!
Interview Questions: Name a time your supervisor gave you criticism. What did you do about it?

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2016

A few days later, I interviewed with two Session Assistant Supervisors. That interview went extremely well. They were very nice and down to earth. PREPARE ANSWERING BEHAVIORAL QUESTIONS!!! If you do not prepare, you will waste time thinking of work related scenarios. I was well prepared for this. They checked my references and I received an offer the next day. Overall, this was a great experience and I'm honored to be with such a great organization.

title: Physician Office Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Late February, I applied online and took the 45 minute test for the position. It's designed to view your typing skills, asks questions based on scenarios, and asks basic questions about functioning with computers. After a few days, someone from HR contacted me and asked me a few questions screening me for an in-person interview. I switched careers, from working in the Admissions department at a university, to the medical field. He asked why I decided to switch to the medical field and if I'm willing to make a two year commitment. Satisfied with my responses, he scheduled me to interview with someone from HR the following week. 

I met with the lady from HR and she asked a variety of behavioral questions and asked why I would like to work for MSKCC. The interview took about 30 minutes and due to a work commitment, was scheduled for the second interview with two department supervisors the following week (mid March.) 

The last interview was very difficult in my opinion, because I was not prepared for the 20 behavioral questions they asked me. I was also very nervous, and I took a few minutes to think about my responses to reflect about my 8+ year work history, since it's very hard to recall things when I am nervous. I left knowing I did not do my best, but I still haven't heard from the department yet and it's been about a week since I have seen them. 

Overall, everyone was very nice and professional, and was willing to meet with me at a convenient time. To do well, you must display confidence, and be well prepared to answer their behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you and your coworkers were given a project and everyone had a different opinion. What was the outcome?

title: Buyer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
A couple of weeks after applying on LinkedIn, I received an email from someone in HR about setting up an in-person interview. Later that week I went to their HR dept to meet with the person who interviewed me. He asked a few behavioral questions then sent me to another location near Union Square to meet with the team I'd be working with. When I got to the other location, I interviewed with three people, including the department head. The questions were straightforward, a mix of behavioral and about my knowledge of certain components of the job. The process was very organized and everyone was friendly, though it made me a bit nervous that they kept writing things down constantly (each interviewer has a scorecard to complete). They told me after the interview that it would be a couple of weeks before I heard from them because they had a few more people to interview. 

As promised, two weeks after I interviewed, I received an email from the HR person asking to speak. I was offered a more junior role than I interviewed for (they were up front during the interview that they have two roles and if they don't think someone is experienced enough, they may offer them the junior role). I ended up receiving a higher offer elsewhere, so I turned down the job, but overall my experience interviewing here was very positive.

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2016

Very quick and easy for me. But I have heard it can take longer for other applicants. First they emailed me back saying I met the minimum qualifications when I applied online and asked me to take a short online test. They emailed me a few days later about scheduling a brief phone interview, which screens you for an in person interview. Here they ask why your interested in this position and why you chose to apply to MSK. If they like you, they'll schedule an in person interview where you meet with the HR rep from your phone interview. Mine was super polite and quick. I think she liked me so she had me meet with the 2 hiring managers right afterward. By the end of the day, she had emailed me for references, and called me a few days later to offer me a position. Like all Interviews, you have to present yourself professionally, and prep a bit. For this position (Session Asst) in particular, they are looking for someone with customer service experience, and can translate that into patient care. 

Review behavioral questions/regular healthcare interview questions

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions:
I initially applied online directly from their job opening section. I'd say It wasn't until a 3 or 4 weeks from that time that I received an email from HR in regards to a phone interview. The phone interview took place a day or so after (I'll list the questions I remember below). It went fairly well, although to be honest I was surprised they contacted me because I did not prepare at all for the phone interview (make sure you always do your homework beforehand!). Got an email asking to meet with a Talent Acquisition Specialist and possibly with other members of the hiring staff. The in-person interview was then done the following week. The interview with the TAS lasted maybe 15-20 minutes and consisted of typical behavioral questions, questions about my resume, how I heard about MSK and then progressed to what working for them entailed, benefits and what not. I was then sent to meet with hiring staff for the particular department, I believe it was with the CRM and perhaps another RSA or higher up. It was during this that they shot a lot of questions my way mostly behavioral and situational, but also personality-esque questions and specifics about my previous research. I'd say the process went fairly well and the next day I was sent an email to meet with the physicians heading the project and after that the CRC. Met with everyone there the following week. The physicians asked questions similar to the CRM but not as intense, they seemed to reiterate the importance of the work of the position and commitment required to be successful. I then met with the CRC and one of his colleagues and it was more so the same behavioral type questions, how I heard about MSK and personality type questions. Felt the most laid back with them, but I still had to be on top of my game and professional. I heard back the following week stating the department I interviewed with wanted to move on with someone else, but there are other openings in some departments what want to go through with interviews.

Overall the process was smooth and everyone involved was very personable and it was seen that they definitely enjoy working at MSK. Make sure to do your homework! I came to Glassdoor and basically looked at the RSA interview reviews and copied down the questions I could pull out from them onto a Word document and then answered them. I reviewed those the days leading up to the interviews and on the days of them. I would definitely recommend researching MSK itself and be familiar with some of their work. They seemed to respond very positively when I told them about specific projects that were going on at MSK when they asked how I heard about them. You can simply visit the MSK newsletter online and read up on some of their research and bring it up when/if appropriate. If you know the names of the physicians it wouldn't hurt to read up on them as well.
Interview Questions:
Would you say you are more passive or aggressive?
Do you prefer an environment that is fixed with work at a desk or do you like to be in your feet?
How did you eliminate any bias from your research project?
How do you respond to criticism?
What do you fear? (in terms of career and work from what I can recall)
What are your plans for the future?
What if your future plans do not work out?
Talk about a time when you had to resolve a conflict.
Talk about a time where you worked in a team environment.
How do you get through doing mundane tasks?
How do you deal with stress?
How would I know you are stressed?
On a scale of 1-10 how well do you handle stress?
Talk about a time where looking back you would go back and change something.
How many cups of coffee do you drink per day?
How many unchecked emails in your inbox?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview

Had to come back twice after that to meet with CRM and two PIs, including the deputy director of the whole department. Filled out a survey of five references and was offered the job shortly thereafter.

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Took too long for HR to get back. There wasn't a clear or direct information for the interview. There was a lot of going back and forth with the HR.
Interview Questions: Why are you applying for this position?

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: At first they send you an email asking what time would be good for a phone interview that lasts about 20-30 minutes. I was then asked to come in for an in person interview with someone in HR. I arrived early and waited to be called back. The HR interviewer was pleasant. After I was done I want asked if I had time for a departmental interview the same day? I said yes, and had to take the free shuttle to another building to have the interview completed. It was done by two people , so it was a bit intimidating. After that step was complete I was asked to wait while they went over their notes. They then asked me if I had time for yet another interview with their supervisor, I said yea and that part only lasted for about 20 mins. All in all a god experience.
Interview Questions: Name a time at your previous job/s do you help to initiate positive change? Describe a time when you did not agree with your supervisor, and how did you handle letting them know? Describe a time you went above and beyond for someone at your previous job?

title: Physician Office Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Met with a woman from Human Resources and was then sent to the main campus for a follow-up interview with coordinator assistants. Was then sent to discuss the position further with their two managers. Scheduled for a time to meet physicians with whom I would be hopefully working with. The interview process takes about a half a day including travel. I had my first HR interview in the late morning and finished up in the afternoon. Plan to leave your schedule open after the first interview. The subsequent interviews follow immediately after.
Interview Questions:
What are two of your strengths and two of your weaknesses?
Describe a situation in which you didn't get along with or didn't agree with your supervisor. 
Name a characteristic that people don't often see with a first impression or are surprised to find out after meeting you.

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: i applied online and did an online assessment.  that same day I got a call from someone in HR that I had passed the assessment. she asked me a few questions over the phone and then scheduled an interview for the following week.  I interviewed with the girl from HR and then she sent me on a shuttle to the main hospital where I interviewed with the administrative coordinator for that department.  after that, the administrative coordinator had me talk with two current physician office assistants
Interview Questions: a lot of behavioral questions like if you were in a certain situation how would you react/what would you do

title: Contract Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received an e-mail about 1 week later from the recruiter in the HR dept. I spoke to him on the phone briefly.  He later invited me in for an interview a few days later. Spoke with the recruiter and two other people, very nice professional people. You can tell they were all very happy to work there and spoke highly of  the benefits they offered.
Interview Questions: Many behavioral questions.  Describe a time when you asked to complete a team project?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Fairly short since it was a new lab starting and it needed staffing fast. there wasn't any specific programming questions just questions in on my general background in research. If you have a decent background in research , and came out of a good university , you should do fine.
Interview Questions: what languages i can code, and to describe the research i done at my MSc

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with HR for a screening then immediately after that met with the head of the department and the person who I would be directly reporting to. The following day I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: what was the most challenging thing that you have felt with professionally

title: Animal Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview is quick and somewhat rushed. The HR representative does a good job of assessing you and helping you with your resume, and what to focus on.  There is crosstown traveling from HR building to main building.
Interview Questions: Are you afraid of mice or dealing with animals at all?

title: Physician Office Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and took and hour assessment online. Once I passed, I was contacted by someone from HR. There was a quick 15 minute screening on the phone with her, then she offered to have an in person interview with her the same week. 

After my in person interview, she asked if I was available to meet with 2 superiors for the department the same day. After meeting with them, I had to provide 5 references. 

As soon as my references were completed, I was asked in to meet with a few Physicans who I could potentially work with. 

Overall I had about 5 interviews, which is normal for all POAs.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time where you didn't succeed in a task or didn't complete a project.

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview is a packet of impersonal and redundant behavioral questions but the interviewers want you to be as specific as possible in drawing examples. It is a test of how well you can tell a story that sells yourself very well. Definitely prepare stories but also prepare to tell a story on the spot. Be charismatic.
Interview Questions: How do I know if you are stressed? Name a time you provided excellent customer service.

title: Patient Access Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Initial meeting in person with HR talent recruiter followed by interview with department management and senior staff. Each interview about 40-60 minutes, all behavioral and situational questions so be sure to look through the examples listed in previous reviews on this website. If you're prepared with stories and examples that demonstrate value it should be pretty straightforward.
Interview Questions: Team work, above and beyond, etc.

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Went first through HR, which was very laid back and more conversational. Then met with two of the current managers, who read of a list of questions for me to answer, but didn't seem interested at all in any of my responses.
Interview Questions: How would I be able to tell that you are stressed, our under a lot of pressure.

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I don't really remember it was more than 3 years ago.  It was a typical interview, met with many people , they asked skill related questions along with personality questions.  Nothing overly complicated they just want to get a feel for how you will fit in to the department.  I don't think this is unsual.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you had to overcome a challenge at work.

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied about a month before I heard anything. Then I contacted an HR recruiter, had a brief phone conversation about my interests. A few days later, I was called in to interview with the recruiter, CRM and CRS and the lead physician on the unit. Took about 2 hours. After you pass interviews, you have to get 5 references to fill out a survey. Very quick turnaround. Very conversational interview. Overall great place from what I hear- super excited! You must stress that you will work for the 2 year commitment.
Interview Questions: Walk through my resume and How I would handle certain situations? ex: Doctor asking for information on patients, a co worker who constantly made mistakes, etc.

title: Research Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Initial email, followed by 1hr in-person skills assessment, followed by one 1hr in-person interview with one of three PIs, two 30min back-to-back in person interviews with the project manager and a second PI, and then another interview about a week later over the phone with the third PI. This whole process took about 5 weeks. Then I received an email asking for references, two weeks later, references had been checked as two of them gave me a heads up. Everything was going great! And then three weeks went by and I was contacted by a different person who asked me for references again. I was confused, but then found out the person that had been processing my files had resigned their position. I gave them my list of references again, and told my references what had happened. About 10 days later I am requested to provide the contact information to my current direct supervisor. I am hesitant for obvious reasons: I don't want to be taken off of current projects without even a firm offer (or any kind of offer for that matter), and provide additional references. After a week, someone else contacts me essentially demanding the contact information for my current direct supervisor before they move forward. I finally cave in, talk to my supervisor and let her know that she may be called - now she knows that I am looking at other jobs. Well, the best part is that weeks go by and they never call her, ever. And they also never call me back. This whole process started in August, 2015. By January, 2016, I called them and they said they were still interviewing. I'm sorry, after all of those interviews, and me traveling 2 hours to get to them on a work day, and all the time I took of my current job, they did not even have the decency to let me know whether or not I had gotten the job? I find that unacceptable. 

Granted, this may be isolated to one department or a single sector of a department, but it was a pretty bad indicator of the quality of life experiences by those working there, I assume. It would have been nice to at least get a notification. All the PIs were wonderful, and I would love to work with them. The project was amazing and something I truly believe in.  But the individual that took over the last portion of my interviewing process did not appear to even have the basic tenets of professional behavior or common decency. Highly disappointed.
Interview Questions: Background, interests, flexibility, language skills, fitness for role

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Start with phone call interview with the recruiter and then setting me up an appointment with the manager. Very interesting, the managers  were straight to the point. Smiling asking questions mostly about who you are.
Interview Questions: Why did you chose the company?  Are you familiar with geriatric patient?

title: Research Study Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with a friend's friend who works at MSK back in April and she sent my resume to HR. Then after I didn't hear anything, I emailed her again and she resent my resume in late July/early August. Finally heard from HR in mid-late August, had a phone call call a few days later. Then I was asked to go in for an interview at the end of August. Found out the next day I didn't get the job, but everyone I spoke with was nice.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time you and a coworker weren't on the same page and how you handled it.
What are some of your strengths? 
(A lot of behavioral questions.)

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through the Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer center website, and heard nothing for weeks. A friend of mine that works there referred me and I got a call the same day from HR. A phone call that lasted about 15 minutes just to talk about interests and what the responsibilities of the job were. In person interview with HR, then with a group of employees.
Interview Questions: What are 3 qualities you think are most important for this position?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Repetitive, thorough, demanding, long, but very doable

The interview process lasted for about two days and followed this pattern:

Day 1
Phone screen
HR Interview
Group Administrative Interview
Admin Manager Interview

Day 2
Doctor Interview

Everything went well.
Just exude confidence and listen attentively.
Simple and straightforward
Interview Questions: What is one way you handle stress in a team environment?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone call followed by in person interview. The interview was pretty quick and they got back to me the following week. The employment process took many weeks. They require medical clearance and more paperwork required. Medical clearance was very tedious and specific. They also asked for 3 reference letters so that is an important of their process.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to intern at MSKCC?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty straight forward. I met with an HR recruiter after being referred by a friend and a brief phone screening.After meeting with her I got what I felt like was a "golden ticket" which were instructions and directions for another interview the same day at a different location. After a little shuttle bus ride, I met with who I swear were 2 girls from that show "Rich kids of Beverly hills". I thought it went well, but got no offer so I guess not.
Interview Questions: Mostly the "Tell me about a time" type of questions

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got a call 3 days after. I had only the phone interview. The person only asked me questions; what do I know about the company? Have I ever worked with a team? And have I ever go above and beyond for a job/something etc? I got an email the week after stating that they decide to go with someone else but I think it was not fair since it was only 3 questions.
Interview Questions: Have you ever go above and beyond for something?

title: Research Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: There were three interviews over the course of 2.5 months due to scheduling issues; a phone screen, in-person interview with 4 staff on the project, and an HR interview. There would have been another interview (I was tied with another candidate) but I withdrew my application.
Interview Questions:
Technical questions: do you know how to conduct a t-test? Do you know how to conduct a literature review? 

General prompts: Tell me more about yourself. Tell me about how you coordinated meetings/events with multiple people.

title: Physician Office Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: STAR interview questions were used and I was prepared for them- I highly recommend googling and reading about this style of interview. It's a very conversational/situation style, and being prepared is the best service you can do for yourself!
Interview Questions: Explain a situation that you felt uncomfortable with a superior and how you handled it.

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I was e-mailed a month after I applied to the position. Me and the HR guy arranged for a phone interview the next day. He basically described the job, and later invited me for an in-person interview the following week. So, the day came. I arrived an hour early, waited an hour until I was called, and had my in-person interview with the recruiter. He asked a few assessment questions and immediately sent me to another building (the hospital) for another interview on the same day. This is when things went downhill.

First, I could not find the shuttle he wanted me to take. I asked an officer in front of the building, and an NYPD officer outside for the exact location (based on a paper I was given), but no one knew. So, after giving up, I decided to take a cab. I figured I'd get there quickly. However, Obama happened to be around that day, so there were traffic jams after traffic jams. I arrived an hour later than I should have, and spent 25 dollars getting there. After being forced to wait, yet again, for the person to interview me, two white women finally met me. I explained what happened, and they seemed understandable. Then, finally, came the 2nd interview.

They sat me down in what looked like an interrogation room--it was small and only contained a round table with three chairs. The two women immediately took out packets filled with questions. I believe they had 17 assessment questions in all. They ran through all of them in a span of an hour (how many times have I written "hour" here?!). The questions involved my experiences with groups. Absolutely none of these were directly relevant to the job, my interest, my nature, my ideals, my goals, etc. They were all about occurrences in my past with groups. It's important to note that I had to give a specific example of whatever occurrence they asked of me. At first, I think I answered many of them well, but then I stumbled. They really expect you to become a story teller on the spot, as if a session assistant is going to be reading tales to the patients. Based on the quality of your stories, and how charismatic you are saying them, you either get the job or you don't.

I, unfortunately, did not possess those qualities. The two women immediately left me in the room alone to discuss my assessment outside. Before I could say anything else, one reentered the room, told me they didn't have anymore questions, and said I could leave. I immediately knew I was shot down, and I was right. A week later, I received an e-mail from the recruiter saying I did not get the job. On top of that, they moved forward with candidates for every SA job available--not just the one I applied for.

Overall, I disagree with their methods. Particularly, this assessment process. I don't see how it accurately gauges the qualifications of an applicant, as anyone can just bs their stories. But, perhaps, it's not about your answers at all, but your charisma, posture, and eye contact while saying them. Who knows. I did the best I could, and give props to whoever actually got the position.
Interview Questions: How did you find out about this position? What do you know about the MSKCC? What was a time you went up and beyond for a client? What was a time you demonstrated flexibility? What was a time you had an idea your group disagreed with? What was a negative experience you had with a group member? What was a long term project you had with a group? What was a time you disagreed with a group member? How do you feel about working with cancer patients (the one question I recall about the job itself)? What was a time you worked with a group to accomplish something (something that stands out)? And about 7 more about times you spent with a group/teams.

title: Budget and Contracts Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: HR was the first point of contact . Second interview was with the Manager and Supervisor. Third interview was with the director. It is a Lengthy process. 3 interviews for entry level job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with HR over the phone went into the city for an interview. Went over resume and work experiences and then met with several members of the actual research team. Went over some scenarios and why I was interested and how my experiences were in any way related. Received an email a few days later with an offer. Seems like a great place to work but required commuting and a 2 year commitment so I was unable to accept.
Interview Questions: What sparked your interest in doing clinical research?

title: Physician Office Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted by a recruiter after an employee referral. We set up a phone interview which was less than 10 minutes and I was asked basic interview questions. I set up an in person interview with HR with a slightly lengthier version of the phone interview. When I passed that round I went to the main hospital building and met with 2 supervisors then with 2 managers. Once they deemed I was right for the role I interviewed with a doctor and we hit it off! 

The entire process was 6 hours. I would say clear your day and be prepared to return in case you don't find the doctor you'll be working with right away.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you went above and beyond.

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied through University, received an email a few days later from recruiter to take assessment test online. Took test and got a phone call a few days later... still waiting
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for MSK?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with a recruiter from HR consisted of a few behavioral questions. Was also asked about familiarity with specific data analysis programs. In-person interview with another HR representative then met with 2 two person panels for about 40 mins each back to back where they asked lots of common behavioral questions and inquired about past clinical research experience. This is when I was given more details about the job. The following week I met with 2 principal investigators for about 30 mins each.
Interview Questions: Describe a time that you clashed with a member of a group and how you handled the situation.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Simple. A phone call then an in person interview. The process took several weeks and i was finally called and extended a tentative offer after background check and references. I found the process was dragged on and could've been way more efficient
Interview Questions:
What do you know about the research going on in the lab?

Where do you see yourself in two years?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: It was very quick, lasted a couple weeks to do everything. Got a phone screen about 5 days after applying. Then after the phone screen got an in-person interview 3 days later. And the rejection came a few days later.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you've made a mistake.

title: PhD Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: 4 interviews with 4 faculty members. The direction and intensity of the interview is entirely dependent on the interviewer. Know your own science and a bit about theirs. Ask insightful questions. The interviewer will be happy to talk about his research if you show a combination of interest and comprehension of the subject matter. Be humble. There is no way you know more than your interviewer.
Interview Questions: What is the importance of your research

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: For this particular position, so far I have had a phone interview and an in person interview with HR and then the clinical supervisor and clinical manager. They have informed me there will be another in person interview before hiring.
Interview Questions: Name a mistake you made and what you did to fix it.

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: After the first online assessment, you may be invited to take another online assessment. If you pass the second assessment, someone from HR would call you for a phone interview. The first interview is with someone from HR, then you meet with the department head/s. In my experience, the interview with HR was easy, but the interview with the department head/s was a bit difficult. A lot of questions that require details and relating your past experiences with the responsibilities you'd have if chosen for the position.
Interview Questions: Name a time you had to make a difficult decision. How did you come to your decision?

title: RSA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Long process with multiple interviews with manager, RSAs and even PIs. Be ready to be interviewed within a group and to meet a PI of a given clinical trial. You will have to interview over the phone, then come in person. Please note that MSK will not cover any travel or hotel stay
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult time when you were overworked and how you handled it

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online after referral from undergrad and received timely response within 2-3 business days. Didn't receive an additional interview. Being a very recent undergrad with skills geared more towards clinical or lab practice moreso than administrative work, I was probably considered either underqualified or an ill-fit. Still, considering the circumstances it was an efficient process.
Interview Questions: Would you be willing to commit 2+ years?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a full day of interviews with everyone within the department of psych-oncology.  They asked if I had questions for them more often than they asked me questions.  I was expecting a job talk, but they didn't require one, which was actually a relief. Everyone was surprisingly friendly, supportive, and provided me with plenty of information about their work.
Interview Questions: What do you think of free will?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: A bit slapdash once you get through HR and to the actual service middle management. Attempts to standardize have not been very successful, but the interviewers were kind and made me feel comfortable.
Interview Questions: No real questions were asked, except inquiring about previous experience.

title: Clinical Nurse Interview

Interview Descriptions: I introduced myself to the nurse leader when I was at MSKCC for a clinical rotation, after I got my NCLEX exam date I emailed her and let her know when it was. She forwarded my resume to the nurse recruiter who called me and set up an interview. The first interview with Nurse Recruiter then 1 week later I had an interview with the nurse leader on the floor that I was hired on.

title: Vice President Interview

Interview Descriptions: 3 -4 interviews per day (30 minutes) with multiple call backs.  Met with direct reports, direct supervisor and multiple people from other groups with whom this position would collaborate.  very thoughtful process and series of questioning.  everyone was very cordial.  30 minutes often felt like too short a time to establish rapport from my perspective.
Interview Questions: Demonstrated examples of the skill sets required

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Took the online assessment test, had a brief 15 min phone call and then came in for an in person interview. It was entirely behavioral questions and last about 2 hours in all.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you went above and beyond when doing a service for a person?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online months ago, I had even forgotten about it. Then, out of the blue, I received a phone call for an interview. I showed up with my resume and showed interest in the position. Gave great answers to questions like what are your weaknesses. After that, I received a phone call for the second interview. Later on that week, I filled out more paperwork for about my references and signed some consent forms then I was contacted with a job offer.
Interview Questions: General l interview questions.

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Long long and VERY long interview process. Tedious I would say. Meetings with MANY people from the department and about 4 hours of interviewing in total. Make sure you come prepared. I would suggest reading alot of the behavioral questions everyone has posted here. They are very helpful.
Interview Questions: Lots of behavioral questions. Prepare yourself to answer questions as of what you have done in the past. Real life examples. A time when.....

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I first had a brief phone interview with HR, then went in for a two part in person interview. The first interviewer was remarkably condescending, and was uninterested in any of my answers.
Interview Questions: Tell me about the various clinical trials available at MSK

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position when the position first posted to msk career website. I received a call about a month later with an HR recruiter representative.  We did a brief phone interview and I was told that my resume would be forwarded to the hiring manager.  I heard back from the HR rep the same day via email,  she set up and interview for that week for me.  I went into the interview,  the manager was very easy to speak with, which made the interview feel very comfortable. After the interview,  about 45 mins later,  I sent the HR rep an email thanking her for setting up the interview between the manager and myself.  I received an email not even 5 mins later from the same HR rep saying that the manager felt the interview went well and they would like to check my references and perform a background check.  The references are checked via a third party website and your reference (5 of them -  2 former managers 3 - peers, subordinates, and or coworkers)  have to fill out a survey on you via this website.  That was a little tasking because you have to run behind your reference and constantly remind them to do it.  It's probably best to have more than 5 references just in case some flake on you. You are able to go to the website to double check to see who completed their surveys or not. As soon as my references were completed,  I sent another email to the HR rep,  informing her that the surveys were completed and if she needed anything to contact me.  The next day she told me via email that my salary recommendation was sent to compensation for review.  2 days later I was sent my offer, and was very happy with the salary amount.  After you sign your offer letter (which btw you should keep)  an onboarding committee rep will contact you to complete all other necessary documents and health screening.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had an unsatisfied/irate patient.

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Resume and application submission followed by a computer based test, then a quick 15 minute phone interview. On site interview had multiple people interviewing you in the same day, for about a half hour each. Pretty typical interview questions, some of my peers had to go to multiple locations for their in-person interviews, but for mine the hiring team was all brought to one site.
Interview Questions: Name a time you disagreed with a superior

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: - Two people interviewed me. They were very friendly. It didn't feel like an interview more of just a conversation. overall the interview was simple and straight to the point. The atmosphere of the hospital was great. Feel like home. You can see why everyone wants to go MSK
Interview Questions: What are you strengths?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took approximately one month; interviewed with 3 HR Representatives a week later I received the invite to interview with the department. Several rounds of interviews in the department. MSK does an amazing job vetting its prospective employees which is probably why only the best of the best work at this elite organization. Lots of behavioral questions however this is a process that I am very familiar with so for me it wasn't  difficult.
Interview Questions: No unexpected questions

title: Unit Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Engaging, interesting, professional and comfort 
The environment was comfortable that it allow me to engage myself entirely into the questions and sceneries being asked. The staff was understanding and firm . I was able to use pass experience to get me through . They were open minded and allowed you to put in your own view of things that can better the department.
Interview Questions: How would you make a decision based on two different review

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, which required an online assessment. A few days later a representative from HR called for a short phone interview and scheduled an in-person interview. The interview day began with meeting with an HR representative discussing various behavioral questions. Then I took a shuttle to meet with Administrative Manager and then an Administrative Coordinator. The whole day took a couple of hours.
Interview Questions: Describe a weakness

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: All day process. Interview with HR, POA supervisors, and then a specific department. Four hours of interviewing with five people total and different locations. The interview went very well in my eyes. Towards the end I felt as if I was overqualified for the position. Seems like they're looking for entry level employees.
Interview Questions: What's the best and worst thing about your current job?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I went through two rounds of interviews. One with the PI and the next with the research technicians and post doc. References were called and ended up getting the offer the next day. Everyone was very nice and inviting. The entire process took about a month or so, but I applied in February. Great experience!
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in our work?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with two of the managers in Revenue Cycle Management and Patient Billing. The first interview was very informal; the manager described the position to me and I talked a little about my experience. The second interview had more structured questions for me to answer.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years? Describe one skill or project where you struggled or were met with an obstacle, and how did you handle it?

title: RSA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with hiring managers and they were warm and inviting.  I was interviewed by two people. I prepared for the interview. I did my research on the organization. I reviewed situational and behavioral questions. I was very prepared so the interview was not difficult. I was able to move on to the next step. I met with a surgeon and he spoke about the job and environment.  Then he said when can you start.  Two days later, references and then 1 week later--I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Can you describe a time when you were under stress and you had to meet a priority deadline and the result ended positively.

title: Senior Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, a few weeks later got an email for HR asking if I was interested in a different position similar to what I'd applied for. Did a phone screen with HR, then an in-person interview with the lab I applied to. About two weeks later (after references were contacted), I came back for another in-person interview with the lab, and with HR.
Interview Questions: Pretty standard interview questions-- they covered my previous research experience, technical skills, organizational and interpersonal habits, and interest. Asked if I liked to cook! (relevant for lab skills)

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I got a 2 phone interviews. First phone interview is ask some questions based on my resume. The second one is done by asking some basic questions based on algorithm and other programming questions.
Interview Questions: some basic questions based on algorithm

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Tedious yet average. Phone interview, followed by interview with hiring manager(s). Happens over a two week span. All involved in the process (HR) was very pleasant, be ready for tons of behavioral questions, attach stories to further explain your experiences. Even if denied the opportunity to work here, the MSKCC makes for great professional practice.
Interview Questions: Why healthcare?

title: Insurance Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Call on Tuesday, contact on Wednesday, interview Thursday...from Philly to NYC. Prompt 3:30 appt with HR and prompt 4:00 appt with mgmt. Panel interview, very professional questioning. Very culturally diverse.
Interview Questions:
What do you do if you don't think you'll make a deadline?
Describe a time when you went above and beyond to get the job done.

title: Animal Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview and screening process as long as your able to follow directions. I talked to a senior manager on the phone and met with two managers in person. I was given a tour of the facility and hired about two hours later.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Physician Office Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and took a 45 minute assessment, basic IQ test and typing skills. I recieved an email two months later stating that i passed my assessment and was invited for a phone interview. Like most of the reviews on here, phone interview was fairly short and simple just a few questions: what do you know about MSK? why did you apply for this position? what are some of your goals? basic questions. HR recruiter was very nice and friendly and she invited me in for a face to face. Common interview questions: strengths , weaknesses, future goals, why did i pick MSK. She went over the position ,duties, salary and benefits. There is a 2 year commitment so be prepared. There was a position that she wanted me to interview for that started in the upcoming month, but due to my school schedule it wouldn't have been possible. She was kind enough to call another department that had a position open for June, after my graduation date. They were willing to interview me that day, she gave me a map to the shuttle bus and names of the managers i would meet. I met with two Administrative Managers who were both really nice. Be prepared for a long set of questions, behavioral/situation based interview. Just smile, be prepared and keep your answers as detailed as possible. Relate your experience to the the job description, do your homework and research. I got a email the same day asking for references and a background check. HR called 2 business days later and offered me the position.
Interview Questions: A situation where you had a complex issue, how did you deal with it? Went above and beyond for a patient? A time where you made a mistake ?

title: Nuclear Medicine Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions:
two rounds. one-on-one and then four of the upper level scientists. 
glassdoor is asking too many questions for a simple review.. im really reviewing this so i can see other details on the site.
Interview Questions: why do you want this position?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was in-depth. Basic questions, and then behavioral questions; the interviewer wants to get to know you, they don't want to trip you up. I found the initial interview very straight forward. So long as you know why you want the job, it should be relatively easy.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you went above and beyond for someone.

title: Research Study Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: First I went to the human resources office to interview with the coordinator. She asked me a series of behavioral questions and then she sent me over to meet the clinical managers on the upper east side. I met two supervisors- one for each department and then the manager came in and asked me further questions. ALL OF THE QUESTIONS WERE BEHAVIORAL INTERVIEW QUESTIONS. So if you prepare then you won't have to stop and think. They were really nice nonetheless.
Interview Questions: How do you complete tasks? How do you prioritize them? How do you monitor your progress? Tell me about a time you were in a challenging situation and how did you get out of this situation. What is our greatest strength? What is your greatest weakness? How do you handle criticism? How can we tell if you are overwhelmed? How would you handle your job duties if we were not able to assist you at any given time?

title: Research Study Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions:
First, I had a phone interview with a member of the Talent group. A few days later I was invited to an in-person interview. Upon arrival I spoke to the receptionist who failed to let me know that my interviewer would be late. My first interview was with a member of the Talent group. This interview was very straight forward. I was asked a few behavioral questions but most of the interview was the Talent member explaining the job (benefits, vacations, duties etc.) The Talent Group member was extremely nice! At the end, I was told to wait 30 minutes for my second interview. The second interview was with the Hiring Manager and Dept. Supervisor. This interview was relatively tough. I was asked many behavioral questions. I was asked many times about my future plans in a career/schooling. Pursing graduate school is a thought in every recent graduate's mind. Memorial Sloan Kettering takes pride in their "tuition reimbursement". Since this position's hours are flexible (7am-7pm), I was told you will not be allowed to take courses during the week (unless the course starts after 7pm...) The Hiring Manger made it clear that work always comes before school. Besides behavioral questions, there was time for questions. BE PREPARED! 
Overall, the interview was just average. After the interview and learning more about this job, I realized I did not want to commit two years in this position.

 
P.S my Hiring manager kept calling the Dept. Supervisor a different name. If I am encouraged to do my research, you should as well! Very unprofessional!
Interview Questions:
Future Plans
Leadership
Teamwork
How would you talk to terminally ill patients

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Didn't hear anything back. Later found out a friend works and had given him my resume to give to the HR. It's been 3 weeks and haven't heard anything back. Overall, he was a really nice guy.
Interview Questions: The questions were situational based questions. For example, was there a moment when you and your co-worker didn't see eye to eye and how did you handle it?

title: SA1 Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: General behavioral based questions. Make sure you are prepared with your stories. Even though you are nervous, don't let them see it. Answer every question fully and try to incorporate their feedback. They will be jotting down everything you say so don't get nervous or try to look at their paper.
Interview Questions: How did you deal with a difficult boss?

title: Accession Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I went through an agency for a temporary position. When I had to head to MSKCC I first met with a high up administrator for a primary interview, before being brought down to the lab to meet with the staff I would be working with daily. Both women interviewed me with the same questions. "Tell me about yourself", I gave my background, my lab experience. They like you to be personable, clean cut, organized, and very polite.
Interview Questions: They like to ask you why you want to work at Memorial Sloan Kettering, to make sure your values match up with the hospitals.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: A whole day of interview with 3 to 4 principal investigators. Very standard graduate student recruitment process. Some tend to ask very tough questions and some don't. You need to know your own research very well.
Interview Questions: Technical questions

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, and got an email from a recruiter about a week later, to schedule a phone screen for the following week.   During the phone screen we talked about my experiences related to the position and my salary requirements -- the job turned out to be offering much less than I was looking to accept, and I was a little over qualified, so I was not surprised to get their e-mail a week later saying they had moved on to other candidates.
Interview Questions: Salary requirements.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Applied through a job fair with my college, and passed an initial cover letter and and resume review. I was asked to come to New York for an interview, where I met with hiring manager with Sloan. Our interaction with half interview, and half explaining what a clinical research coordinator does at Sloan.
Interview Questions:
What has your past experience with statistical software been? 

Other questions related to behavior and past research experience.

title: Exercise Physiologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I waited over 30 minutes past my scheduled time before being seen and Alison seemed disappointed to see me. She asked the same questions during the phone interview at the on-site interview which felt like a waste of time since i travelled from out of town on my own expense to come to the interview. She did not know much about the EP field and tried proceeded to denounce my experience. Overall, it felt like I was brought in to meet a diversity interviewee quota to maintain their funding. I never heard from her again.
Interview Questions: She asked me two questions that were the same twice and when I responded with the same answer she seemed baffled.

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: first I was given an online assessment (about 45 minutes long) on data entry, math, behavioral questions.  I passed so I was given a telephone interview.  then called in for a face to face interview.  the interview is not difficult but they ask alot of situational/ behavioral questions.  the only way to prepare for these questions is to prepare several stories of when you had a difficult situation or had to meet a deadline.  why do you want to work for us?  what do you know about msk? how would you handle.....
Interview Questions: situational questions.  Im horrible at answering those.

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application online and within 2 days I got a call from a HR representative who gave  me a brief interview (15 minutes tops)  over the phone. By the end of the phone call I was asked to come in for another Interview with him in person where were went over my resume and the position. I received a phone call later asking for another interview with managers at a location which was about 1 hour and 30 minutes long. Within a the week I was called back and offered the position.
Interview Questions: Name a time where you made a bad decision

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Interview process starts with the HR representative. If you pass that interview, you will be asked to see the supervisors. A good set of questions were asked during the interview with the managers so make sure to review the typical interview questions.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were pretty common like why do you want to work at Sloan and tell me a time you have to deal with a difficult person.

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, then online testing on basic computers, typing, and behavioral questions. Then phone interview, in person interview with coordinator then doctor. The doctor interview is more of a personality fit, by then you have the job. Salary is 39.5K.
Interview Questions: Weakness, strengths, time you missed a deadline, why do you want to work at MSK, talk about an accomplishment.

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for the position and I was asked to do an online assignment and about a week later I received an email to book a phone interview. The phone interview was short and she went straight to some questions. The first one was: Is this a good time to talk? Well, if I confirmed the time and day for the interview, what kind of question was that?
Then she asked why healthcare? why did you choose our organization?
It took less then 10 minutes but the feeling much was longer and boring. A week later she emailed me saying I didn't go to the next round.
Interview Questions: Why healthcare?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Professors working in related fields asked students to talk about a specific project that they parcipatated. They will ask questions to make sure that the student has a good understanding of the project and science. They also asked about whether there were specific topics that we were interested in.
Interview Questions: Why do you apply for MSK?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview Process involved traveling to a job fair like convention for college students. At a hotel you walk into a big room with tables from different companies. You get asked a few questions within a 20 minute time span and then leave. If you move to the next stage, you must complete an online test, and then you get called into a one on one interview with a physician
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I got referred by someone, got contact for an interview immediately. The interview was ok, they asked what I knew about the company, about the position, and a lot about my past related experiences.
Interview Questions: What are the duties of a POA?

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with HR first. He arranged an actually interview for the job. On the day of the interview, I met with HR for a 1:1 interview. It was quick and simple questions were asked. Then I went and met with the head of the department that I would be working in. That was a more difficult interview (see below). I was asked for my references via email later that night.
Interview Questions: They asked a lot of questions that they wanted answers with using past sitauations in real life. Ex: Name a time you needed to accomplish something with a group. How will your past experience help you in this position? No typical interview questions were asked.

title: POA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Met with HR and progressed to group interview and then one-on-one interview. The entire process was very smooth and most of the interview was done throughout one day. It was a great experience to be involved in.
Interview Questions: What qualities do you have to contribute to this hospital

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was set up through my university. Set up a time to interview over email. There wasn't anything very memorable about the interview. The interview was very causal. I've seen other potential volunteers come into their interviews with jeans and a blzer.
Interview Questions: Why Memorial Sloan Kettering?

title: Practice Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Pretty quick. Received a phone interview the next day and in person interview with the same HR recruiter a week later. Overall experience was alright. Initially it was quick. However, the in person interview didn't seem as enthusiastic. The recruiter interview was pretty repetitive & she seemed very uninterested. A month later, it felt as if it was a waste of time. But make sure to be well prepared. Know a lot about MSK and be confident. Review resume and have a few stories to shares with good and bad experiences.
Interview Questions: What do you know about MSK? A scenario depicting a difficult situation amongst co-workers & how did you handle it? What do you feel about teamwork. A lot of emphasis on team work and difficult time working with a people.

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
