Interview Descriptions: The process itself is a well-oiled machine. You will see HR first for a screening and then have 1-2 more interviews with the supervisors at the location you will be working.
Interview Questions: What are your salary expectations?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, it took about two weeks until I was called for an on the phone interview. after hearing my background they believed I was a better fit for the physician office assistant. I then was asked to take an online assessment. After the assessment I followed up and had an interview with the HR recruiter. during the interview I was then sent to the Administrative coordinator in the department I was to work in. The interview was very nice and so were the people. be prepared for a very long list of questions about your goals in life, along with some " what would you do questions". i was not offered the position but I am interviewing in other departments. Its a pretty competitive process for good reasons.
Interview Questions: the most difficult question for me was how would I immediately start to organize the the schedules of the doctors I would be working for.

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Sent in my application and got an email a few weeks later asking to take an online test. The next day I was called to schedule an interview. I was away at the time, so could not come in for a few weeks. The initial interview took all of 10 minutes, which was pretty much just a screening to make sure you are able to effectively communicate and "practice" for the real interview that was scheduled for the next day. The next round was with two people who asked a long list of typical interview questions that were mostly fair. The interviewer's were extremely nice and made me feel comfortable. After the interview they had me wait outside while they discussed. They then came out 10-15 minutes later informing me that I had moved on to the final round of interviews which took place that day. Not as many questions were asked in the last interview and they were similar to the questions already asked except for a few variations. Overall, the whole process went well and everyone there was really friendly. They informed me that they would let me know by the end of the week, however I did not hear from them for two weeks. After those long two weeks, I received the email that I did not get the job.
Interview Questions: What was a time where you had to convince a co-worker to do something that they didn't want to do?

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I filled out an application online on MSKCC's career webpage. A week or so later, I received an email from a talent recruiter letting me know about an online assessment that I had to take before scheduling an interview. I passed the test, and then a few days later received a call from said recruiter asking when I was available to meet with him. I went in a week later, and the meeting was mostly like a pre-interview. He informed me about the position, and then asked me questions similar to what they would ask in a formal interview.
Interview Questions:
Describe a time when you were under a time crunch and how you dealt with it. 
Describe a time when you went above and beyond to provide exceptional customer service
Describe a time when you worked in a group setting with others

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: You start with interview with HR and if you move on you meet with two department managers and interview with the two of them at once. Then you move on to interview with the building administrator.
Interview Questions: Why MSK

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: the entire process entailed 5 interviews in total. Each interview was about 5-10 minutes and scattered over the course of a month and half. Overall I would say it was a long process but I believe they purposely make it this way to see that you are committed to wanting to work here.
Interview Questions: What would you do if your boss was pressuring you to get information from a patient and you couldn't?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick, I first had a phone interview with a member of the Talent Acquisitions team. And then I had a in person interview with two administrators. I was very nervous and did not make it past the second interview. I believe there were one or two more people that needed to interview me after them. The interview had alot of scenario questions, which I do not like.
Interview Questions: Describe a time in which you felt your employer was unfair.

title: Research Study Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a lot of behavioral questions, the ones you can directly lift off of google. Fun if you like storytelling, you have to be sharp on questions like what is your weakness, etc.
Interview Questions: They asked how I managed a conflict between previous supervisors telling me to do different and opposing things?

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I got refered by an agency to one of MSK talent recruiters.  I had an intital phone conversation with the recruiter and then an interview soon after that.  After the recruiter interview I met with 2 practice managers for an hr and then directly after that their supervisor for another hour and recieved a tour of one of the floors to get an idea of the session assistant layout.  Los of behavioral questions and tell me a time when....questions. The process took about 3 weeks, but that it because I was only available on certain days to interview and they were very accomadating to meeting me a week apart each time.  This isn't for the faint of heart, you need to be able to stick around, and you should want to because MSK is a great company, so don't mess around with them, this isn't just "another job".
Interview Questions:
Name a time you had to go above and beyond

Give me a time you had an idea that everyone was against, and how you proceeded with it.
 An example of a time you had to make a quick decision

I displayed extraordinary customer service, and (2) one example where I participated in a group activity.

How you’ve shown leadership

What would you do if a co-worker of yours was being exceptionally lazy or not doing his/her job?

stressful situation and how you handled it, how do you feel about team work &give an example of when you worked on a team

Name a time when you failed at something?

Give us one example of when you did not agree with your boss and what you did about it.

Have you ever received feedback that you did not agree with?

Tell us about a time where you made a mistake.
 When was a time you showed empathy?
 When was a time you missed a deadline?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: It was a long and frustrating process, but in the end it was a great first job out of college for me.  I commuted in 3 separate days for interviews, and on one day a physician kept me waiting an hour and a half before she met me for the interview.  However, I am glad I stuck with the process because I enjoyed working there.
Interview Questions: Where do you live?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is very long.  You have to interview with a lot of people within your department.  Can be several months between when you submit your application and hear back.  One woman in my orientation group had twelve interviews before being offered a position.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Had a total of four interviews, one over the phone with HR recruiter, one with administrative manager and another office assistant, third interview with direct manager and final interview with head nurse at the clinic.
Interview Questions: What is the key to success so that workflow can function properly?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied through career services from my university.  Very laid back feel, straightforward questions.  I had an initial interview in the fall, and they asked me to contact them later in the year when they had an idea of what positions would be open.  Still waiting on that, but an overall pleasant process.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation when you utilized teamwork.

title: Research Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had 3 separate interviews: first with HR, then with my potential supervisor and lastly with the PI I'd be assisting. The interview with HR was to gage my experience in the Admin. Field. The interview with the supervisor was to express the role duties and expectations. The interview with the PI was to explain his work and what he needs extra help with.
Interview Questions: What's your greatest weakness?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by phone with HR and then came in to an in person interview. We talked about my previous experience at rival MD Anderson in Houston. After interviewing for about 20 minutes, I was asked if i could interview with the department. I shuttled over to the Upper East Side for the next interview and met with 2 ladies who told me more about the position. The asked if I was busy later in the day and then scheduled my next interview in with the department head. I met with a board of 4 women who all asked very intense questions about my skills and experience. I received an offer, 45 minutes after leaving my last interview!
Interview Questions: How do you deal with immediate patients?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3+ months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Contacted a recruiter through email after months of applying through the website. Immediately got called in and had an HR phone interview where then they asked me to come in two weeks to have an in person HR interview. After the HR interview I met with the CRM followed by both CRC. I was then called back to interview with a physician in the service. Following that interview I was sent an email asking for references to complete an online survey. Didn't hear back for two weeks and then finally was offered the position.
Interview Questions: A lot of the question were experienced base such as how have you handled a co worker who isn't pulling their weight?

title: Commercial Insurance Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I applied for this position online. I received a call back from HR and a telephone interview, two weeks later from the job posting date.  A week later I had a interview the supervisor it went very well. They were extremely nice.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for MSKCC?

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied through my undergrad career services counselor, online. I heard back  from a talent recruiter 2 weeks later asking to interview with me over the phone. I was out of the country at that moment so I didn't meet with him until another 3 weeks after. I met with the recruiter at their HR office on 40th and 3rd which lasted about 30 minutes. Mostly questions about customer service and why I want to work at MSKCC. That same day, I also met with 2 managers who started out as session assistants and were  very welcoming. This interview was much longer, about an hour. They ask very detailed questions so be prepared to be as specific as possible. And ask questions. Then I met with the hiring manager which was a shorter meeting. I heard back that I was hired 2 days later. I don't start for another 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you didn't agree with your boss's instructions.

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received an email about going through with the position. Did a personality and computer skill test online and then got a phone call a week later. Discussed why I wanted to join Memorial Sloan and generic questions. Made an appointment for interview during the phone call. The interview took about half hour and mostly behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength and biggest weakness?

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the MSKCC website, and was notified one week later to take a skills/personality test online. A few hours later I received a call from a recruiter to ask some basic questions- why I wanted to go into healthcare, etc- and we set up an in-person interview for the following week. I met with a recruiter who asked only 2-3 behavioral questions and said he would be in touch if I made it to the next round. I was not called back for the next round, and did not like the idea that the interview was only based on so few questions.
Interview Questions: Talk about a time you went above and beyond to provide exceptional customer service.

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty easy. I had my HR interview and 1st round interview all in the same day. Received an email asking me to come back for second round interviews. Went on the second round interviews and the same day I received the call that I was being granted the position.
Interview Questions: How can you deal with different personalities?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Pretty intense but totally doable, just prepare a nice presentation and yourself and you gonna be fins. Sometimes strong focus on publicaiton record but depends on PI. Overall great experience and very useful feed-back.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, day after got a call from recruiter. She sent me an online assessment. As soon as I finished it she called me and we had an interview. A couple of weeks later I went in for an interview. She didn't seem very welcoming.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you failed at something?

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Two initial interviews with a packet of questions. Ended up being very conversational. After the interview was done with the initial two managers, I met with their manager for a final review.
Interview Questions: Name a time you had to make a quick decision and what conclusion you came too.

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and used an employee  reference. This got my an interview, which I did not get, but they passed my resume to another department, where I interviewed and did not get. THEN it was forwarded to another department, and I did not get the position! (Maybe it's time to give up!) Overall it was a good experience, just very slow. This whole process took four months.
Interview Questions: Some interviewers asked basic questions off of a standardized sheet (strengths and weaknesses, experience working with difficult coworkers), while others asked more specific job related questions (what would you do if a patient did not want to enroll in a study?)

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Was interviewed by HR first (very easy; essentially a practice interview), then by two Administrators simultaneously, then by the Administrative Coordinator, then by physicians if you pass all previous steps.
Interview Questions: Give us one example of when you did not agree with your boss and what you did about it.

title: Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: After submitting a letter and resume I had a phone interview and then was called in for a 3/4 day of interviews.  I met with my potential boss for an hour, had a Skype interview there with the person I would be replacing and then met with the two designers I would be overseeing.
Interview Questions: Insistence (repeated questioning) on naming specific research methodologies.  Even after describing and naming various methods I've used in the past for ethnographic and design research and discussing outcomes, the interviewer wanted me to assign vocabulary to these methods and seemed to be focused very narrowly on whether I got these names "right."

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Campus recruiting, then interview, and then they sent an assessment test to see if you move on to the next round. I got past the initial interview, but didn't find out about the assessment test until later, and ultimately did not pass the assessment test.
Interview Questions: Name a time where you had to go above and beyond.

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was first emailed by the HR recruiter with an assessment test, which contained a MS Word test, some math word problems, a personality assessment, and a few other things. I finished it up and he contacted me saying I passed and he wanted to schedule an in-person interview. We interviewed - a very informal, relaxing meeting - he just asked me a few questions and then told me I'd be interviewing with two managers. The interview with them was much more official and tedious, be ready to tell stories and have examples ready! This took about 1 hour. Afterwards, they told me I'd be interviewing with their manager, who asked me about half as many questions the first two managers did. They told me I'd hear from them and I got a phone call a few hours later with the job offer! Just be super friendly, make eye contact, shake hands and thank them for their time after the interviews. Be specific, have stories ready for their questions, have your strengths and weaknesses prepared and you'll be fine.
Interview Questions: Tell us a time when you disagreed with something your coworker did and how you handled it.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds of interviews, 5 people in the first and 7 people in the second with one last interview with the boss. Didn't hear back from the boss for two months and suddenly got an offer and a deadline to accept! It was a hard decision.
Interview Questions: Tell me anything about you that's work unrelated. Caught me completely off guard!

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was not hired, I was referred to by my old professor, and was called about a month later. The people were friendly, including the doctor that interviewed me. After about a half hour with him, he gave me a tour of the lab and then led me to a second interviewer.
Interview Questions: Do you see yourself in a leadership role?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is very length and a wait time. I worked as a temp trying to get a position. They really didn't give a chance. I took the very confusing test and scored low.
Interview Questions: The exam to become a POA or SA. The questions are useless except for the data entry but overall its meant for you to fail/

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online through the company website. A couple of weeks later, I was contacted to complete the skills and personality assessment that I did the same day. The following day, I received a call from HR notifying me that I passed the assessment and the next step would be a phone interview. The phone interview was a day or two after, and I was asked some basic questions about my interest in the position, organization, and in health care. At the end of the phone interview, I was asked to come in for an interview at HR. The next week I went to HR and met with the same recruiter that I did the phone interview with. He gave me more details about the position and shared some additional information about MSKCC. For the interview, he asked me some personality questions. That same day I was sent to the department and met with a manager. The department manager asked me several more questions to assess my personality and behavior in different situations. I was very pleased with this interview and was under the impression after my conversation with the manager that she was interested in hiring me. She told me I would hear back with in a week and that the next phase in the hiring process would continue in about 3 weeks.

I did not hear anything until I sent a follow up email two weeks after the interview with the manager. I was not selected for that position, but the hiring manager did contact HR to recommend that I still be considered for the position in another department. The same HR contact called me about 3 weeks after my in-person interview to set up another interview at a different department with 2 Clinical Practice Supervisors. During that interview, they asked several questions about my personality, how I would act in different situations, general questions about strengths, weaknesses, etc. Although the questions were not too difficult to answer, they did want specific examples for each. At the end of that interview, they asked me to wait about 15 minutes so they could review my answers and discuss their thoughts. After 15 minutes, one of the supervisors informed me that they wanted me to meet with their manager. I met with the manager immediately after and she asked me some more questions about my past work experience, experience with projects/ long term goals, and again about personality/ behavior. 

That evening, I received a call from HR offering me the position. At each interview, everyone was friendly and open to questions. It was a longer interview process than I have ever experienced but it was not difficult or intimidating to have to go through different people.
Interview Questions:
What are some of your strengths/ weaknesses? How do you deal with weaknesses? 
Have you ever received feedback from a manager that you disagreed with? 
What was a positive/ negative outcome or experience when working in a group? 
Name a time you had a difficult conversation with someone? What was the outcome? 
Why MSKCC?
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
Have you ever worked on a long-term project? What was the outcome?

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a few positions at MSKCC, however they emailed me and said they were looking for session assistants. In the email was a link to an assessment that included data entry, math, personality and Microsoft windows questions. The assessment was pretty easy and I took it on a Thurs. By Monday I received a call from an HR recruiter and she gave me a quick interview. She asked why I wanted to be in healthcare. She then scheduled me a face to face interview with another HR recruiter by Friday. On Friday that recruiter gave a fairly brief and easy interview. Just two behavioral questions one of which was name a time where you displayed exceptional customer service. He then set me up with an administrative manager for that following Monday. This interview was much longer and definitely had a lot of situational questions. Have plenty of stories ready. Be able to sell yourself, why do you want to work at MSKCC. I received the offer the same week, that Friday :D be personable, have fun & good luck !
Interview Questions: Name a time where you received criticism that you disagreed with.

title: Research Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by HR after uploading my resume to the MSKCC site.  After meeting with her I was schedule for 3 separate interviews where I met with the department Administrator, Administrative Manager, Professional Admin. staff and the Principle Investigators that I would eventually support
Interview Questions: Have I ever worked in a fast paced environment

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I received a call from a nurse recruiter asking very basic questions.  Then went in to interview first with the nurse recruiter.  Next I interviewed with the Nurse Manager of the unit.  Then was invited back to do an "observational interview" where I spent two hours on the unit and met briefly with the manager afterwards.  I was told I would receive a call the next week about their decision.  I never received a call, called and left a message with the nurse recruiter & manager, no one called back.  I finally learned the position was filled by talking to someone in HR who looked it up in the computer.  Very unprofessional way of handling not being offered the position, especially since I was traveling each time from out of state.
Interview Questions: If I asked your current manager your biggest weakness what would she say.

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Referred by friend. Had initial phone interview then interview in New York with HR.  After HR was sent to interview with 2 people in charge of SA's.  Then interviewed with manager. Called within that week and offered job!
Interview Questions: What was one time you have shown flexibility in your schedule

title: Payment Poster Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I initially had a one on one interview with an individual in Human Resources on the fifth floor. Was asked a couple questions pertaining to the company and was briefly told about the job (in a general sense) and was given some pointers. Then afterwards had an interview with the department assistant manager/supervisor where i was asked about my previous work experiences and if I understood the process of how things worked in the department I was going to be working in.
Interview Questions: Do you have any relatable work experience?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a rigorous one. I had a total of 3 interviews before getting the position. It isn't necessarily hard just lengthy.
Interview Questions: Have you ever failed at anything? How did you handle it?

title: Fundraising Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I went through a phone and then in-person interview.  HR was very fast-moving at the start and very professional. I felt that the in-person interview went well, but something hadn't clicked. My follow ups were not acknowledged. More than six months later I received an automated reply thanking me for my application and saying the position had been filled.
Interview Questions: Describe the difference between various fundraising platforms

title: Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had a few interviews with two call backs. i researched the company and its history to have a better understanding of how successful it is.I was always treated very well for my hard work.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Clinical Systems Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Quick turn around time on job offer. Came in for interview 2x. Nothing I needed to worry about. Spent an hour and half with my current manager just talking about the job. We got along well from the beginning.
Interview Questions: What do you do when you don't know what to do?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied via my school's career post. I came in for an in person interview and was interviewed by two administrators. Questions were relatively generic and broad- Why do you want this position? Why MSK? Where do you see yourself in 5+ years. Interviewers were very polite and kind. They called back very quickly with a decision.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5+ years?

title: RSA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: The process was not difficult. There are multiple interviews in different buildings so there is a bit of travelling through the city on the interview day. Overall not a bad experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Clinical Laboratory Technologist I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process for me went pretty well and fast. I was referred to by a friend. I got a call the following week from HR and was scheduled for an interview the same week. The interview with HR was casual and fast they just asked me the usual questions (reason for leaving, current job title/description etc). That same day I also had an interview with the Lab manager, supervisor, lead techs and  a few people in the lab. This time the interview was more lengthy since I met and talked with everybody. The interview was more formal they asked mostly behavioral questions. After the interview, I immediately got a call from HR and they asked me to fill up my references. After a week they offered me the job. From this point on HR will email you a bunch of stuff to do such as drug test, background check, medical etc.
Interview Questions:
-What are you strengths and weaknesses?
-Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
- Describe a difficult situation and explain how you positively handled it.
- What is your current salary? What is your salary expectation?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Asked for my resume. Seemed impressed with my GPA, but were full for the summer.
Interview Questions: Never got around to this part, unfortunately.

title: RN Postion Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I met with HR and then the following week I met with the nurse manager and a clinical nurse specialist. HR interview was typical interview questions &2nd interview was more technical questions. Be prepared to discuss resume and clinical rotations. Everyone was very friendly and it seems like a great place to work overall. I am in the process of going for a third interview.
Interview Questions:
How would I describe my leadership qualities?
How would I avoid becoming an overworked nurse?
How would I perfrom an assessment and what abnormalities would I be looking for?

title: Research Study Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
Really pleasant overall, very nice and comfortable. You need to be there on time. I recommend getting there 15 minutes early, they want you to show that you are interested in the position and serious about being there. Make sure you can talk about your resume in debt, if you are a recent college or still in college make sure you can talk about all of the jobs you've had (even summer jobs like camp counselors etc.) be sure to know your interests as well. For the HR interview most of the questions are about situations you've been in, like have you ever worked in a team, whats a situation you've been disrespected. 
You will interview with the people who are directly in charge of the service you applied for, make sure you have questions for them, they don't need to be seriously informational but should show that you are interested enough in the position to have done some research. If you have done previous research they will ask about it, make sure you can talk in detail about it, how many data points, protocols, etc.
Interview Questions: how many data points did you collect during your research

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online in February and received an invitation to take an assessment. The next day I was contacted by a recruiter who gave me a short phone interview and invited me in for an interview the following week. The day of the interview I met with the recruiter and she set me up for all my interviews for the same day. I met with two administrative supervisors, then two administrative managers and then with the physicians I would be working with. One of the physicians was unavailable and I was scheduled to come back the following week to meet with her. Th interviews all went extremely well. They were professional yet very inviting and relaxed. The physicians were VERY nice ladies. The interviews were about 30 mins to an hour and consisted of many behavioral and job based questions. They wanted specific clear answers that tied to previous employment. BE VERY CLEAR IN YOUR ANSWERS.
Interview Questions: Name three things that you need to work on. It comes up in all job interviews and I am never quite prepared for it.

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Mostly situational based questions, how you would react in particular situations. As well as how you deal with stress and remembering situations in which you faced particular problems and how you dealt with it. For example, how would I know you were stressed?, tell me about a time where someone did not treat you the way you expected and how you dealt with that.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a long-term project and how you dealt with meeting deadlines and you're overall interest during the time of the project.

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: 1st you take online assessment, then you go to HR for and interview, then you meet with the specific department you applied for which can have multiple interviews before you actually start working
Interview Questions: How would you handle an interaction with a patients family whose loved one was just diagnosed with cancer?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the career portal of the MSKCC website. I completed my profile and uploaded resume etc. applied to various positions. I Received an email for the Assessment test. next, had an HR interview. Then met with the department staff for interview. Overall the process was quick and easy set time aside to complete the assessment.
Interview Questions: What was your most difficult tasks at your previous employment

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Wasn't too difficult asked me about previous research experience in terms of IRB approval, writing, protocold rafting, as well as data collection and analysis, comfort with presenting and comfort with manuscript writing. also asked about comfort with presenting at national, domestic and international conferences and with using excel for statistics calculations
Interview Questions: Can you write a publication

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Its best to know someone that works in the company so they can refer you. Memorial relies on referral when considering candidates for positions. And also do your research about the position first. After i applied, a friend of mine took my resume and sent it to the recruiter. Then i got a call after completing the required assessment. Then a few days after, i got a call for an interview. On that same day, i did 3 interviews. Then by the end of the week, i got a call that they would like to offer me a position.
Interview Questions: A lot for the questions are behavioral. Ex: what will you do if you have a rude patient? How will you handle the situation?

title: Medical Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very difficult interview.. over the phone call, then a interview with human resource assistant then  two human resources managers then a interview with two doctors.
Interview Questions: so many behavioral questions.. each interview had about 5-15 questions a piece

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Extremely long process for interviewing beginning with human resources and then multiple members of the department I was interviewing for.  HR is extremely slow process.  Difficult to find out status during interview process.
Interview Questions: Do you really want this job ?

title: Veterinary Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I met with different groups of staff. It started with a group of technicians in the department that shared the current position. After that, there were individual interviews with different members of senior staff (Managers and Directors).
Interview Questions: What are you hoping to learn here?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: went fine, too many interviews. the building isnt that easy to get to from penn station. confusing to find your way around there too. overall though the people seemed friendly, I have a buddy who just got a job there and seems happy.
Interview Questions: What challenges have you faced over the phone?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Took me 3 months to get the job. I didn't get in after my first round of interviews (4 interviews) But I kept applying. Basically once you go past HR interviews, you just have to impress the mangers who interview you. If you don't get it the first time, keep applying to different services and departments. You are going to be interviewed by different people so you will eventually meet someone who likes you or thinks you are fit for the job.
Interview Questions:
Long term goal. 
Short term goal
Can you commit to 2 years? ( you don't sign any legal documents that holds you to this)
Why MSKCC? why Cancer?
Any research experience?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process took about a month and a half for me due to scheduling issues. The first interview I had was with a recruiter who asked me basic questions about myself and my background. She also asked a few questions about working in a team and difficult situations that I have been in at work and how I handled them. Those last questions were to prepare me for the interview that I would have with the two Administrative Managers the following week. My interview with the two managers went well. They asked about 20 questions ranging from what my role is usually in a team to if I had ever made a mistake during my job. As long as you give genuine detailed answers you should be fine. My second interview took the longest (about an hour and half) but that was because they were extremely friendly so it was easy to talk to them and get more in depth about my experiences. The last interview was with the doctors that I would be working for. I was a little nervous at first but as soon as I came in to meet with them I quickly realized that there was nothing to be nervous about because they were so nice! They didn't really ask me any of the usual interview questions. They just asked more questions about my personality and what my future goals were. I was offered the position the next day. Overall it was a great interview process!
Interview Questions: Have you ever received feedback that you did not agree with?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Not the ideal interview experience.

I spoke on the phone with HR immediately after a current employee referred me. I had a brief interview with HR to discuss general details about the position and company. Afterwards, I had to go to a second campus and interview with the program manager. She was lovely and asked me to come in and speak with two more people, including the Dr. Later, I interviewed with the Research Coordinator and was asked a slew of general, behavior type questions from a guide. At my interview with the doctor, I learned she was out of the country. They let me speak with a current research assistant. She was insightful about the position pros and cons and it was honestly a helpful exchange. I set up another interview with the doctor and she mentioned the next step would be meeting more staff.

HR contacted me the next week to say that they were continuing ahead with other candidates, but that he wanted me to interview with different departments. I had two "blitz" interviews, where I met with up to three departments at a time.  From one of the blitz interviews, I spoke with the incoming head doctor and followed up with the Clinical Research Coordinator.

A month later, HR sent an email saying the position was filled.

 While I did feel HR was genuinely interested in adding me to the company, I felt really pulled around with the many interviews I had. At the end of the day, I had 8 interviews with MSK with varied departments/people, and in different buildings. That's a lot of time, stress, and energy spent to not get offered a position.
Interview Questions: During a blitz interview with multiple departments, "why do you want to work with us?"

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied through Linkedin and received a phone interview within the next few days. I then was asked to come in for an initial interview. I was told there are three stages to the interview. If you get to human resources, you probably got the job. I had three interviews in one day, which was completely exhausting, when I was told I would be there for one -- I forgot the names of people by the end of the second interview, and was tested on their names in the last interview and I couldn't remember them. Interview questions weren't necessarily challenging. I knew within a short amount of time being there that the position was not paid enough for the commute and responsibilities, although the benefits are good.
Interview Questions: What are the names of everyone you met with today?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: The process, overall, was smooth and timely. A MSKCC recruiter for another department forwarded my resume to the department that I interviewed with. First, there was a phone interview that lasted less than 20 minutes. Then, I was invited to interview in person. In total, I met with 5 people, including my direct supervisor, his "bosses", and the attending physician.
Interview Questions: Questions included "Tell me about yourself," "Why MSKCC." I was also asked where I see myself in two years / do I want to go back to school, strengths & weaknesses, my understanding of the position I was applying for.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Email conversations then phone interviews with the HR personnel. Then they requested to send transcripts and references and letters of recommendation. After a few week I got my first email for selection process and matching to suitable lab or department. I was provided with a list of mentors and the project proposals. I sent the list back with my preference, which was probably matched with mentors' list of favorable interns. After the process was over, I received another email, announcing my acceptance to the program. Then there was a long list of papers to be filled out, immunization and background checks. Then I was interviewed by the direct supervisor  who would be in charge of me.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, your interests?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Sent in my application and then about 4 weeks later was contacted by one of the current lab technicians. We then set up a time and day for interview quick and easy. The interview processes was very good- I was questioned by 4 lab members and the PI. Things went well but no offer in the end.
Interview Questions: What do you see yourself doing in 5 years?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process required a lot of traveling. The first "round" was with a talent acquisitions manager who required me to take a computer test before the meeting. He also asked me a few questions that would be asked in the real interview. This was prep for the second "round" with two hiring managers who asked me around 15-20 questions. They required me to be specific in my answers. After that, I was called back to meet with a doctor, his nurse, and administrative assistant. This interview was short, just a few questions on conflict resolution.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about a time where you made a mistake.
When was a time you showed empathy?
When was a time you missed a deadline?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Process was very pleasant- they called me to schedule an interview a few days after I applied (I had previously met a recruiter at a career fair), and I interviewed the next day with the Talent Acquisition Specialist, then with the Research Coordinator. A few days later, I interviewed with the Research Manager, and then the doctors that I would be working for. Everyone was extremely  pleasant.
Interview Questions: Mainly behavioral questions and those pertaining to research- "how do you deal with deadlines? What would be your greatest challenges in this position?"

title: Performance Improvement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Several rounds of interviews. Be prepared to discuss PI and project management experience.  Some clinical knowledge is ideal, but not a requirement. Be able to talk about how you interact with physicians, leaders, and how you may manage multidisciplinary teams. First round with department administrator, second and third with department managers.
Interview Questions: Straight forward. Nothing unexpected.

title: Research Study Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Had four Interviews, with HR, Research manager, Research Coordinator and the PI. The interview process was not that bad more of a conversation and focused on working under pressure and analyzing data.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation and how you handled it.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The hiring manager was very kind, and the interview was very conversational.  The questions were not challenging, and the hiring manager was genuinely interested in my career background and work experiences.  The projects she described seemed challenging and exciting.  She did not ask me too many questions.  In many ways, I was guiding the structure of the interview.
Interview Questions: Q: Tell me about yourself

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Presentation and meeting with lab. Met with entire lab and answered their questions. Interview was a basic one with meeting with boss, head scientists, lab members and graduate students. Good experience. Overall experience was good. I am not sure what else to say about the process.
Interview Questions: Scientific training and area of expertise

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very well organized and thought out. Lasted about 5 hours total because I requested to have it done in one day. Met with about 6 people total. They were very professional and asked questions that made me give specific examples. It almost felt like a life test. Was a great experience to go through because it required me to be prepared and direct with my answers. They were sharp!
Interview Questions:
Describe a time when took initiative and what was the outcome?
Describe a time when you overcame a creative obstacle?
Describe a tim when you went above and beyond?

title: IRB/PB Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: An HR rep first called me to set up an interview. Met with several people who asked the standard hiring questions, nothing weird or unusual. A second interview was set up later. I was told that if you get the 2nd interview it basically means they're interested in offering the position.
Interview Questions: How I handle stress, why I'm interested in MSKCC, what my previous employer would say I should work on improving, why I'm leaving my current job.

title: Health Law Paralegal Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: The first stage was to submit an online application.  I then received a call to screen me before the initial interview.  I was screen by a talent acquisition manager and that was who my initial interview was with. I went to the human resources building for my first interview.   She was very friendly and asked me several questions and also probed about my conflict resolution skills.  Upon the completion of that interview, I was given an hour and sent uptown to the general counsels office for the next round.  There I met with 2 women in the same room and was asked a wide variety of questions and reactions to scenarios and also the job was explained to me in more detail.  After that, I was shown around the office and then met one more man.  He asked me several questions and some seemed to contradict the women in terms of what the job description might entail.  I showed myself out in the end which seemed odd.  All in all it was a very long and tough interview, but the interviewers were very professional and respectful.
Interview Questions: No question was specifically difficult but most questions were extremely intricate.

title: Senior Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Very detail, well-organized. People are helpful. Interview process was pleasure.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: email first. then 2 phone interviews. then offer.
Interview Questions: One should have good publications.

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions:
Was referred for the position by a current employee. The next day I received a 5 - 10 minute phone call from the recruiter. He asked about why I chose healthcare, why did I want to work for MSKCC, college major, etc. Scheduled an face to face interview with the recruiter, he asked basic Behavioral questions (they want you to be very specific), the interview was very laid back and comfortable. 

I was scheduled for an interview the next day with two hiring managers at the main hospital. The interview was about 40 minutes, they also asked behavioral and situation questions, but they were very in depth. I'd suggest you prepare about 5 or 6 stories that you can immediately and fluently talk about on the spot. 

After that interview I was told to wait in a waiting room to see if I made it to the next and final interview with another hiring manager. This interview was very short (15-20 mins), she asked an additional 5 or 6 questions, some behavioral and some about past experiences. Overall the interview process was great; don't get nervous and practice, practive, practice!
Interview Questions: What is a personality trait of yours that others might misinterpret?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Had team interviews with the department that I was sent to. They took turns asking me questios from a sheet. After I was sent to interview with another group of mangers.
Interview Questions: Most questions are basic but know more about the organization itself.

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process happened very quickly. I was contacted on for an on-phone interview and proceeded in scheduling an on-site interview with HR and several supervisors. The interviews take about 30-45 minutes and I was also given a skills test. The interview process happened in 1 1/2 weeks and by the end of the second week, I was extended an offer.
Interview Questions: What is one of your greatest weaknesses?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I applied through their website and never heard back until I had a friend who put me in contact with one of the recruiters. I emailed that recruiter and he immediately set me up for an hr interview. The hr interview was very easy going and the questions that were asked were very simple. Then I was forwarded to a hiring manager whom I could not get in contact with that same day so i was scheduled for an itnerview the following week. I met with two of the hiring managers who were a bit uptight and asked close to 20 questions back and forth.
Interview Questions: What would you change about this hospital if you were hired?

title: Unit Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I was called by a recruiter which was very kind and asked me questions
Interview Questions: Why did you choose to become a unit assistant?

title: Research Study Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Meet with recruiter, meet with head researcher (MD) and management; very relaxed interview setting, nothing intense. Meeting with the recruiter is like meeting a stranger who knows nothing about the job you're applying for - they are just there to make sure you're normal. The 2nd and 3rd interviews were very relaxed. I had an over-the-phone interview that lasted 2 hours, not kidding. Very complex questions - group-oriented tasks, responding to high-pressure situations, etc.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 10 years?

title: Senior Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
After to responding to an ad online about the job, I received an email from the PI offering me an interview.  A week later, I had the interview with the PI and met some of the lab members.  Two days later, I received a call from HR asking me to come in for an HR interview since the PI was strongly considering me.  The HR interview was with a Talent Acquisition Specialist.  While there, I had to fill out an application and list my work history, as well as supply a copy of my CV.  

The HR interview was fairly standard, no curve ball questions.  Mainly why MSKCC, explain why you're leaving your current job, greatest accomplishment, future goals, how do your skills match the position, etc.  She also explained the benefits during this time.

About 3 days after the HR interview, I received a call from the specialist and was told that the PI wanted to offer me the job.  I gladly accepted and was then informed that I would be hearing from someone else in HR to assist with the Onboarding process.  This includes a mandatory urine drug test, background check, physical exam (exam + 2 TB tests), and filling out of tax forms and other HR paperwork.  Be aware that an outside agency does the background check; this is not the same as checking references.  They simply will confirm that you worked everywhere you list that you have worked the past 7 years and verify your education credentials.  They are very thorough!  They couldn't confirm one of my past employers over the phone with the company so I had to fax them my W2 proving I had worked there.  Be sure to provide as much information as possible for the background check to avoid delays. 

Overall, the hiring process took about 3-4 weeks to take care of all pre-employment clearances and paper work.  Once you're all set you'll attend new employee orientation for two days, then your first real day of work will be that Wednesday.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself that I would otherwise know from looking at your CV.

title: RSA Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I was initially contacted by the HR who then presented my resume to a certain department. I got a call for an interview which was with the Research Coordinator and the Research Manager. They asked behavioral questions to judge if I would be a good fit for the role or not. The interview lasted about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: There were not difficult questions. It was more like a behavioral assessment to see if the candidate is a good fit for the position or not.

title: Research Study Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a position online and then found a friend who worked there who also referred me internally. About a week or two later, I received a phone call with a general summary of the position and questions about my education and experience. I was then invited to an interview with the HR person and it was pretty relaxed. There were some standard "why do you want to work here/ think you are a good fit/ interested in cancer research?" questions followed by some behavioral questions. I was then sent to interview with the PI and their assistant, during which they mostly described the position and only asked a few questions about experience.
Interview Questions: There were a few questions about whether I knew how to use MATLAB or SPSS which I wasn't expecting because they were not listed or discussed previously.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Pretty slow
Interview Questions: speicific questions about on-going research

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: pretty easy. Did phone interview  with a recruiter from talent acquisition. few days later got a phone call again to meet in person after which I was partially considered and had to meet hiring managers for interviews
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviewers.  Both interviewer were very nice and welcoming.  Interview was easy, but definitely be prepared and know the organization well.  Interviewer asked a few questions and used the rest of the time to explain various programs and projects I would be working on.  Arrive early since the buildings are located in a very busy area of NY.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: First receive a phone call about job offer and in person interview date.  Next you meet with multiple interviewers.  If approved another interview is arranged with a new interviewer.  Lastly you get interviewed by the Provider you will be working under.
Interview Questions: List three words that a friend would use to describe you.

title: Assistant Research Bio Statistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied for this position one month ago and got a phone interview. All the interviewer asked is about the work experince I listed on the resume. No behavial questions. The interviewer is a predoctoral research fellow.
Interview Questions: What are other statistical analysis you know except those you mentioned on your resume?

title: Rehabilitation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Make sure to dress businessy, wear a suit or the equivalent for females. Take it very seriously and make sure to do your homework on the hospital. You'll start with an interview with HR and they will ask you series of situational questions and will ask typical strengths and weaknesses. Those are routine questions. If they like you they will try to send you straight to the department hiring manager for the position you are applying to. After you meet with that person you should wait about 1-2 weeks to hear from them.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you were in a tough situation and what did you do to handle it?

title: Research Study Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the center's website for the position.  Two weeks later, I called Human Resources to get a status update on my application; he offered me an interview for the following week.  He got back to me in 4 days saying that the researcher who was hiring would be deciding to go ahead with the other applicants instead.
Interview Questions: Please talk about your experiences and how you think they will contribute to this position.

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Met with Talent Acquisition Specialist and took a skills test.  About a month later (due to my schedule) met with two Administrative Coordinators at the main hospital site.  Second interview was more extensive with a lot of questions and details about the job.  The second interview lasted about an hour.
Interview Questions: What is a personality trait of yours that other people might misinterpret?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a very comfortable, yet thorough interview that covered my health sciences background as well as expectations from the role. The interviewer was friendly and gave helpful cues throughout.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a research study assistant?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I worked with one of the hospital recruiters and he was great and organizing and helping prepare me for the interviews. I had several interviews with various administrative managers and physicians. Overall, I thought the process was a little drawn out but well organized.
Interview Questions: Please tell us about a time where you made a mistake

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Internal reference got my resume on HR's desk after several months hearing nothing re my online application. Short phone interview with an HR rep, a week later interviewed with the same rep and two managers individually, onsite, in the space of a day. The followup was that they asked for 5 references, all of whom had to fill out a ranking survey. Once they were all complete, I heard from HR very quickly.
Interview Questions: What was a time when someone disrespected you?

title: Research Study Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Applied through HR but never heard back so I contacted the department directly and was offered an interview week later. HR phone interview, then met with CRC in person and then met with direct supervisor.
Interview Questions: Basic questions - why do you want this position?

title: Insurance Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, and I got an email from HR about 3 days later to come in for an interview. First I had an interview with a talent acquisition specialist in HR, and then with two group leaders and a supervisor, and then with a manager. The entire interview process took about 1.5-2 hours.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you had a tight deadline to meet and obstacle was thrown in your way.

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
I found out about this job through a recruiter. Once I passed their tests/interviews, I visited MSKCC's HR dept. I took a computer-based test that focused on typing speed (both numerical and lexical) and Microsoft Office knowledge. I then met with an HR rep who told me my test results (a simple pass/no pass answer) and discussed why I was interested in the positions (both a "floater" position and an specifically assigned doctor position were available). Important topics included "Why medicine?" and career goals. 

I passed that "round" and was asked take a shuttle to the Main hospital where I met with an Administrative Coordinator (physician office assistants' supervisor) and a Physician Office Specialist. They asked many questions based around teamwork (the standard "Tell me about a time..." type of questions). The final question was something along the lines of, "Why should we hire you?" I was then asked to wait outside while they determined whether I passed that round. I then met with an Administrative Manager (the Coordinator's supervisor). She asked questions along a similar vein.  

I was then thanked for my time and went home. I received an email from the HR rep that said they would like to have me move on to the next round. I interviewed with a doctor. Then I got another email inviting me to interview with the second doctor. I was offered a position as a physician office assistant to the second doctor.
Interview Questions: The most "difficult" question I personally encountered was asked by the Administrative Manager - "What frustrates you most while working?"

title: Research Study Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions:
I applied to multiple jobs on the MSK job portal. About a month later, I was contacted by Pirooz in HR to set up an interview for a specific RSA position. On a Wednesday, I first met with Pirooz in the HR office and he went over the position I'd be interviewing for, along with the format of the interview process. First would be direct managers, then the manager of the service, and finally the doctor I'd be working with.

I met with the direct managers who'd be supervising me for about 2 hours. They asked all the typical interview questions (e.g., name what you consider your greatest strength) and told me about the position. I had 10 minutes to review a paper description of the RSA role in regards to clinical trials, and then had a chance to ask questions. I'd prepped general questions in advance so I didn't have to think on the spot- that ended up being a good idea because there would have been silence had I not had questions. This portion of the process was the most intense and in depth.

I then met with the manager of the service- that interview was ~15 minutes and she spoke mostly about what trials the service works on. I was asked about my interests and what I'd like to get out of the job. Overall, this section felt much more like a conversation than an interview. This was the last interview of the day for me; the total time was 10am-4pm, including travel and waiting time.

On Thursday (the day after), I received a call from Pirooz that the service wanted to set up a meeting with the doctor I'd be working with, for the following Wednesday. That interview was quick (<10 min) and focused equally on my skills and questions about the job. I do hear that some doctors have a more intense interview, so this section is the most variable because they don't have an interview script.

The day after my meeting with the doctor, Pirooz let me know that they wanted to move forward with the background check, which is the last step in the hiring process. I got 5 references to fill out the online form that night (recommended) and submitted. The background check part was a bit more difficult, as the company that MSK hired reviewed every single thing written on my resume. So I put down a volunteer position I'd had at a local hospital, and then had to track down the now-retired volunteer coordinator to confirm my work there as they did not keep paper records. My recommendation is to only put on your uploaded resume and in your online application those jobs that are relevant and easy to track down confirmation of employment.

A week after my last interview, I heard again from Pirooz that my references and background check were successful, and that I got the job! Overall, a quick process for me. However, having now worked here for 2 years, I can say that this really depends on what is needed. Some people have waited 3 months to hear back from HR after submitting their online app, while others hear back the next day. However, once the interviews start, everything moves fairly quickly.

They ask for a 2 year commitment, but that's not written in stone- you're not bound to MSK. I do not know if this affects a recommendation that they would give for another job.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when a coworker you were friends with did something wrong and you were the only witness. How did you handle it?

title: Research Study Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Even though I submitted the resume and everything, I had to call to schedule an interview, which happened 2 weeks later.  During the interview, the hiring manager asked me very general questions, such as my past experiences and my education.  I think I was a bit underqualified for the position because I didn't have much experience in clinical research.  The interview went okay, but I didn't get a sense that I got the position.
