Interview Questions: Name a time you struggled to meet a deadline and how you handled that situation.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: person to person interview, mainly discuss about research experience. It is a job that really looks at what techniques do you have, does that match the lab need. It is varies a lot, depends on the lab. Every lab environment is different.
Interview Questions: tell me about your research experience. what skills do you have?

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a long day, but not too terrible. They make you take a test first thing to make sure you are a competent human being. It is mostly a personality-based test. I then met with the talent recruiter. After which he sent me to meet with two other women who actually ended up being my managers! Overall, it took about 4 hours.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you received negative criticism and how you handled it.

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: First interview was with HR. 2nd round with Admin Manager and office specialist. This next round is with one of the MD's and the Department Administrator.
Interview Questions: None really. Just go prepared. Hardest question I guess is when I was asked about a time I missed a deadline/How did I react when I was working with someone difficult.

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: If they like you, they will invite you for an initial interview. After the initial interview, if you get past that round, they will most likely send you an Assessment Test, which asks you personality questions as well as assess your typing speed. If you pass the test, they will invite you for an in-person interview in New York.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you had to go above or beyond?

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call from HR the day after which lasted about 5 minutes. Individual asked questions about how I heard about MSKCC and why I would like to work there. Set up an interview with a Talent Specialist (HR) for the week after. The day of, I took a one hour test that just tested computer and logic abilities, with personality questions. Spoke to Talent Specialist for ten minutes and was given another interview for the week after. The second interview, I met with two Supervisors for an hour and then a Manager for about an hour as well. Interview with Supervisors consisted of behavioral and scenario questions. Was asked for references then offered the job the next day.
Interview Questions:
Give me a time you had an idea that everyone was against, and how you proceeded with it.
An example of a time you had to make a quick decision.

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: The questions asked were reasonable and the process from beginning to end was pretty standard for a hospital.  There were different places within the hospital to do testing and interviewing, which you will need directions to get to. The interviewer asked pretty standard questions. Overall, the process wasn't bad for the externship.
Interview Questions:
Is this the field you are interested in specializing in after school?
Why do you have interest in this hospital?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I applied through an employee referral. I first had an interview with HR, then had an interview with 2 administrators, moved on to their supervisor, and then the doctor I would be working for. The interview with the 2 administrators took the longest, with around 15-20 questions.
Interview Questions:
When was a time you received feedback you did not agree with?
When was a time you showed empathy?
When was a time you worked with someone difficult, how did you handle it?
When was a time you had multiple things going on at once, and how did you manage them?
When was a time you missed a deadline?

title: Research Study Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions:
I was referred by an internal candidate who is currently an RSA in a different department. First I spoke to HR for about 10min via phone (this part was slightly nervewrecking because it caught me off guard) - she set me up with an in-person HR interview which went very well. My interviewer was super nice and personable.  She then set me up for an interview with possible colleagues and I interviewed with 2 coordinators and the manager - all very nice and asked some very good questions, mostly about my previous research experience and my interest in research, also on how I would handle certain situations (deadlines, a coworker trying to pass off work to you, other departments not getting data to you on time etc.).  They seemed pretty pleased with most of my responses which made me feel a little more at ease.  That same day HR called me and said they wanted to check my references - they were all complete by the end of the week and about a week and 1/2 later HR called me again to let me know I was being offered the position! Overall a very pleasant experience from start to finish with all interviewers - each one even responded to my thank you emails and were very receptive to any other questions I had.  Overall process until accepting/signing papers took about 1 month.

Post-acceptance, HR was also very receptive to working with me to schedule all pre-employment necessities (I was in and out of town) which was much appreciated!
Interview Questions: What was your favorite class (graduate degree)? What are you most proud of on your resume? Where do you see yourself in 5-10 years?

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions:
First and foremost you should get someone to refer you. It is a lot easier to get hired this way. They usually hire new rounds of session assistants every 3 - 4 months (sometimes even sooner) so always check with your inside connect.

After you complete the online application you will have to go on 3 ~ 4 interviews in this order usually:

Interview 1: Usually someone from HR. 
- He will usually ask you general questions regarding the position such as your past working experience, how did you hear about the job, etc.

Interview 2: Usually 2 Clinical Practice Supervisor leaders
- Very easy going interview that ask you more specific questions regarding who you are, past experience, and resume

Interview 3: Usually a Administrative Manager 
- At this point you're pretty good. Just reiterate what you said in your prior interviews and act professional.
Interview Questions: Questions vary depending on your resume. Make sure you review your cover letter and resume before going to the interview.

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, MO)
Interview Descriptions: It's mainly dependent on your previous research. Very academic.
Interview Questions: Not really.

title: Research Study Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, heard from a Talent Acquisition Specialist about a month after.  Scheduled and interview with the Clinical Research Manager.  Interview went well, I left feeling good.  Was told I would hear back within 10-14 days and have not heard anything three weeks after.  I sent a follow up email and am awaiting a reply.
Interview Questions: Nothing difficult.  Mostly questions about my resume and maybe 1-3 behavioral type questions.

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Less than a week after applying for the position, I was contacted by phone by HR. We had a very pleasant discussion about the position and what I was looking for in an employer. After about 10 minutes she asked me to come in and speak to her in person, which took place about three days later. It was one-on-one with a talent acquisition specialist and very informal; she looked over my resume and asked me what areas I was interested in. She also explained the administrative side of the position; salary, vacation time, benefits and the hiring process. It went very well and she told me she would submit my resume to the departments I was interested in and I would hear if they were interested in me.

Less than a week later, I was contacted by the clinical research coordinator of the department. She asked me if I could come in the same day for an interview (we spoke about 10 am and set the interview for 3pm), which I did.  That interview was with two people, the CRC and the clinical research manager. It was more formal than HR but not overwhelmingly so. They asked typical questions; why do you want the position, where do you see yourself in 5 years, that kind of stuff. They do ask for a two year commitment so be aware of that. The interview went well, and I was told that they would make a decision within a week.

Three days later the CRC contacted me again for an interview with the Service Chief in the department. That interview was very short and seemed like the physician in charge just wanted to make sure he knew who would be working for him, because he didn't ask me anything that hadn't been covered by the first two interviews. An hour after I left, HR called with an offer for the position.

They do perform an extremely thorough background check, so be prepared to let your references know to expect a phone call.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to come in to work early, late, on weekends or in inclement weather if necessary?

title: Research Study Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I first did a Skype Interview with HR (I applied through my school's job portal). They asked behavioral questions. Two months later, I was contacted my HR again and they asked me to come to the site. I interviewed with three supervisors from three different services/departments (2 in person, and 1 over the phone). One supervisor then asked me to come back to conduct three additional interviews (2 with doctors, 1 with a different supervisor). Those interviews were more job specific and they did a lot more explaining than asking me questions.
Interview Questions: How would you handle conflict with a coworker?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application through a job recruiter that came to my University. She called me back right away after having met me at the job fair. Then for two months I did not hear back and called numerous times to find out she had quit her job as a recruiter and I had to start my process all over again. Eventually when I did get an interview it was 3-part interview, first over the phone to check my fluency of Spanish. When I passed that I had two more interviews with 4 different people.
Interview Questions: Why do you feel that patients would feel comfortable with you?

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with 4 people from HR, took a typing assessment test as well. They asked numerous questions about past experience, difficult situations and how I would handle them etc.
Interview Questions: How to handle difficult patients, how you would interact with someone with cancer and similar questions like this.

title: Physcin Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was very smooth and everyone here was very helpful and nice. A very nice environment and made me very comfortable. I would recommend people for this plce. It is the Best place to work.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Started as traveling nurse interview in person with manager of the Urgent care. As a traveling nurse I got very familiar with the hospital and decided I wanted to become staff.
Interview Questions: What makes you want to become staff member?

title: Environmental Aid Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: My interview started through a temp agency called custom staffing the interview went good basically they ran you through all of the products and chemicals you would be working with at the same time they told us if we would come into work everyday we would get a better chance to be hired i didn't think that was true because I was there everyday and other coworkers of mine missed days,weeks and they got hired.
Interview Questions: The most difficult thing was getting to know customers knowing they would not be here the next day and as for unexpected questions I had none.

title: Laboratory Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Filled in a general job application form and then met with someone from HR. Was then referred to the lab manager for an interview. After the interview, was sent information to do an online reference check.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Immunology?

title: Client Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (Rockville Centre, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Very basic. I was overqualified so maybe that was why. Everyone seemed normal.  I was kept waiting for about 20 minutes, which I learned happened to every single person scheduled to meet with the Manager (if not 20 min then up to 1 hour. very disrespectful).
Interview Questions: Why MSK?

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions:
A lot of scenario based questions about problem solving. Have a lot of work experience from previous jobs based on customer service, and how you helped customers during difficult encounters. You will meet with an HR representative, and then if they like you, you will be interviewed by upper management. Usually two managers will interview at once, and alternate questions. Have knowledge of the hospital, and it's accomplishments. They will ask why you want to work there, and what you see yourself doing in the future.
Remember to stay calm, and be approachable. The biggest requirement for this job is that the patients like you, and that you make them feel comfortable. So a huge part of the process is that they like you as a person.
After the interview, they said they would contact me within the week. But they called me the same day to offer me the position.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you made a mistake and how you fixed it..

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I met with HR and had an interview first then was called back a week later and met with three supervisors in the same day. I had a tour of the building and met some other session assistants. I got a call that same day and was offered the job.
Interview Questions: What are my strong qualities?

title: Senior Unix Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (Lyndhurst, NJ) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone call screen followed up by an in person interview.. all standard.
Interview Questions: They didn't waste my time asking silly questions. They got right to the point and asked relevant questions that determined if I could do the job or not.

title: Administrative Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions:
2 step interview, I first met with the recruiter for the HR department. Did a typing test to check for accuracy and speed.

After passing the test, I then met with the Volunteer Director for a face to face interview.
Interview Questions: Was it difficult finding the location?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: i found this job online through a staffing agency.  I met with the recruiter at the staffing agency and then was passed along to meet with an internal recruiter.  The following day I met with the department administrative coordinators and finally the administrative manager.  The whole process took about two weeks.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Chat with the PI about previous experience, future plans, scientific interests. Tour of the lab, discussion about the project I was likely to be responsible for. Discuss about grant applications.
Interview Questions: Explain previous projects and experience.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with the HR and she asked pretty easy questions like: What do you want to do after 5 years? Why have you applied to MSKCC? After that I had a video interview with her as well and she explained me about the working hours and the salary.(which was low as per my expectations) Later, I had an interview with the PI of the lab which was not even close to a typical interview. He explained me what kind of work I will be doing and what research they carry out. He just asked me only one or two questions regarding my future goals and if I would like to go ahead with the job. He made me meet his lab members who were all very warm and friendly. I felt I had almost got the job but in vain! They got someone more experienced than me, that is what the HR said. But later she said she will get back to me for any more job openings in any labs.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply to MSKCC?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was short and very personal. My boss just asked about school, career expectations, internship expectations, and social life. Not too much involved here since I was referred about an employee. I got to talk to CTO.
Interview Questions: Q: What are your career expectations?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by HR via phone where I was asked a few questions. The HR Rep was very pleasant and helpful in scheduling the interviews for the RSA position. I then had the first and second round of  interviews within a week, one meeting with the managers and the other meeting with the potential coworkers and the coordinator. The interviews consisted of the normal questions, i.e. "Where do you see yourself in 5 years?" and "How would your current boss describe you?" Unfortunately, I was not offered the position but the HR rep was willing to set me up with interviews for other vacant positions. Overall, I had a positive experience interviewing at MSKCC.
Interview Questions: What words would your friends use to describe you?

title: Postdoctoral Research Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was a well organized process that was directed through the laboratory PI's office. I spent two days in NYC (hotel paid for by the lab PI) and met with all laboratory members. On the second day, I gave a seminar to the entire department as well as a follow-up chalk-talk/Q&A session with the PI and lab members. They got back to me in a timely manner. I was offered a position. I accepted immediately.
Interview Questions: What are your career goals?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Just asked one or two really basic questions. Was with a recruiter and only took a few minutes. Just be prepared.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume via school, the HR contacts me to schedule the first interview, and do the online application. Get a second phone interview right after talking to HR, and talk with two team members over the phone for about 30min. Invited to onsite interview next day, meeting with HR first, and sitting with all the group member and supervisor for a group interview. After the onsite interview, it took about 4 week to hear back from them, with no offer. Really sad as I am looking forward to this one.
Interview Questions: tell me an analytic project you do

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Asked questions about resume and qualifications as well as past experience. Had to explain why I am interested in the position and why I think I would be a good candidate for the job. Asked about familiarity with the field and with the software programming that I would be using in the job. Explained a lot about what is expected of the position and how it is different from other roles. Interviewer told what the mission of the office is and what the research goal is as well as provided some background on why the research is being done.
Interview Questions: What is the best statistical analysis software to use ?

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: As usual for postdoctoral interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Application, followed by two interview rounds.
Interview Questions: Detailed ten year plan

title: Animal Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is pretty simple. You first have a one on one with the director of the program, he looks over your resume to make sure you have some relevant experience with animals. Not too many questions were asked aside from you being aware of euthanasia and if you are comfortable with that. There is also the typical "Why do you want to work for us?" question. Part two of the interview is actually a tour of the research facility, which is pretty impressive to say the least. Everyone I spoke with and was introduced to was very friendly and kind. You should be aware though that if you are given the position you won't actually be starting work for a few weeks. You have to be medically cleared, meaning they make sure you have all your immunity shots, and you are also tested for any other things they deem necessary in accordance to that particular facility.
Interview Questions: Do you know what euthanasia is?

title: Grad Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: the school interview is really easy, only need to meet 3 PI, they took us to broadway for a show and dinner at time square, the hotel is amazing, they pick us up in the airport with a special driver. really awesome
Interview Questions: what do you want to do in science

title: Senior Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very formal and intense. Although it lasted for 2 hours it seemed more or less like an interrogation than an interview. The staff in his department or primarily under the age of 30 a
Interview Questions: How do you feel working with young people

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions:
I submitted my resume online in September, and was contacted via phone by one of their Talent Specialists about 3 weeks later.  The phone interview took just a few minutes.  He scheduled an in-person interview with me later that week.  There were two entry-level positions for which he was recruiting: Session Assistant and Physician's Assistant.  I had to take a test beforehand which took about 50 minutes.  It consisted of word problems and simple math questions, and then there was a personality test.  The word problems/math questions were pretty easy, I think you only have to get 30% correct (there were more questions than you are expected to answer) to pass (and it was assessed on a pass/fail basis).

I was pretty disappointed by the overall process.  I came in at 8am for for the testing, but didn't get to speak with the interview until 9:50am or so, and the interview took all of 15 minutes.  He didn't seem very interested in speaking with me, and only asked me a few questions.  He asked me again why I was interested in healthcare, and then asked me (1) for one example where I displayed extraordinary customer service, and (2) one example where I participated in a group activity.
Interview Questions: Give one example of when you have showed exceptional customer service

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: It takes a frustrating 4-5 months to land a job here.  They say its a fresh out of school position but wont consider unless you have a Bachelors or Masters degree in a related field. Most of my peers also were frustrated with this. Employees usually stay here for about 10 months, after the mandatory 6 month probation period and then use up their vacation time and get out. Worst kind of Micro-mgmt from CRCs and Clinical Research Managers, and this is the usual culture and not a specific personality disorder, as the Managers have either been there for too long for obvious reasons or they leave knowing that this is a position no idiot should accept in the first place. There was even a HR survey done a few years ago shown to Research Managers as to why there was a 10 month average timeline of a clinical research staff member to stay here.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: They are very serious about being prompt for the interview so always get there on time.  I got there at 9:03 for a 9AM interview (the Potus) was in town and I got stuck in traffic.  As soon as I arrived the young lady at the front desk wrote down the time  I arrived and circled it.   The interviewer was very nice and the questions were basic, i.e. tell me about yourself, what made you decide to get into health care?  He looked over my resume and said he felt I would be a better fit for another position (however there were no openings).  Before I left I told him I was interested in the session assistant position but he kept pushing me towards an administrative position which would have been fine if one was available.  I was told a recruiter would call me about the admin position...that was a week ago I have heard nothing since.  I was very upset.
Interview Questions: Give me one example where you had to provide exceptional customer service?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Contacted by HR rep. Scheduled the interview for the following week. Met with two people in the department and then with HR. 

The department interview consisted of many fit questions such as how do you handle deadlines and stress and why do you want to work here.
Interview Questions: Have you ever missed a deadline and how did you handle it?

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews one with HR and the other with two former Session Assistants. The second interview tests your ability to perform the job and how well you handle stress. There were about 15 to 20 questions in this interview that takes around 1.5 to 2 hours. Since this job interacts with patients on a daily basis some of the questions are difficult and are meant to be a challenge.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about interacting with patients (often critically ill) on a daily basis?

title: Strategic Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume and within 3 days I received a phone interview. A week later, I went to NYC to interview in person. great atmosphere and I was asked the standard behavioral questions. The person who interviewed me then showed me around the center and gave me a walkthrough as to what my responsibilities would be if hired
Interview Questions: What are your future plans and what do you want to do in this field?

title: Post Doctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: The communication was directly with the PI. I was scheduled for a talk. I had the day talking to the lab members. After having the day with short interviews with the lab members, I wrapped up with the PI where I was kind of given an offer. We finalize everything over email though.
Interview Questions: There were not specific questions. Presentation talk about my previous research work. Normal questions about my project.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: I had 2 separate interviews which seems to be the minimum.  I know people who had 3 separate interviews before they were hired.  I was not referred by anyone working there but most of my coworkers were referred by employees.
Interview Questions: I was asked about relevant work experience. Type of unit or patient population I was interested in.

title: I S Audit Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: For an I.S. Audit Manager position, there were 8 separate interviews.  Each interview asked behavioral questions.  I was asked a few application and general controls questions only in one of the interviews.
Interview Questions: Give me an example when one of your staff members did not like the project he/she was on.  What did you do about it?

title: Entertainment Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was hired and interviewed over the phone and had all my presentation and sales materials on the Internet. I have since obtained 24 contracted jobs from Sloan Kettering and they have been wonderful every single time. In fact, when my Dad got diagnosed with Cancer, the lovely lady that hired me helped me connect my Dad with a solid doctor to help him. My experience all around has been fantastic and I'm doing an event with them again the summer of 2015. YAY!
Interview Questions: Everything I was asked was relevant to my profession and easy for me to answer. AND it was many many years ago so I don't remember struggling with anything.

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: I filled out paper application upon arrival - waited for about twenty minutes or so and then saw the interviewer. Interviewer was very easy to talk to. Asked general questions about school and past experiences how you went about picking your major, how you dealt with obstacles in the past, how you show leadership, dealing with patients, what do you consider a good quality about yourself, etc
Interview Questions: Why did you pick your major

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a nurse manager and several nurses specialists. They asked me about my past experiences, why nursing and why MSKCC. Then several questions about problem solving: co-workers, patients, etc. Also several specific questions about nursing. They were very knowledgeable, but also very friendly.
Interview Questions: How would you handled a angry patient?

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: Posted resume online, recruited contacted me the next week. Phone interview a couple days later, and another two days later. The interviewers were very nice and made the process pleasant. Offered me to fly to amazon, but then realized I did not have enough professional experience for the position.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very intensive; they schduled to see 14 sceitists from 9am to 4pm. There were a lots of specific questions related to a job; 1:1 interview or ground interview or having lunch with group members. Be positve and motivated, and ask some questions to show you to be nice and impressive.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Session Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: I initially had a phone interview with a very lovely woman. I then was brought in to meet with an HR representative. He was a little cold/sterile and I later learned he rarely passed people on to the next phase. I was then brought in for a third interview to meet with a Practice Leader at a different location. She was dressed in VERY business casual attire (fovus on "casual"). It was much more conversational and less interview-like. I was offered the position two days later.
Interview Questions: How would you handle an angry or upset patient? Knowing that they are dealing with a terminal illness?

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with this guy name Chris, horrible experience he did not like me at all. I applied again for the job hoping i would get someone else the recuriter on the phone told me i would interview with chris again. I wasn't thriled about that. but i went with a positive mind and he told me "i wasted my time by coming there"
Interview Questions: why health care

title: Senior Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: I moved here with a lab but in that lab my interview process was pretty standard as it would be in an academic setting. There was a full day of meeting with post docs and PI's and I had to give a talk on my research. There were questions specific to my research.
Interview Questions: Do you think your SVM is overfitting on the data and that is why you get good training results but bad results on actual data?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: The process was relatively pain-free. We started by establishing expectations (like all we'll be working on and the type of credit/satisfaction we'll receive). We discussed work ethics and team compatibility and arrived to a offer a few hours after the interview. It took a while to go through HR but nonetheless a painless process.
Interview Questions: How well do you work on your own?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was an internal candidate seeking an opportunity to gain staff management experience. I first Interviewed with the Administrative Manager and then the Department Administrator approximately one week later. After a period of about one to two weeks following my second interview, I was contacted by the recruiter with an offer.
Interview Questions: How would you earn the respect of your staff?

title: Bioinformatics Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview. Mostly had to meet with people. I have a phd so for most phds u have the academic interview with seminar and one on one meeting during a full day. Most people are nice and the interview is determined a lot by the hiring managers liking or disliking you. So that said, there were no trick questions so that was okay.
Interview Questions: None. It was all about your work experience and what you have done and what projects you worked on in the past

title: Accounting Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: Normal interview procedure.  Meet with the head of the department.  30 min interview.  Ask the normal questions.  Nothing technical.  Very smart man.  Great hospital to work for.  will pay for any education you want.  Will help you out a lot.  They have a great mission.  No better.  I meet only great people there.
Interview Questions: What are your future goals?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call from a HR person about my resume which I had submitted almost 3 months earlier. I was asked a few simple questions about my academic experience and career goals and why I was interested in working there. Then I was asked to come in to an interview in person at the HR department. Again, simple questions about my college experience and career goals. The HR person then said they would see if any research managers had needs that fit my interests. Overall the interview was easy, though very vague as I wasn't actually speaking with a person I would be working with.
Interview Questions: Why did you chose to go to your college? Why did you chose your major?

title: Physician Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Dec 2009
Interview Descriptions: submiited resume through school, phone interview 1 month later, face to face one week later with HR, scheduled with dept's managers/administrators and then met with physicians. took about a month
Interview Questions: whats your greatest weakness?  other basic Qs

title: Administrative Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview where they ask your about your interest and where you see yourself in the future. Had a interview with HR where they ask about why Healthcare and have you talk about previous jobs. A week later met with four managers in a series of one on one interviews. There were situational questions and informal oral personality test at the end.
Interview Questions: What sort of role would you like to have in healthcare in the near future?

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: They ask a lot about why you want to work in health care, if you make it sound personal they are more understanding of your desire to work in the industry
Interview Questions: most questions were pretty typical, strengths, weaknesses, etc

title: Medical Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: After a skill test of typing, transcription and dictation. Interview with HR, very fast interview. Then its off to the facility where I met with two assistant managers, once if they like you, you go to interview with the doctor and sometimes his staff.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years.

title: Session Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jul 2008
Interview Descriptions: My resume was forward to the human resources department and a few days later I got a call.  At that point, there was a ten minute phone interview.  From there, I was brought in to meet with a human resources representative in person.  That same day, I met with three different managers to interview with each of them.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a co-worker of yours was being exceptionally lazy or not doing his/her job?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2008
Interview Descriptions: I was first interviewed via phone by HR of MSKCC.  The interviewer was a very pleasant lady and the entire conversation lasted about 15 minutes.  Next I was interviewed by another HR interviewer, but face to face this time.  This one was a bit tougher and the interviewer asked me a couple of questions that took me a minute to reply to.
Interview Questions: Why did you pick your major?  What are your future plans and what do you want to do in this field?

title: Research Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (New York, NY) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: Must use on-line application process, be sure to include cover page and CV in addition to answering the on-line application questions. First interview was via phone by an HR representative, the second interview was with a panal of staff members from each departmental area, there were 7 people in total for individual meetings and then a group interview with 4 other employees from outside the department. Second and final follow up interview lead to the offer. People were professional and intelligent and curteous but questions were specific to the job at hand so knowing your area of expertise is important.
Interview Questions: Provide specific examples of times when something went wrong or not as planned and how you handled it at the time, the outcome and what you would have done differently.
